description: About GlovoWe‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Africa and Asia. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.Our vision and ambition are not only to give everyone easy access to everything in their city, but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.Your Work-life OpportunityIn order to maximize value for our partner restaurants and our customers, our Food Innovation team is innovating around new food concepts designed from scratch and optimized for delivery.Glovo is creating the next generation of food delivery brands. These brands are designed by Glovo using customer feedback to provide the best user experience to our customers. These brands are operated by our partners (restaurants working with Glovo) through a franchising model where we create the brand, take care of the marketing, take care of the supply chain and train their chefs so they just have to cook while we help them grow their top line!You will be responsible for managing our Food Lab where we are creating and testing those new generation delivery brands that will be scaled to more than 800 cities around the world. The successful candidate must be passionate and action-oriented professional with know-how of kitchen operations.Do you want to evolve into one of the fastest growing Start-ups of Barcelona, building a product that will change people's day-to-day and disrupt the on-demand market?Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will Hire and manage a team of talented chefs that will be responsible for operating our new developed food concepts while having the team engaged and with a good working environment. Supervise the maintenance of the working environment ensuring a high health and safety standards across our kitchen and our team of chefs. Be responsible for updating and owning our Lab P&L, assuring an optimal number of resources with the responsibility to keep our lab efficient and profitable. Be in charge of our lab operations to assure we are nailing every step of the process and give the best delivery experience our users can think of. Be responsible for the successful launching process of more than 15 new brands in the next 18 months with a very short time to market, assuring an unbeatable user experience from day one. You Have +5 years of experience in managing high daily volume restaurants or involved in the kitchen/food operations sector Hands-on attitude: you‚Äôll have to roll up your sleeves! Ability to to prioritise and multitask, work well under pressure with aggressive deadlines and in a fast changing environment Experience in leading teams of at least 10 people having the necessary skills to keep them engaged and motivated Proactive, organized, and obsessed with details Comfortable on working with health and food safety best practices Out of the box thinker and high level of self-initiative (proactive in finding new solutions to new issues) Comfortable working with limited resources under tight deadlines Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits Enticing Phantom Shares plan Attractive Relocation package (if applicable ;)) Comprehensive Private Health Insurance Cobee discounts on kindergarten, transportation, and food Free monthly Glovo credits to spend on our restaurant products (and zero Glovo delivery fee on all Glovo orders!) Cool perks such as fresh fruit and healthy snacks every day, beers on Fridays, the Glovo Festival every quarter! Discounted Gym memberships Flexible working environment What You‚Äôll Find When Working At Glovo Gas: We work hard with energy and passion for what we do. Care: We act in the best interest of a sustainable future. Good vibes: We always see the positive side in every situation and act with fairness and honesty with everyone. Stay Humble: We embrace mistakes and feedback to learn from them. Glownership: We roll up our sleeves and get work done no matter our position and level. If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!At Glovo we believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. As of 2020, we‚Äôre currently present in more than 22 countries across Europe, Latin America, Africa, and Asia.For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://about.glovoapp.com/
industry: Marketing y publicidad,Software,Internet

Intracon is an international marketing agency with more than 20 years of experience that helps B2B/2C companies to transform the way that they do business, by achieving their goals with customer-oriented creative and professional solutions. We create impactful training, consulting, events, multimedia content, or a blend of these services. We make an impact on our client¬¥s audience and effect change - no matter the industry or size.We are currently looking for an experienced IT Product Owner with an agile mindset and great management skills to provide service to one of our main clients, the American Multinational Technological Company Hewlett-Packard (HP), which is the world's leading personal systems and printing company. You will be part of a reinventor team, which is constantly innovating and moves at the speed of curiosity for what tomorrow holds.  About the role: As an IT Product Owner, you will be responsible for setting, prioritizing, and accepting the work generated by the team (across different time zones) to ensure the most valuable and proper functionality of the product. The role also involves scheduling and leading meetings to identify product issues, determining roadmaps for products and managing daily goals and schedules to achieve high performance and meet project deadlines.Dedication: Full-timeLocation: In remote from homeProject¬¥s length: 6 months (maternity leave) So, are you ready to step up to a challenge? üöÄWhat you will do: Be the focal point to consolidate business IT requirements and provide guidance to quickly enable new business models.Create, plan, prioritize and manage IT-related backlog.Manage ERP development team for new business enablement efforts: Planning, Reviews, Retrospective, etc.Enable communication between business and IT key stakeholders.Coordinate worldwide teams across different time zones (Europe & USA) What we expect from you:University degree with technical background You have Project Management experience (at least 5 years)Scrum master and/or Product Owner certified.You have an Agile mindset, flexible and able to adapt to project changes.You are fluent in English, and Spanish if possible.Previous exposure to SAP/ERP processes.Proficient in MS Office (Excel, Access, Word etc.)Familiarity with modern database and information system technologiesYou are a team player with previous experience coordinating different teamsExcellent communication and collaboration skills If you are meet the standards, please do not hesitate to apply. We will be pleased to know you! üôè **Please, note that, due to the amount of CVs that we receive, only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. However, we want to thank all applicants for their interest and time.**

description: Summary of the roleIn the complex world of payments, we want to simplify the picture. description: XING is the social network for business professionals with millions of members all over the world. Help us shape the future ‚Äì for a better working life!  We currently have different openings  in Barcelona for a QA Automation.  Join us and be a driver for the software and processes quality at XING! We value the art of continuous improvement. Agile testers work directly within the development teams and are our voice of quality and continuous improvement. They play an active part in releasing the software to our end users, and they help to understand the end-user perspective. Agile testers share the improvements and lessons learned with the company, for a better-working software. Popular technologies and tools like Ruby on Rails, Java, Kotlin, Kafka, Jenkins, Calabash, Cypress,... are used.   A challenging taskWork inside the cross-functional agile teams, closely cooperating with developers, product owners, scrum masters and other stakeholders Contribute throughout the product development lifecycle: from product planning to releasing to production and monitoring the live environments Use testing infrastructure, data and tools to perform manual, exploratory and automated testing. Help the team towards their journey of test automation.  Make quality issues and concerns visible and help others understand the risks and impacts to our end users Propose improvements of our processes to be able to deliver higher quality software on time Highly tech-diverse environment with Backend, Frontend and Native App testing responsibilities   A convincing backgroundYou must be elegible to work in the European Union, the Company will not Sponsorship Visas or Work Permits You are motivated and experienced test engineer with very good communication skills You have a solid experience with automated testing. You also have manual testing experience. You are organized and value attention to detail.  Some experience with Ruby and Rails, version control systems (e.g. Git) and continuous integration (e.g. Jenkins) is a plus Knowledge in SQL databases, ideally MySQL and API‚Äôs Proficient English speaking in a working environment (German language not required, but nice to have) Agile experience (Scrum or Kanban) and/or experience with backend testing (including REST services) is a plus  An inspiring place to workCheck our Twitter account! https://twitter.com/NewWork_es Training, conferences and many opportunities to learn, experiment and grow. Innovation weeks (Hackweeks) Flexible working hours and remote flexibility Restaurant tickets, coffee and snacks. Spanish / English/ German lessons. A mobile device of your choice (iPhone, iPad, Android‚Ä¶). A great, multicultural and diverse environment. A sunny office located in the centre of Barcelona, with a large terrace. Flexible Compensation Plan: Health insurance/ Transport/ Nursery Tickets Extended holidays Competitive salary and a Permanent contract Bicycle park and package reception Relocation pack if needed.   We're looking forward to hearing from you!

description: About GlovoWe‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Africa and Asia. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.Our vision and ambition are not only to give everyone easy access to everything in their city, but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.Your Work-life OpportunityIn order to maximize value for our partner restaurants and our customers, our Food Innovation team is innovating around new food concepts designed from scratch and optimized for delivery.Glovo is creating the next generation of food delivery brands. These brands are designed by Glovo using customer feedback to provide the best user experience to our customers. These brands are operated by our partners (restaurants working with Glovo) through a franchising model where we create the brand, take care of the marketing, take care of the supply chain and train their chefs so they just have to cook while we help them grow their top line!You will be responsible for managing our Food Lab where we are creating and testing those new generation delivery brands that will be scaled to more than 800 cities around the world. The successful candidate must be passionate and action-oriented professional with know-how of kitchen operations.Do you want to evolve into one of the fastest growing Start-ups of Barcelona, building a product that will change people's day-to-day and disrupt the on-demand market?Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will Hire and manage a team of talented chefs that will be responsible for operating our new developed food concepts while having the team engaged and with a good working environment. Supervise the maintenance of the working environment ensuring a high health and safety standards across our kitchen and our team of chefs. Be responsible for updating and owning our Lab P&L, assuring an optimal number of resources with the responsibility to keep our lab efficient and profitable. Be in charge of our lab operations to assure we are nailing every step of the process and give the best delivery experience our users can think of. Be responsible for the successful launching process of more than 15 new brands in the next 18 months with a very short time to market, assuring an unbeatable user experience from day one. You Have +5 years of experience in managing high daily volume restaurants or involved in the kitchen/food operations sector Hands-on attitude: you‚Äôll have to roll up your sleeves! Ability to to prioritise and multitask, work well under pressure with aggressive deadlines and in a fast changing environment Experience in leading teams of at least 10 people having the necessary skills to keep them engaged and motivated Proactive, organized, and obsessed with details Comfortable on working with health and food safety best practices Out of the box thinker and high level of self-initiative (proactive in finding new solutions to new issues) Comfortable working with limited resources under tight deadlines Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits Enticing Phantom Shares plan Attractive Relocation package (if applicable ;)) Comprehensive Private Health Insurance Cobee discounts on kindergarten, transportation, and food Free monthly Glovo credits to spend on our restaurant products (and zero Glovo delivery fee on all Glovo orders!) Cool perks such as fresh fruit and healthy snacks every day, beers on Fridays, the Glovo Festival every quarter! Discounted Gym memberships Flexible working environment What You‚Äôll Find When Working At Glovo Gas: We work hard with energy and passion for what we do. Care: We act in the best interest of a sustainable future. Good vibes: We always see the positive side in every situation and act with fairness and honesty with everyone. Stay Humble: We embrace mistakes and feedback to learn from them. Glownership: We roll up our sleeves and get work done no matter our position and level. If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!At Glovo we believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. As of 2020, we‚Äôre currently present in more than 22 countries across Europe, Latin America, Africa, and Asia.For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://about.glovoapp.com/

description: About the job We are looking for an Accounts Receivable Specialist who will work with the Finance Team. Overseeing billing operations and processes to ensure collection of account balances will be your duty.  This role, based in our Elche (Alicante) office, will be reporting directly to our Chief Financial Officer. You will:  Process accounts receivable transactions. Continuous evaluation of current policies and recommendations for process improvements. Handle sensitive information in a confidential manner. Provide support for internal and external audits. Prepare cash receipts for processing. Perform account reconciliations in a timely and accurate manner. Manage collection efforts and associated functions What are we looking for? You are someone with interest in who has a knack for numbers, is very outcome oriented, and has strong prioritization skills, who wants to be part of a team.  At minimum, a degree in Accounting or related field. 1-2 years of experience with collections, invoicing, and/or accounts receivable. Proficient in Microsoft Office applications. Knowledge of GAAP and basic accounting principles. Strong attention to detail with a dedication to accuracy. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to analyze large sets of data. High degree of familiarity with accounts receivable functions. Experience in Microsoft Dynamics AX will be highly valued. Why would you love to join us? We are an international brand in a path for success. We have that start-up vibe where anything is possible. A revolution is happening in the fashion industry and we want to be a major player in the years to come. A very welcoming atmosphere and a very nice office where you can develop your full potential. A chance to gain real world experience really fast and set your career to new heights if you share our ambition. Work hard. Play hard. A flexible schedule so you can have a clear mind to focus on your goals. What‚Äôs our culture like:  üöÄ Be prepared to perform from day one. üí° Share your ideas. Critical thinking. üîÆVision is everything. Always see what is coming no matter what it comes. üåüWinwin mindset ü§ìTransparency. Be Authentic üíØ Feedback. Fast, Honest and Direct. We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent people from all walks of life (variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills). All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. Feel like this job is for you?  Can't wait to meet you! üëãüèª

description: Position Summary     An exciting opportunity has arisen to be part of the Support Team based in Barcelona.  Successful candidates will be given full product training.  The Junior EAM Technical Support Analyst provides support to customers, answering questions on technical and functional usage of product via the telephone and/or Internet; and conveys customer feedback to the product development staff. This position serves as primary support liaison between company and customer in a highly team oriented environment.     Key Responsibilities     ‚Ä¢ Serves as primary support liaison between company and customer and documents incidents in required tracking systems.  ‚Ä¢ Proactively keeps customer informed of how and when problems are resolved with focus on retention and reference ability.  ‚Ä¢ Involved in any additional follow up, testing and troubleshooting including remote desktop viewing through tools such as WebEx.  ‚Ä¢ Responsible for appropriate referral to other support analysts, provides feedback to Development with guidance from mentor (more senior analysts) and liaises with other Departments.  ‚Ä¢ Focuses on developing knowledge in specific product suite or operating environments.  ‚Ä¢ Contributes information to the Support knowledge base.  ‚Ä¢ Manages workload effectively following Support Procedures.  ‚Ä¢ Chat response.      Key Requirements/Experience     ‚Ä¢ Graduated in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering.  ‚Ä¢ Able to perform basic queries against a database, understanding sql codes  ‚Ä¢ Previous experience working on Support  ‚Ä¢ Languages: Fluent French or German and fluent in English.  ‚Ä¢ Good problem solving and analytic skills.  ‚Ä¢ Team player with the ability to build strong peer and interpersonal relationships.  ‚Ä¢ Good writing and editing skills.  ‚Ä¢ Strong organizational and problem solving skills.  ‚Ä¢ Able to provide oral and written communication that effectively articulates complex ideas.  ‚Ä¢ User of Microsoft Office applications  ‚Ä¢ Previous experience on Enterprise Asset Management software.  ‚Ä¢ Oracle server, Java, Apache, Jboss, xml, traces, network.        Infor employees have:   A sense      of urgency - Conduct your work with intensity and      speed. Huddle fast. Make fact-based decisions. Use good judgment.  Keeping the initiatives moving.  Repeat.  A      passion for customer success ‚Äì Be      responsive. Follow through on promises. Reject mediocrity. Be obsessive      about doing better. Be accessible and communicate proactively. Be      selfless.  Work as One Infor.  A      thirst for innovation ‚Äì Be curious. Be a change agent.  Some ideas will prove out, and other      will not.  Fail fast.  Iterate.       Stay ahead of technology.  A focus      on results - Never ignore results and facts.      Learn and adjust. Focus on quality in all that you do. Do more of what      works; less of what is not working. Invest your time in value      creation.  Act like an owner with an      adaptive, entrepreneurial spirit.  A sense      of community - Show compassion and caring for      others. Be socially responsible. Be inclusive.         The information above is not complete and may change once joining Infor in future but this is a guide of the overall role. Please find further information here: http://www.infor.com/     If you recognize yourself in this description and are interested in joining us to build the future of our company, please apply.  Due to the high volume of applications we receive, if you do not hear back from us in 2 weeks‚Äô time, please consider your submission declined.

description: Territory Development Executive - Direct Sales - EstancosGalaxy Connect is a distributor in the rapidly growing market for e-cigarettes and vaping products in Spain. Replenish stock directly from the van in stores.Proper handling of the vehicle and the company's work tools.Follow the rules and procedures using the reporting and administration systems. Have a clear follow-up of the sales results and reports.Maintain a high level of knowledge of products and services, as well as market trends and competition. Money management and bank deposits.Working hours determined by store opening hours (estimated 40 hours per week)Attend training sessions and training sessions. Hold telematic commercial meetings with the commercial team and with management.The ideal candidate:Native fluency level in Spanish or Catalan and a proficient level in EnglishA competitive spirit and a passion for sales.Solid track record in the sales and stock management sector.An attitude focused on objectives and results.A firm and self-paced work style with clear signs of leadership.Attention to detail and sales report. Excellent money and deposit management.Professional image and attitude with the ability to interact with large accounts.Excellent communication, interpersonal and negotiation skills.Advanced understanding of computer science and office tools.Full and clean driver's license.Motivation to visit accounts and develop long-term customer relationships.We offer:We offer: An attractive basic salary up to ‚Ç¨ 20,000 per year (depending on experience) + ‚Ç¨ 5000 Commission in remuneration according to the objectives and OTE. Promotion opportunities, in-house training, a company van, and all the sales equipment and literature needed to run the job function

description: KingEclient is a digital business consultancy focused in web/app services for International clients.We are part of the WPP International Group, if you are passionate about Digital services and Human Resources we invite you to consider our new job offer! description: Start Date: 12th JulyWe are looking for German Speaking Associates to join our project team, supporting our clients on interesting projects around the world. In 2021 we expect to grow significantly, seeing our revenues increase by 300%, and we need ambitious people to help us. The role is great for people who enjoy learning, communicating, and building relationships and those who want to propel their career through hard work, early responsibilities, and teamwork. Based in the heart of Barcelona, you will be working with people from around Europe. We are looking for people we want to work with, who bring something different to the company and will help drive us forward.CompanyArbolus is changing the way businesses learn and retain knowledgeWe believe experience is worth sharing, so we set out to help people with experience share their experience easily with businesses. Today, Arbolus is the first platform that helps businesses build and work with networks of experts, advisors, and freelance consultants. Our product has been a big hit with global consulting firms (e.g. the big four) and Fortune 500 companies who use third parties to inform their business strategy. Based in London, we are a venture-backed scale-up with offices in Barcelona (our largest) and New York.RoleProject Associates help their clients build micro-networks around specific projectsProject Associates work with clients to help them build teams of experts and advisors around specific projects. This includes helping them use our platform‚Äôs tools to source their own experts as well as engaging experts on their behalf. The role involves:Understanding what your users are trying to achieveResearching their problemIdentifying people who can help with their problemEngaging those people and onboarding them onto the platformSupporting the customer and expert to build strong relationshipsOver time, the role evolves into user management and later an account management position as you build up stronger relationships with your clients. It can be challenging, at times reasonably demanding but also very rewarding from a learning and financial perspective.BenefitsArbolus is a high growth company that wants to reward people for their hard work and contributionCompetitive base-pay + bonusInternational exposureInfluence on the future of ArbolusGreat team & strong office culture2x annual retreats and regular socialsWork from home daysMacbook + moreWhat We‚Äôre Looking ForWe want to work with people who inspire usStrong academic background0-2 years experienceA proven entrepreneurial/commercial driveGreat communication skillsHigh emotional intelligenceAbility to challenge the status quoWe like to work with people who are:CuriousOutgoingHigh energyTake initiativeDriven

eDreams ODIGEO is one of the world's largest online travel companies and one of the largest European e-commerce businesses. Under its four leading online travel agency brands ‚Äì eDreams, GO Voyages, Opodo, Travellink, and the metasearch engine Liligo ‚Äì it offers the best deals in flights, hotels, cruises, car rental, dynamic packages, holiday packages and travel insurance to make travel easier, more accessible, and better value for the more than 18 million customers it serves worldwide. With a presence in 46 countries, the company has a team of over 1,200 professionals (www.edreamsodigeo.com). Travel is the largest e-commerce segment in the world and eDreams ODIGEO is at the heart of it.Over the last years, the company has truly transformed and is now known to be a real innovator in the travel industry. For example eDreams ODIGEO is the first travel company in the world to launch a subscription programme, like Amazon Prime or Spotify or Netflix in other industries. In addition, the company has industry leading customer satisfaction, high product quality and positive trends on revenue margins and stock price. In fact eDreams ODIGEO was the best performing stock worldwide in travel for the previous 5 years just prior to the outbreak of COVID-19, beating Expedia, Booking Holdings, Tripadvisor, Ctrip and all others. Looking towards the future the company is also looking for M&A targets to expand geographically and product/capabilities, all which offer also professional growth opportunities. More recently, eDreams ODIGEO has been one of the most resilient travel companies in the current COVID context: unlike most other travel companies, it has kept all its staff and invested in product development for the post-COVID recovery. eDreams had gained share during the COVID crisis and will emerge as an even stronger competitor.We are now looking for a Business Analyst for Prime, our subscription program. Prime is a truly innovative product and service. eDreams ODIGEO is the first company in the world to come up with a subscription programme for travel. It is still in its early days and yet has had huge success. It is the world‚Äôs largest travel discount program, the company‚Äôs top strategic initiative and one of the most transformative products in the travel industry.Key responsibilities:Responsible for execution of key analysis, being the data entry point for the business team and including taking ownership of the database from the business side. Understand the business needs, gather the data and present the key insights: ‚ÄúContribute to the Prime strategic roadmap with numbers‚ÄùElaborate business cases to support strategic product decisions: e.g. should we include more ‚Äúbenefits‚Äù into the program? what is the profitability of a free-trial? contribute to the Prime strategic roadmap with numbersCreate dashboards and tracking: master the internal Business Intelligence tools to contribute to the monitoring and tracking of our business KPIs. Work with data engineering and data science teams to be able to leverage all our internal dataContribute to the delivery of the Prime strategic projects: participate in the delivery of the key internal projects, giving support from the business side to ensure progress and effective delivery of the desired outcomes. Work together with product and Marketing in the execution of the projects, giving support from the analytical and business side Desired Skills and Experience:Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a quantitative discipline (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, etc.), 2-4 years experience in a role with strong analytical componentStrong knowledge of SQL is a requirement, as well as experience in working with databases and large sets of data; R programming skills and experience with Google DataStudio will be highly valuedAdvanced Office skills. Strong experience with analytical tools, ideally with the Google toolset (spreadsheets, google docs, etc)Strong analytical skills, fast-learner, with high attention to detail and focused on results and productivityA self-starter and team player, who also enjoys to have fun!Business Proficiency in EnglishWhat do we offer?Safe environment during COVID times: Onboarding and daily work can be done 100% remote. A free eDreams Prime subscription to benefit from significant discounts on your travels.Competitive compensation package with an attractive bonus structure.Excellent environment for continuous growth and learning: with our Learning & Development programs, you will have access to tech talks, internal soft skills and technical skills training, language lessons, external events and industry conferences.Free subscription to O'Reilly Online Learning.Fast-track career development: with our unique programs, you are always working towards the next step on your career path.We also have for you a Ticket Restaurant benefit & unlimited beverages and coffee for free at the office (with many types of milk alternatives) because we like our eDOers happy and healthy!A phenomenal lifestyle and work-life-balance.New to the city? We also offer great relocation packages.Additional prizes and awards for a variety of team and individual achievements.Fun at work: at eDreams ODIGEO, work and fun go hand in hand!‚Ä¶ And the opportunity to work on a dynamic, dedicated, fun, and passionate team of professionals. We journey together!ÔªøCome fly with us and join us now.eDreams ODIGEO under its four leading online travel agency brands ‚Äì eDreams, GO Voyages, Opodo, Travellink, and the metasearch engine Liligo ‚Äìis an equal opportunity employer and value diversity and inclusion. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

description: Company Vision & MissionCobee is an employee benefits company that is using new technologies to disrupt the big market of employee compensation.All our efforts are focused on becoming the most desirable solution for employees to get compensated at work, making them financially healthier and more engaged with their companies.We are a young company made of a very professional and talented workforce. We are autonomous and we care A LOT about the quality of our own work.3)  ISpossible ambition: our business offering did not exist before. We constantly challenge the status quo because we are a set of thinkers who think that improvement IS always POSSIBLE. Who would not like to work for a company whose main value is to make employees happy? ;)What are we looking for?As per our new challenge in the Portugal market, we are looking for a Business Development Representative Junior for the Portugal Market as one of the key roles to get to our success going forward.The ideal candidate will cultivate relationships with prospective clients in order to catalyze business development success. He/she will also be responsible for maintaining contracts and performing other tasks needed to ensure customer satisfaction at all times. See below how to get involved in the adventure! Requirements: You are Portuguese.1 year of experience in similar positions.You demonstrate great communication and presentation skills in spoken and written Portuguese as well as in English (as our official language). Spanish will be a plus.The candidate must have proven strong in Sales competencies.Excellent organization skills to manage pipeline, calls, clients, leads, proposals and make relations with prospects.Excellent communication and teamwork skills.Experience working with Salesforce.Having a strong experience in working with CRM, Indicators, and DashboardsKnowledge of SaaS products and services will be a plus.Structured and always eager to improve the way you work What you will be responsible forBe the first contact point with the prospects to identify the opportunity.Manage daily activity into the CRM.Design cadences to improve the approach with prospects.Apply Sales Intelligence to know all about our clients.Working closely with the AEs involved to exceed their sales quota by identifying and qualifying opportunities with the best fit for Cobee and the client.Close meetings with the DM.What can you expectÔªøExtraordinary projection (great opportunity to develop a career)Cobee Benefits (health insurance, transportation, learning, nursery)Offices located in the center of lovely MadridHealthy working culture in a young and talented atmosphereCoolest place to work!

Fueled by a fundamental belief that having access to financial services creates opportunity, PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL) is committed to democratizing financial services and empowering people and businesses to join and thrive in the global economy. Our open digital payments platform gives PayPal‚Äôs 392 million active account holders the confidence to connect and transact in new and powerful ways, whether they are online, on a mobile device, in an app, or in person. Through a combination of technological innovation and strategic partnerships, PayPal creates better ways to manage and move money, and offers choice and flexibility when sending payments, paying or getting paid. Available in more than 200 markets around the world, the PayPal platform, including Braintree, Venmo and Xoom enables consumers and merchants to receive money in more than 100 currencies, withdraw funds in 56 currencies and hold balances in their PayPal accounts in 25 currencies.Job Description Summary:The Market PMM Intern will work on both merchant and consumer needs to gain a working knowledge of both sides of the business. They will be in charge of supporting local Market PMM in their daily activities from getting a deep understanding of customers needs and used payment products as well as understanding the competition to enhance our users local experiences.Job Description:Our teamThe Global Product Marketing team [PMM] is setup to drive product commercial success in partnership with Marketing, Global Product and Sales teams. PMM‚Äôs accomplish this by deeply understanding and consistently championing the needs of the customer as a representative voice in all discussions and decisions, ensuring product and feature releases solve tangible customer pain points.The Market PMM role is responsible for building a deep understanding of the market, competitive landscape, regulatory environment and financial services system as well as local culture & interaction with PayPal‚Äôs products & services across all customer segments. It connects the dots between Market, Global Marketing, Product and Sales teams at a local level to ensure accurate definition and prioritization of product and feature releases, improvements and bug fixes. While being aligned to specific geographies, Market PMMs are also responsible to collaborate across markets that serve each of our customer segments in the identification of opportunities for business growth.Key ResponsibilitiesDaily activities are broken out into Inbound work and Outbound workFrom an inbound perspective (60% Time allocation), the Market PMM continually defines the most important customer needs and opportunities. The Market PMM intern will collaborate on the following activities:Interacting with the following teams; Sales, Marketing, User Experience Research, Market research & Customer SupportModerating or observing focus groups & 1:1 interviews with customersStaying on top of and using competitor products in the MarketStaying on top of Market insights & trendUltimately Market PMMs create a clear understanding of opportunities across product and segment in their market to allow prioritization at the global level. They will be able to help answer priority customer questions and requests with the local business, providing deep expertise about our products.From an outbound perspective (40% Time allocation), the Market PMM performs the in-market activities to ensure successful Pilot testing and Product feedback. The Market PMM intern will support local Go to Market Strategy across sales, marketing & functions at country level and ensures local understanding of global product delivery. They will constantly evaluate end to end journeys to identify optimization opportunities end local experience enhancement.Key RequirementsEnergetic and positive, hungry to learn and challenge, creative, reliable, results focused with a can-do attitudeInterested in the operational, marketing, product and financial aspects of businesses in generalStrong in analytics and problem solving. Experienced/comfortable with data mining and analytical toolsGreat communication skills and ability to work and collaborate cross-functionally with external and internal teams including Product, Marketing, Sales, LegalHighly organized, attention to detail and follow-through. Should enjoy problem solving, fixing processesExcellent written, verbal, and presentation skills. Proficiency in MS Word, PowerPoint, Outlook and excellent in MS ExcelTo Be Considered You MustCurrently enrolled in a Bachelors or Masters degree in engineering, business, marketing, economics or data science at leading University, or equivalent.English and Spanish fluencyOther European languages are advantageous.Be available for an 6-month internship starting as soon as possible.We're a purpose-driven company whose beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We hold ourselves to our One Team Behaviors which demand that we hold the highest ethical standards, to empower an open and diverse workplace, and strive to treat everyone who is touched by our business with dignity and respect. Our employees challenge the status quo, ask questions, and find solutions. We want to break down barriers to financial empowerment. Our open digital payments platform gives PayPal‚Äôs 392 million active account holders the confidence to connect and transact in new and powerful ways, whether they are online, on a mobile device, in an app, or in person. Through a combination of technological innovation and strategic partnerships, PayPal creates better ways to manage and move money, and offers choice and flexibility when sending payments, paying or getting paid. Available in more than 200 markets around the world, the PayPal platform, including Braintree, Venmo and Xoom enables consumers and merchants to receive money in more than 100 currencies, withdraw funds in 56 currencies and hold balances in their PayPal accounts in 25 currencies.Job Description Summary:We are currently seeking a Solutions Engineer to join our Global Professional Services team in Southern and Northern Europe, focusing on Enterprise integration. This role is based in our Amsterdam or Madrid office. The Solutions Engineer plays a pivotal role in enabling our growth and innovation agenda - partnering with merchants, partners and technology providers. Working alongside our Commercial Sales and Business Development teams, the Solutions Engineer provides technical consultancy to enable PayPal‚Äôs diverse product set within these environments. The Solutions Engineer is the "voice of the customer" providing feedback to Product Managers, Technology, and other internal groups to provide technical solutions and define new function/feature needs. The ideal candidate is a motivated self-learner, passionate about problem solving and creating delightful experiences for our customers.Job Description:Primary Job Responsibilities:Consulting with our external clients to understand their business priorities, operational challenges and technical infrastructure, and propose technical solutions which solve for their needsDevelop best-in-class solution designs, test cases and launch plans for opportunitiesPartner with our integration engineering teams and oversee the enablement of new client integrationsCollaborate closely with internal teams including compliance, risk, information security, customer support and business operations to ensure all aspects of the launch are effectively managedIdentify any product/functionality gaps required to deliver a solution and collaborate with internal product and technology teams to define the necessary enhancements to support successful delivery.Job Requirements:Prior experience working as a Solutions Engineer, Technical Pre-sales Engineer or Solutions ArchitectExcellent communicator and relationship builder at the C-level with the ability to explain technical concepts to a non-technical audienceCreative thinker and experienced at understanding client‚Äôs pain pointsHighly skilled at applying consultative methodologies and techniques to influence solution design and solve integration pain pointsAbility to manage multiple projects running on parallel timelines, and to work and collaborate in a global and remote environmentExperience with Web and Mobile development technologies (iOS, Android) is required: JavaScript, Node.JS, PHP, Java, REST, SOAP, NVP, Webhooks are commonly used by our clientsPrior experience within the payment‚Äôs industry will be highly regarded Mentor junior team members as a senior technical and sales consultation leader (passive to active voice)Preferred Qualifications:Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent practical experienceSound knowledge of online payment processing across web, mobile app, and in storeIdeal candidate will have experience in working with enterprise organizations - preferably retailers, ecommerce, shopping carts and payment gateways.Experience with system discovery process, requirements gathering and systems architectureFluency in English and Italian, Spanish or Dutch is required. Additional languages are a plusWe're a purpose-driven company whose beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We hold ourselves to our One Team Behaviors which demand that we hold the highest ethical standards, to empower an open and diverse workplace, and strive to treat everyone who is touched by our business with dignity and respect. Our employees challenge the status quo, ask questions, and find solutions. We want to break down barriers to financial empowerment. Join us as we change the way the world defines financial freedom.PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.REQ ID R0068934

description: Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location for this position from the following: Madrid, Spain; Warsaw, PolandMinimum qualifications: Experience in strategic partnerships, business development, and stakeholder management. Experience influencing internal and external stakeholders across all levels of management. Experience building relationships. Experience working with startups.  Operations and project management experience. Preferred qualifications: Experience in an international partner management or operations management role. Deep knowledge about entrepreneurship, or network experience in the startup sector. Entrepreneurial spirit, ability to operate successfully with ambiguity. Strong desire to be a thought partner to product teams to activate product vision. Proven track record as a strategic thought-leader at a large global technology company, VC, incubator, or technology startup in business development, partnerships, product management, general management, or sales. Passion for entrepreneurship with an ability to speak the language of users.  About The JobGoogle for Startups (GfS) works to empower startups worldwide through a combination of programs, partnerships and Google products. We work closely with organizations, local tech hubs from Accra to Zurich, as well as accelerators and diversity-focused groups. We also run a network of physical spaces called Campuses, where startup founders come to learn, connect, and build companies that will change the world.You will cover EMEA, driving impact in the startup ecosystems. In this role you will work closely with the GfS regional lead to drive the partner engagement strategy in EMEA. By partnering with the local offices and with local organizations, you will also execute the local strategy toward startups by providing the programs and resources available within GfS (brand, partnerships, programs, network of experts) to founders in the region.You will work cross-functionally across local teams and manage the network of partners (accelerators, tech hubs, VCs) in the region. You will be responsible for day-to-day communication with partners in order to ensure we're delivering value to startups and founders in each hub. For non-GfS markets, you will ensure our brand footprint via the execution of programs or initiatives in alignment with our main key performance indicators (impact to startups, Google‚Äôs business, brand, and reputation).Responsibilities Manage day-to-day relationships with Google for Startups partners, both external (e.g. accelerators, tech hubs) and internal (other Google teams in non-GfS Campus markets). Work with GfS partner program lead and regional leads to drive partner engagement strategy. Be the GfS liaison for country offices that want to begin Google for Startups programming in their cities by providing playbooks, programs, brand usage, and oversight. Ensure the success of their strategy towards startups and the alignment with our core KPIs. Conduct operational tasks for partners in your portfolio including contracts, purchase orders, and invoices working with Legal and Strategy & Operations leads.  Ensure data collection from partner programs is in compliance with privacy and personal identifiable information rules.  Source and value potential partnerships, perform due diligence on partners, leading through execution including annual partner evaluations, and off-boarding conversations.  Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form .

description: Job SummaryThe Red Hat Consulting team is looking for a Cloud Native Architect with an OpenShift Infrastructure focus to join us in the Europe, the Middle East, and Africa (EMEA) region. In this role, you will promote the adoption of Red Hat's solutions at our key enterprise accounts, government agencies, and service provider partners. You'll lead small to medium-sized project teams and ensure the quality of customer deliverables for one or more projects. You will apply well-developed consulting, business, and process expertise in your quality work, as well as actively coach and mentor others while building good customer relationships. You'll earn the trust and confidence of our customers' engineering, development, and operations teams by matching their requirements and use cases with the functional capabilities of our solutions. As a Cloud Native Architect, you will serve as a customer advocate within Red Hat to deliver the right solutions and to ensure that these solutions are implemented and supported in a creative and reliable way. The role can be based in any of our EMEA offices with access to a major airport. Successful applicants must reside in a country where Red Hat is registered to do business.Primary Job ResponsibilitiesDesign automated, containerised cloud application platform solutions with a focus on application containerisation, including cloud-ready distributed application architectures, migrating workloads to containers, containerised development workflows, and integrating container platforms with automated continuous integration (CI) and continuous delivery (CD) pipelinesLearn new technologies quickly, including topics like container orchestration, container registries, container build strategies, and microservices on container platformsAssist in presales discovery and solutions blueprint developmentPresent, discuss, shape, and influence customer architectural design decisions and roadmap with external and internal stakeholdersPlay a technical governance role in project deliveryCollaborate with Support and Engineering teams to ensure customer success and effectively manage technical riskTravel in the future to work alongside leading financial services, retail, telecommunication, and institutional customers, in line with Red Hat's COVID guidelinesRequired SkillsExperience designing complex customer solutions in a rapidly evolving technological fieldPrior experience working in a enterprise architect or a consultant role related to the delivery of infrastructure solutionsPrior experience focused on cloud environments and their supporting infrastructures, in particular the microservices architectureSolid operational and management experience with hybrid platformsBackground in customer engagement with either a major consulting services organization or within a services division of a major software companyProven record of working in a strategic advisory capacity to senior IT and business executivesBroad experience across technologies like Red Hat OpenShift, Red Hat Virtualization, and Red Hat Ansible Automation PlatformExperience with CI and CD processes and development of pipelinesWorking knowledge of cloud architectures Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) and their supporting infrastructuresExcellent written and verbal communication skills in English, including experience presenting to senior business and technology leadersWillingness to travel up to 50%, following Red Hat‚Äôs COVID-19 guidelinesAbout Red HatRed Hat is the world‚Äôs leading provider of enterprise open source software solutions, using a community-powered approach to deliver reliable and high-performing Linux, hybrid cloud, container, and Kubernetes technologies. Red Hat helps customers integrate new and existing IT applications, develop cloud-native applications, standardize on our industry-leading operating system, and automate, secure, and manage complex environments. Award-winning support, training, and consulting services make Red Hat a trusted adviser to the Fortune 500. As a strategic partner to cloud providers, system integrators, application vendors, customers, and open source communities, Red Hat can help organizations prepare for the digital future.Red Hat is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. We review applications for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, veteran status, genetic information, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, or any other basis prohibited by law.Red Hat does not seek or accept unsolicited resumes or CVs from recruitment agencies. We are not responsible for, and will not pay, any fees, commissions, or any other payment related to unsolicited resumes or CVs except as required in a written contract between Red Hat and the recruitment agency or party requesting payment of a fee.

description: Job Purpose:  As a member of Tech Data‚Äòs European headquarters, the Consultant European Profit Management operates across a wide variety of front-office disciplines helping country and central operations systematically achieve significant and sustainable gains in profitability through superior margin management, both, at product and customer level, to meet Corporate goals.You will provide support to drive tangible profit improvements by prioritizing, transforming, standardizing and optimizing Tech Data‚Äôs pricing and Trade Margin management strategy, methodologies, tools and processes across our European operations. This implies improving the performance of major gross profit/Trade margin components that include Front End Margin, Backend Margin, Net Freight, Customer Rebates and Forex gains and losses. You will interact with country management teams, executing and coordinating assigned activities to ensure that goals or objectives of business units are accomplished within prescribed time frame and funding parameters.Responsibilities:  Assume accountability for the delivery, implementation and impact of advanced standard methodologies, tools and processes aimed at providing sustainable results for major Trade Margin components such us Front End Margin, Back End Margin, Net Freight and Customer Rebates.Collaborate with key members of local and central organizations and the European Profit Management community to provide strategic, analytical and implementation support in order to address potential risks and opportunities in the area of Trade Margin.Monitor country results to identify major deviations from defined profitability plans, prioritizing immediate remediation measures and driving the implementation of the required levers jointly with local teams.Support the European Profit Management Community that shares ideas and best practices, driving further harmonization and standardization across the region.Participate in the definition of functional specs of IT innovations related to profit management improvement opportunities liaising with TDIT and in-country business users to define priority and rollout strategy.Act as a key role model to the organization demonstrating the highest adherence to the corporation‚Äôs key values of Integrity & Respect, Passion for Winning, Leadership, Ownership and Partnership.Actively oversee the company‚Äôs operating policies and practices and ensures these meet and exceed where possible, all corporate requirements.Perform other duties as assigned by the Director, European Profit Management. Experience, Skills, and/or Abilities Required:  To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the experience, skill and/or ability required.Over 2-3 years working experience in a relevant discipline, ideally management consultancy or operations.Graduate degree required / preference given to those candidates possessing MBA.Fluent in English (other languages a benefit), exceptional verbal, written and communication skills.Willingness to work in a multi-cultural and multi-skilled team.Advanced analytical and fact based decision making.Previous experience implementing large projects (ideally business operations related) or effectively partnering with country organizations. Proficiency with Microsoft Excel; SAP knowledge is a plus.Experience in relationship building and facilitation skills with business partners; influence without authority; comfortable interacting with senior management.Strength in dealing with senior executives and peers to successfully implement change.Exceptional verbal and written communication and interpersonal skillsAble to operate effectively and constructively in a multi-task environment under stress and pressure.Able to define and achieve clear individual, team and company prioritiesPositive ‚Äúcan-do‚Äù attitude consistently able to deliver above expectationsExtensive root cause diagnosis and problem solving skillsAn ability to stimulate others to change and absorb new ideasStrong motivators and ability to work effectively in teams and aloneRemain professional and perform above expectations in high stress situations consistently Working Conditions: Normal, professional office environment Cultural Competency Requirements: Within Tech Data diversity is one of our fundamental shared values. We are a multi-cultural environment and we pride ourselves on being a welcoming place of work where we celebrate inclusion and champion people from a multitude of backgrounds. Join our team to connect the world with the power of technology!

Do you take pride in the simplicity and elegance of your code?Are you looking to apply your creative problem-solving skills to the most innovative cloud-based enterprise software?Do you want to write code that reaches thousands of high-profile companies such as The New York Times and Verizon?Upland hires the top global developers and lets them do what they do best. Unlike other jobs, where a lot of your work involves internal managerial tasks and meetings with clients who don't know what they want, in this role you will focus on doing what you enjoy the most. Shipping high-quality production code that matters. Every day.We have a strong engineering culture focused on giving developers ownership and autonomy over their tasks. In this role, you will apply your expertise to modernize a range of legacy products, turning them into state-of-the-art cloud-native applications, ready for deployment. You will quickly but thoroughly understand the ins and outs of different platforms to then creatively problem-solve to implement the simplest, most elegant solution to the issue at hand.This 100%-remote, work-from-anywhere position is an exciting next step for the experienced developer that is tired of working with old tech. Sharpen your skills and help us deliver our suite of top-quality, cloud-based software packages to millions of users globally.What You Will Be DoingWriting high quality production codeLearning how different platforms workShipping new features and improving software quality by delivering what the specs outlineApplying our metrics-driven agile approachSenior Software Engineer - Java Key ResponsibilitiesRe-design, re-build and re-factor essential B2B products before re-deploying them as true cloud-native applicationsFocus on feature development, API development, and performance improvementsBasic RequirementsA university degree (BS, MS, or PhD) that included in-depth study of data structures, algorithms, object-oriented programming, computer architecture, and software engineering OR at least 5 years of of experience writing code at a company that ships a software service or product (not including internships or trainee programs)At least 3 years of recent experience working on a professional team, developing and unit testing new features for complex production system (not including internships or trainee programs)Proficiency in Java for software development and web applications Proficiency with MySQL and No-SQL databasesDaily work schedule that significantly overlaps with standard Eastern Time Zone (GMT-5) work hours Excellent English verbal communication skillsAbility to learn quickly and work in a fast-paced environmentNice-to-have RequirementsExperience with ScalaExperience with AWSAbout UplandUpland Software (Nasdaq: UPLD) is a leader in cloud-based tools for digital transformation. The Upland Cloud enables thousands of organizations to engage with customers on key digital channels, optimize sales team performance, manage projects and IT costs, and automate critical document workflows. The Upland Cloud is backed by a 100% customer success commitment and the UplandOne platform, which puts customers at the center of everything we do.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!What to expect next:You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online ‚Äúscreening‚Äù assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.You will be paired up with one of our recruiting specialists who can answer questions you might have about the process, role, or company, and help you get to the final interview step.Important! If you do not receive an email from us:First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as ‚ÄúNot Spam‚Äù since you will receive other emails as well.Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/reset-password if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply. Acerca de nosotrosDesde enero de 2021, Henry Schein lo formamos profesionales provenientes de dos empresas: Schmidt Dental Solutions, un proveedor integral de soluciones dentales en Espa√±a y Portugal con 100 a√±os de dedicaci√≥n que operaba bajo el nombre de Casa Schmidt; y Henry Schein, el proveedor m√°s grande del mundo de soluciones de atenci√≥n m√©dica y odontolog√≠a cl√≠nica con cerca de otro centenar de a√±os en el mercado. Trabajamos con el prop√≥sito com√∫n de ofrecer una gama ampliada de productos y servicios a clientes en Espa√±a y Portugal ayudando a que los profesionales proporcionen pr√°cticas m√°s eficientes mediante nuevas soluciones y tecnolog√≠as. Y, por ende, obtener el mayor beneficio para sus pacientes.Ofrecemos la cartera completa de soluciones de negocios, cl√≠nicas, tecnolog√≠as y suministros de Henry Schein, as√≠ como con todas las l√≠neas de negocio de Schmidt Dental Solutions. Entre todas las l√≠neas de negocios se incluyen: Servimed, que proporciona apoyo t√©cnico a los odont√≥logos y especialistas dentales incluyendo a ortodoncistas y cirujanos; Importaci√≥n Dental Especialidades, un proveedor de productos y servicios especializados en implantolog√≠a y ortodoncia; y Schmidt Dental Solutions, un completo servicio distribuidor de productos y servicios dentales a cl√≠nicas, laboratorios, universidades y hospitales en Espa√±a y Portugal. Adem√°s, todo ello complementado por el software de Comunicaci√≥n y Gesti√≥n con el paciente l√≠der en el mercado, Henry Schein One; y las soluciones ofrecidas por CAMLOG y BioHorizons, las marcas m√°s importantes de Global Dental Surgical Group de Henry Schein.En Henry Schein, empresa con cerca de 100 a√±os de experiencia al servicio de profesionales dentales, ofrecemos nuestros servicios en Espa√±a y Portugal desde 1990 con un creciente n√∫mero de productos, tanto de marca propia como privada. Las generaciones familiares de Casa Schmidt llevan prestando sus servicios comprometidos en aportar una atenci√≥n de calidad a sus pacientes desde el a√±o 1919. En 2019 comenz√≥ a operar como Schmidt Dental Solutions. A d√≠a de hoy, contamos con m√°s de 175.000 productos en inventario, tanto de otras marcas como de marcas corporativas y con m√°s de 180.000 productos adicionales disponibles como art√≠culos especiales. Hi, we're Fever!Fever is the leading entertainment discovery platform, with a mission to inspire people through experiences. We are looking for bar-raisers who want to work hard, have fun, and make history with us. Fever combines its marketplace and Secret Media Network (such as Secret London, Secret NYC, Secret Los Angeles, Madrid Secreto, Paris Secret) through technology to reach over 30 million people every single week. Fever has also rolled out Fever Originals, which are proprietary events in which we follow a data-driven content creation strategy, using analytics to understand audiences and develop new, unique experiences.Fever is present in over 80 cities worldwide, in countries such as the UK, US, France, Brazil, Portugal, Australia, and Spain, and is always in the process of expanding to new markets. Fever is also backed by top-notch institutional investors, including Rakuten Capital, Accel, and Atresmedia. We have continued to disrupt the entertainment space during the pandemic, and launched the Stranger Things Drive Into ‚Äî the largest event in the world in 2020!THE ROLEYou‚Äôll be part of the Engineering team and work closely with the Marketing and Fever Originals team in order to reach our goals. You‚Äôll be working in a fast-paced environment to design and develop new pages for some premium Events in Fever, taking care of the whole lifecycle of the site. description: Are you a global software sales professional whose total compensation is up to $200,000 USD? Are you a student of the sale who is ready to teach the class? Are you obsessed with quality? It is not about earning a commission.You will not lead the customer conversation, and you will not be the one closing the deals.Head Of Sales Key ResponsibilitiesInstead of having you chase a quota with potentially misaligned incentives, we are willing to give you certainty on comp because we know what we need you to do to drive results. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. We are looking for a motivated Senior UX Researcher to join our Product Team, based in our headquarters in Madrid (Spain).About usShipping is complex and online stores need solutions to compete globally. With our technology, you can improve the shipping experience of your customers and deliver a premium service.Operating in 10 countries, our passion for getting shipping right means we support our customers every step of the way, making shipping simple and transparent.Our vision: to facilitate online shipping around the world.Our mission: helping online stores offer a great delivery experience.Our values: making our inclusive and proactive company culture our core guide.Earn it - Without trust, we can‚Äôt grow. We earn trust from our teammates, customers and partners through hard work and great results. Do it - Act, accomplish, repeat‚Äîthat‚Äôs how we achieve our shared vision. Our team doesn‚Äôt overthink it, we are simply shipping by simply thinking!Live it - We‚Äôre at our best when we‚Äôre challenged, learning and having fun.Our awesome Product CrewThe Product team is working on making shipping simple for online stores and customers. We are responsible for building the most simple, lovable experience that help online stores give a great delivery experience. This will allow us to be leaders in more than 10 countries. The world moves fast and we need to move even faster. Looking for challenges to redesign a massive growing and fast-paced industry? This is your place. üòé What you will be doingAre you ready to join our dynamic and fast-paced team? If so, please continue reading!üëáüèæConduct mid-to-large scale research projects across various teams to help them uncover findings, and help in translating those into business impact.Support and educate the product teams on how to conduct small scale user research and testing and how to turn the findings into actionable insights.Generate insights that both fuel ideation and evaluate product experiences.Decide, balancing proven techniques with creative solutions, which set of methods and tools match each research question in order to create multi-phase, mixed-method studies.Communicate results and illustrate suggestions in compelling and creative ways.Partner with cross-functional teams (Product Management, Design, Data, Customer support and others) to identify high-impact research studies, understanding when to bring in others for support.Prioritize research needs across numerous work streams by evaluating the moment, scope, and scale of potential studies.Drive the team in fostering an understanding of our users to influence how product teams think about mid and long-term product strategy.What are we looking forWe want an enthusiastic and motivated person to join our Product team üíÉüèΩThe skill setUndergraduate Degree in Cognitive Psychology, Human-Computer Interaction, Human Factors, Sociology, Anthropology or other undergraduate program that includes research methods and statistics as part of the core degree. 5+ years experience of hands-on experience with a variety of qualitative and quantitative research techniques, along with the knowledge of when and why to apply them.Experience with end-to-end research projects; from defining goals and objectives, recruiting, developing scripts or interview guides, conducting interviews, analyzing results, reporting and sharing insights with stakeholders.Experience promoting insights across groups with a focus on impact.Excellent presentation and storytelling skills that turn raw data in information that guides decision making.Experience giving internal training about the benefits of introducing user-centric practices and frameworks.Fluent in English as it is the official Packlink language and also for communicating with international customers. A part of the interview would be in english.Nice to have: a strong portfolio demonstrating past work experience and deliverables (e.g., study plans, reports). What we offer- üí∏ Clear and transparent compensation plan.The salary range for this role: 40.000-50.000‚Ç¨.We always include the salary range for all our job offers in order to be clear about our expectations. We will discuss the indicated range with you in the first recruiting call to ensure that we are on the same page. - üìô Personal Training Budget: Up to 2000‚Ç¨/year training budget (certifications, conferences attendance, etc.) to invest in your professional development. We want to help you improve your technical skills, feel involved in the product community, and develop your soft skills in order to lead teams and manage other stakeholders.- üè† We are a remote-first company All team members at Packlink are remote employees. After COVID, you can decide if you want to work in the office 2 days a week or 3 days per quarter‚Äîit's up to you. We also cover your expenses for working from home (50‚Ç¨ per month/600‚Ç¨ per year).- üíª Everything you need to work from home Whether you prefer Mac, Linux or Windows (or an additional screen or two), we set you up for success when working remotely.- Referral Bonus üîó We need your support in hiring top-class talent! We offer a referral bonus of 1k-3K, depending on the complexity of the role and the hiring process.- üá¨üáß üá™üá∏ Free language classes Thirsty for knowledge? Learn a new language by joining our free English/Spanish/French classes. In groups of 4-5 people, you can connect and enjoy taking up a new language or improving your current skills with one of our great instructors. - üèê Health and Wellness The well-being of our team is super important to us. Choose from different options that help you focus on your health:Gym membership or exercise classes (pilates, kick-boxing, etc.)‚Äîwe‚Äôre happy to cover the cost!If you prefer private health insurance, we offer a great plan courtesy of our partner Sanitas.- üéÇ Enjoy your Birthday Take your birthday off to celebrate, or your kid's birthday!- ‚öñÔ∏è Great work-life balance We offer a flexible work schedule and will do our best to adapt to your personal situation. Working in a fast-growth environment can be intense, but that doesn‚Äôt mean you shouldn‚Äôt enjoy your free time!-üíú An inclusive and upbeat work environment Leave your suit behind... we‚Äôre a t-shirt and converse kind of place! More importantly, our company culture promotes diversity and inclusion.The personality and opinions of each of our team members are important and valid, and we aim to offer all employees a safe environment where they can be themselves and thrive. - üåç A cross-cultural atmosphere We are a truly international team of 15 nationalities that speak 10 languages. Our company language is English and all internal communication and company-wide meetings are in English. -üèüÔ∏è Company events Work hard, play hard! We do our best every day, even at our regular team-building events. Everything is currently remote, but we‚Äôre looking forward to organising in-person company events once again in the near future! - üí∞ Flexible Salary We work with Cobee on a flexible compensation plan for transport, restaurants and kindergarten so our employees can save on personal income tax.Plus, many more exciting perks! Are you ready for discovering them?

description: About NebeusNebeus bridges the gap between crypto and cash. We allow people to use their crypto to get instant crypto-backed loans and access financial services for everyday use.Key facts:Founded in 2014, backed by ex-VC executives, Seedrs, and the UK government's Future Fund.We are a multi-cultural and international team spread out between London and Barcelona.Our main markets are the UK & Spain, but our platform offers crypto & financial services connecting to more than 150 countries.We are looking to ramp up our activities in the Spanish market. For this, we are looking for an experienced product manager to own product and marketing activities targeted at Spain and Spanish-speaking countries. Your mission will be to enhance the Spanish Nebeus product and own its success from start to finish. So if you are hungry for a challenge, this role is for you!What You'll Be Doing You will work closely with multiple departments, analyze our products and our competitors to gain an in-depth understanding of the Nebeus platform.You will evaluate all the steps needed to make sure that Nebeus is 100% Spanish native. You will then execute this plan and be responsible for its success.You will analyze and dissect Nebeus's Spanish users to understand our customers' needs in Spain and Spanish-speaking countries.You will be responsible for executing our Spanish-speaking marketing initiatives, getting your hands dirty, and doing all the small tasks needed to take us to success.We want to emphasize the getting your hands dirty part: you will be involved, execute, and be responsible for all the needed tasks and processes.You will continuously conduct qualitative & quantitative analyses of our products and our marketing. You will pitch new product, feature, and marketing ideas & initiatives where you see a need, and you'll constantly provide input to help further drive our product and marketing processes.You will work to reach set targets and KPIs.Who You AreYOU MUST HAVE PREVIOUS STARTUP EXPERIENCE.Previous crypto experience is a HUGE plus. You are a team player who can collaborate across functions and quickly adapt to a rapidly changing environment.You have experience working directly with senior management.You are not afraid to get your hands dirty and are ready to get involved in multiple product and marketing processes simultaneously.You are exceptionally well organized and can stay calm when working to tight deadlines.You can break complex problems into viable and actionable chunks and solve each problem accurately and effectively.What You'll NeedYou are a native Spanish speaker.You also have a very high level of English, and any other language is a plus.5+ years of product management/product marketing experience.Experience inPrevious experience launching products and features with experience in agile methodologies and the scrum framework. Strong Spanish copywriting and reviewing skills.Bachelor's degree with relevant education.We have a highly dynamic and challenging work environment with many initiatives happening simultaneously. We expect results on a daily basis. If that sounds exciting, please apply :)What we offerA competitive salary.25 days' holiday.Free coffee, tea, and beer!Regular on-site and off-site team events + team summer and Christmas parties.Happy Hour every Friday (post-COVID).We believe in continuous education and continuous self-development, so we offer monthly cashback on your purchase of non-fiction, business, and crypto & fintech books/e-books.
