description: About the jobIf you are a software engineer interested in the media and digital television sectors, we might have the perfect job for you!Mirada is a SW development company that builds solutions for TV and media sector.Our products are used by leading TV operators and broadcasters worldwide, to deliver innovative digital TV services to their customers.The solution that we provide comprises many different components and technologies. Our backend is a core component that manages the most important processes on the TV Operator platform. It's in charge of the content acquisition, the catalogue and lineup creation, the user accounts management, etc. It also provides support to the apps running on the different devices, from the login to the content playback and billing.The backend is composed by many microservices that are developed on Java and deployed on Kubernetes. The client apps are usually developed on native languages, for Android, iOS, Web, SmartTVs, Android TVs and TV decoders.The solution is really big and the global ecosystem is complex, then we have a specific team that is specialized in the final configuration and the rollout process.What you will be doing:You will be involved in the setup and deployment of our solution, which needs to be configured according to the client's platform requirements and the 3rd party systems that exist on the specific platform.This is a technical work that requires a high level of knowledge about our product and the tools that are used in the rollout process, but it's not just this, for a system integrator in Mirada the software development and abstract thinking skills are also important to build and to suggest improvements on the solution.As a system integrator, your main tasks will be related to the solution deployment, but your knowledge about the product and the different environments where it's deployed is really important to provide feedback and to suggest improvements to the different development teams. In Mirada, we encourage to have the feedback from the system integrators present during all the development process.Troubleshooting skills are also very important because system integrators usually are the first line of analysis when a problem on the platform is detected, then they provide a quick fix if possible but they also redirect the issue to the proper development team if necessary.What we require:Engineering in Audiovisual Systems, Telecommunications, Software development or similar.Software development knowledge. SQL and Database systems.Experience with Linux operating system and shell scripting. Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes and Helm would be a plus.Knowledge about television and video solutions.Ability to understand new systems and technologies.Troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.Good English level. Availability to travel.Friendly with a positive attitude to life.What we offer:Fixed salary depending on the experience of the successful candidate.BonusTicket Restaurant.Health and life insurance.Flexibility with taking holidays.Short working hours every Friday and throughout July and August.Possibility of teleworkingEnglish classes.... and much more!

description: Sales Operations ManagerODILOWe are Odilo: a fast-growing scale-up on a mission to democratize access to high quality education and improve literacy skills and critical thinking skills. Many call us the ‚ÄúNetflix for Education.‚Äù We are trusted by over 4,500 institutions (government, schools, libraries, universities, enterprises and startups) that use Odilo to provide digital content access to over 140 million users in +45 countries and are proud to be supported by the European Commission to improve literacy across Europe. Our team is truly international (+10 nationalities) and with champions from the top companies in the education, media, publishing and technology industries. As Sales Operations Manager, you will be managing the tools and systems that are essential for our sales process. You will be responsible for the management of our CRM, improving processes, and the adoption of our CRM within our sales team as well as other sales tools. You will work closely with the Head of sales operations to design, implement, and enforce new business processes.You will also assist with building and managing the recurring and ad-hoc reporting and analysis relating to Sales efforts from an operational perspective. Learning and development is at the core of our company, and we proudly support a culture of lifelong learning and providing our team all the resources (weekly dedicated time for learning, company library, etc) required to learn what they want at their own pace. You need to be genuinely passionate about supporting a learning culture within your team and be open to new ideas and change the status quo. Your responsibilities will include:Administer and support the CRM platform (adding new users, creating new fields, implementing changes in processes, supporting uploading processes, etc).Develop and maintain standardised operational reports and dashboards to monitor Sales performance, data integrity, and other key objectives and performance indicators.Build repeatable processes and reporting packages to empower all our Sales teams with critical operational data related to sales strategy and execution.Promote and maintain data integrity by analyzing data and taking the appropriate steps to ensure good practices are followed.Support day-to-day inquiries from the sales team, providing prompt and efficient resolution to a wide range of issues and developing operational procedures and policies to manage volume.Maintain and improve sales support tools, quota calculators, and internal processes.Provide guidance and education to the Sales Team around CRM policies, enforcing the established policies, and being a facilitator to the extent possible. The ideal candidate will need to bring:At least 2 years of experience working in sales operations, business analyst role, or as CRM administrator, preferably in technology, software or consulting environments.BS/BA degree in a technical or business-related field.Organization and attention to detail.Experience in creating complex reports, dashboards, and documenting processes.Strong analytical skills.Ability to work autonomously, effectively prioritize, and deliver to a high standard.Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, Fluent in English. What would make us happy:Superuser skills in CRM (ideally Pipedrive), G-Suite, etc.Knowledge of Business Intelligence tools (Quicksight, Domo)Knowledge of SQLKnowledge of Python Scripting.Wgy ODILO? Working at Odilo is about being part of a lifelong learning culture, where everyone has the possibility to take on challenges and participate in the growing of the company. But we also offer: o A unique and challenging job within an informal, creative and ambitious work environment. o Inspiring working space in the centre of Madrid. o Fulltime and permanent contract o A salary commensurate with qualifications and experience Does this sound like a mission made for you? Then we need to talk!
industry: E-learning

description: WHAT IS OUR TEAM LIKE?We are seeking a Lead Data Scientist to join our Advanced Analytics team. You will be part of the team that shapes Mango‚Äôs data intelligence, strategy, and architecture. The Advanced Analytics team develops Artificial Intelligence algorithms targeting to optimize the most challenging processes and decisions within the retail industry.Mango Advanced Analytics team consists of Data Scientist, Big Data Engineers and Software Engineers who work together in cross-functional squads to develop state-of-the-art quality machine learning algorithms leveraging the latest technology in Big Data platforms and distributed computing.Each of the Advanced Analytics squads targets to develop and evolve Machine Learning algorithms to face some of Mango key technical and business challenges:Personalization Squad: Develop Artificial Intelligence algorithms to provide a personalized experience to Mango Clients including both product, fit and size recommendations.Pricing and Markdown Squad: Develop machine learning algorithms which determine the optimal promotions and discounts to optimize the company margin during the sales period.Forecasting: Develop time-series forecasting algorithms to predict the evolution of sales and returns both short-term and long-term.Purchasing/Production: Develop data-science algorithm for early best sellers detection and to determine how many units of each product and size should Mango manufacture during the season planning.Due to the relevance of Mango Advance Analytics projects, each squad has board-level visibility and presentations.At Mango we are inspired and united by our passion for style and culture. We are present in 118 countries and our online presence extends to over 80 countries. Our team is made up of people of 112 nationalities, 80% of whom are female.We are a very dynamic team, motivated by new technologies, with a passion of what we do and will to take on major challenges that will allow us to continue to grow and contribute value through data.WHAT DOES A LEAD DATA SCIENTIST DO AT MANGO?As a Lead Data Scientist you will be part of the team that shapes Mango‚Äôs data intelligence, strategy, and architecture. You will work developing Artificial Intelligence solutions developed with state-of-the-art data models and algorithms. These data products enable use cases that are very innovative in the retail space, such as geoanalytics, robotization, omnichannel personalization, the connected store, computer vision, consumer 360¬∫ and real-time decisions. In you day-to-day work‚Ä¶Develop the development advanced machine learning algorithms to improve our core business processes and decisions.Work with a solid engineering approach (e.g., continuous integration, testing automation, etc) in a strong team of data engineers and data scientists.Use Spark to scale up your models and leverage MLOps tools to deploy them to production.Interact with business stakeholders to ensure proper alignment and adoption; and participate the delivery of the project end-to-end.Be passionate to work with a fast, iterative approach in new ideas and proofs of concepts.Stay connected to the latest developments in Big Data and MLOps and invest time in bringing new technologies and best practices to Mango.WHAT DO WE EXPECT OF YOU?Degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or other quantitative fieldsExperience developing mathematical models and predictive algorithms (supervised & unsupervised models, clustering, neural networks‚Ä¶)Experience developing production level machine learning solutions in a cloud environment with distributed computing.Experience with deep learning is a plusExperience working in cloud environment (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud, Azure)Ability to own the delivery of a project, including communication with business stakeholders and to deliver board-level presentationsAt least 3 years of programming experience, expertise in Python is a plusExperience implementing ETL, using BigData platform is a plus WHAT MAKES US SPECIAL?Immediate start with indefinite contractFlexible working hours and intensive working day on Fridays.You will form part of a leading company in the fashion sector which is dynamic and immersed in a process of innovation.You will work with a great team that is moving in the same direction to achieve the best results.Friendly, inspiring and ambitious work environment.25% discount on all our product lines (Woman, Man, Kids, Violeta and Accessories)Showroom market to renew your wardrobe twice a yearFree company transport from Barcelona and el Vall√©s.Training in languages, mindfulness and personal development programmes, among others.Social benefits and discounts.Monthly Mango Talks on digital transformation, fashion and the activities of our teams.Constant development opportunities with highly varied challenges that generate learning on the job.GymForLess (#andjoy)You got it?We like you!

description: If you are a software engineer interested in media and digital television sectors, we might have the perfect job for you!Our products are used by leading TV operators and broadcasters worldwide, to deliver innovative digital TV services to their customers. Focusing on back-end, we have 3 main systems:- SDP: Providing support to the client applications (STBs, Android, iOS, Web, Smart TVs, Android TVs, etc), besides, for the TV operator to control the platform, i.e. managing clients, devices, channels, VoD Catalogue, billing, etc.- CMS: In charge of content acquisition and management.- LogIQ: Receiving metrics from the clients to provide reports and useful data to the operators, e.g. audience measurement, customers behaviors and quality of service.Our solutions and the global ecosystem are complex, and the development, evolution, and maintenance of the different applications usually last for several years and everything needs to be properly tracked. We are using Confluence and Jira for this purpose.What you will be doing:As a backend developer, your main tasks will be related to the development of new functionalities or micro-services, this is A&D, coding, unit testing, etc. But you also will need to debug and fix different issues in your code and others, please consider that there are more than 30 developers in the team. On the other hand, we have many integrations with 3rd party systems from different partners. This means that the setup and deployment for a customer are not straight forward and we need to help with the configuration, fine-tuning and troubleshooting during this process.What we require:Engineering in Audiovisual Systems, Telecommunications, Software development or similar.Experience in Java and/or Clojure for Object-Oriented and Functional software development. SQL and Database systems.Knowledge of AWS technologies: Kinesis, RedShift, etc.Experience with Linux operating system and shell scripting.Knowledge of television and video solutions.Ability to understand new systems and technologies.Troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.Good English level. Availability to travel.Friendly with a positive attitude to life.What we offer:Fixed salary depending on the experience of the successful candidate.BonusTicket Restaurant.Health and life insurance.Flexibility with taking holidays.Short working hours every Friday and throughout July and August.Possibility of teleworkingEnglish classes.... and much more!

description: Job DescriptionWe have an exciting opportunity for a Business Developer to drive new business opportunities for our Portuguese sales team by qualifying, nurturing and setting appointments in prospect and dormant accounts.Location: Madrid, SpainLanguages: Fluent/business level Portuguese and English From the start, the Fortinet vision has been to deliver broad, truly integrated, high-performance security across the IT infrastructure. Today, we secure the largest enterprises, service providers and government organizations around the world.Fortinet empowers its customers with intelligent, seamless protection across the expanding attack surface and the power to take on ever-increasing performance requirements of the borderless network ‚Äì today and into the future. We have proven to be a truly innovative technology driven network security company with over 619 registered Global Patents. This is over 3 times more than our closest most innovative competitor!Our TeamThe Fortinet EMEA Business Development team is a group of highly driven and tenacious professionals, with an entrepreneurial spirit and a hunger for winning. Based in Fortinet offices across some of our key EMEA locations their mission is to drive new business opportunities for our EMEA sales teams by qualifying, nurturing and setting appointments in prospect and dormant accounts.With Us You Will Learn and demonstrate a fundamental understanding of Fortinet‚Äôs technology in order to articulate our value proposition to decision-makers, as well as being able to successfully manage and overcome objections. Research customers, identify decision makers, educate prospects and qualify buying interest and sense of urgency. Prospecting into multiple organizations via calling, networking and e-mail, with the help of cutting edge digital platforms for intent based leads such as Bombora and 6Sense, and contact discovery using Linked-In Sales Navigator, Discover.org, and other digital tools and Internet sources, to build and maintain a high quality lead pipeline. Schedule well qualified appointments with key decision makers within targeted companies. Meet and exceed daily and weekly call goals, as well as deliver a high quantity of well qualified sales opportunities. Maintain accurate activity, contact, and account information of all customers and prospects in our CRM (Salesforce). Work closely with Sales, Marketing and other Fortinet business functions in the development of strategic sales approaches.Apply If You Are customer orientated with current experience of inbound and outbound focused sales. Want to grow your career with a leading global cybersecurity company who have experienced 19 successive years of double digit growth. Are a highly motivated self-starter with a competitive personality, strong attention detail and a hunger to win. Have exceptional communication skills, both oral and written, coupled with excellent listening skills and a positive and energetic phone presence. Have the ability to demonstrate an aptitude for technology.What You Can Expect From Us Excellent training and development opportunities, providing you with all the tools you need to be successful. An open working environment, sharing knowledge and information collaboratively and transparently, with respect to everyone‚Äôs thoughts and opinions. The opportunity to be part of an innovative, collaborative and winning team. A competitive salary and incentive compensation package, including stock awards, health and welfare benefits.About UsFortinet (NASDAQ: FTNT) secures the largest enterprise, service provider, and government organizations around the world. Fortinet empowers its customers with intelligent, seamless protection across the expanding attack surface and the power to take on ever-increasing performance requirements of the borderless network - today and into the future. Only the Fortinet Security Fabric architecture can deliver security features without compromise to address the most critical security challenges, whether in networked, application, cloud or mobile environments. Fortinet ranks number one in the most security appliances shipped worldwide and more than 450,000 customers trust Fortinet to protect their businesses.

description: Ryanair Holdings plc, Europe's largest airline group, is the parent company of Buzz, Lauda, Malta Air & Ryanair DAC. In this role you will work closely with our development and product team to develop, modify and support our applications, website and user interfaces across all channels. We want someone who is motivated by emerging technologies and has a passion to drive digital transformation. A real desire to work in a collaborative and fast-paced environment is essential. DynamoDB, EC2, Lambda, ElasticSearch, RDS, SQS, SNS, Cloudformation), Couchbase, MySQL, Spark, Redis, Ansible, DockerBenefits:Flight Benefits

Position: Partnerships CoordinatorLevel: Entry-level Employment type: Full-timeLocation: Madrid, SpainAbout The FBAThe Football Business Academy is a business school dedicated to the football industry. Our programs have been developed and are delivered in a collaborative way with football industry experts around one foremost objective: to provide Candidates and Participants with all the necessary tools and an optimal learning environment in order to succeed in this passionate and dynamic industry.In order to reach this objective, we place a lot of importance on collaborating closely with industry stakeholders and co-creating value for them. As a result of this, more than 40 Partners have already joined us in our mission to build the future of Football together. About the role:The FBA is looking for a Partnerships Coordinator to support the servicing of our network in line with the interests of The FBA Family (which involves Staff, Candidates, Alumni, Faculty, and Partners). The successful candidate for this position will work closely with our Partnerships Manager and liaise with other members of the team for certain tasks. You will be part of a dynamic team which is passionate about accelerating the professionalization of the football industry and inspiring the next generation of football business leaders. This role plays an instrumental part in the way that FBA Candidates experience our program and get their (usually first) football industry experience under their belt. In other words: it means a lot to them, so it must mean a lot to you too. By doing so, we can ensure that we continue to raise the awareness and image of The FBA as the number one football business education provider globally and become the go-to place where the football industry‚Äôs stakeholders come look for off-the-pitch talent. Sounds like something you‚Äôd want to be part of? Continue reading!Your profile:Passionate about football businessFluent in English (written and spoken)Any additional languages are a plusBachelor‚Äôs degree in sports management, marketing, business administration or other related fieldPrevious experience in the football industry is preferrableAbility to work independently and prioritize workStrong organizational skills and attention to detailPositive attitude and open-mindedAbility to show initiative, be flexible, and find solutionsConfident communicator who is able to network and build relationships effectivelyQuick learnerComputer skills (MS Office, Hubspot)Permission to work in SpainYour main responsibilities:Support the Partnerships Manager with the coordination of internshipsLiaise between FBA Partners and Candidates to identify the best synergies and facilitate the internship recruitment processMonitor the football industry‚Äôs internship/job market and identify relevant opportunities for FBA Candidates and AlumniBe a voice of support and guidance to FBA Partners and Candidates alikeCoordinate agreements, feedback forms and other necessary documentsKeep CRM system up to date (Hubspot)Build relationships & networks on a global stageResearch potential partners and source key contactsDevelop new partnerships with football clubs and other industry stakeholdersOccasionally represent The FBA at events, meetings, and conferences (which may take place abroad, as well as on evenings or weekends)Additional details / considerations:Start ideally in June or at the very latest beginning of July 2021Based in Madrid with flexibility regarding office/remote workIf/when working remotely, you must have access to a home office scheme and reliable high-speed internetStandard full time work schedule consisting of five eight-hour workdaysAbility to work in Spain is a mandatory requirement. No sponsoring will be providedSalary between 18K and 22K euros (gross) depending on experience levelPlease note that The FBA is an equal opportunities employer and strongly committed to diversity and building a multicultural environment. Next steps:Do you think you have what it takes to join The FBA Family and embrace the role of Partnerships Coordinator? If so, you can get yourself in the game by submitting your application via email to jobs@the-fba.com by the end of Friday, 21st May 2021 using the following instructions:Email subject title: Partnerships Coordinator ApplicationYour CV in PDF format (max. 1 page)A cover letter outlining your motivation and aptitude for the job (max. 1 page)If we see a good match, you‚Äôll be invited to submit a case study based on a few exercises we have created. If we really like what we see there, you‚Äôll be invited to the interview process.Thanks for your interest and good luck!

Responsibilities: Establish and actively manage global and localized online media buys via Ad Networks, Google Search and Display, Facebook, Twitter, AdRoll, direct marketing arrangements and offline media buys.Campaign Management: ensure that all campaigns (e.g. email, webinar, social, offline, media buys, etc) function as per requirements, coordinate with the relevant departments to measure effectiveness and attribution to desired goals, impact analyses of the corporate website, email marketing and any custom landing pages.Work together with the designated CRM owner and involved teams to develop and track automated client journeys, funnels, behavioural and personalized email marketing campaigns.Working together with the Graphic Design and Frontend Web Development teams, manage all corporate website, landing page and email template designs, creatives, copies, translations, calls to action and related affairs.Produce documentation, project plans and road maps for processes, A/B tests and all financial promotions.Keeping yourself and the rest of the team well informed of competitor marketing initiatives and promotions.Liaise with members of the Business Development teams to ascertain their marketing requirements and ensure timely and effective delivery of such requirements. Evaluate requests to ensure that they are inline with the company‚Äôs strategic objectives and brand guidelines.Perform task management in a centralized manner, recording all requests, opinions, ideas and progress updates, ensuring that management is always kept informed of the progress of important tasks.Arrange meetings with key personnel to proactively ascertain their marketing requirements and provide them with progress updates on existing requests.Monitor and ensure that all marketing campaigns are within budget. Develop spending reports with a view to identifying high ROAS areas, and making data-driven recommendations for future spending accordingly.Assist when required with event management for local regions, sourcing venues, coordinating personnel placement and merchandise delivery.Work with tools such as HubSpot CRM, CrazyEgg, HotJar, Google Analytics, Power BI, GotoWebinar and JIRA.Experience RequiredMinimum of 5 years‚Äô experience in Marketing, preferably in the financial or data sector.Bachelors or Masters Degree in Business, Marketing, Communications, or any relevant field.Prior experience with all items listed in the ‚ÄúPrimary Responsibilities‚Äù section of this job post.Excellent written and spoken English.Strong organizational, project management and prioritization skills.Strong work ethic, proactive attitude, meticulous attention to detail, and the ability to deliver fast under pressure.Self-motivated with troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.Why DarwinexYou'll get the opportunity to be part of a rapidly scaling FinTech company, working alongside some of the brightest talents in tech and investments. This is a unique opportunity for the right candidate to forge a strong career in one of Europe‚Äôs most disruptive FinTech Startups. We were recently cited as one of Europe‚Äôs top 21 FinTechs to watch in 2021!https://sifted.eu/articles/21-fintechs-to-watch-in-2021/Flexible hoursPartially remote workingTeam EventsA strong and clear company cultureOffice in the heart of MadridGreat team to work with!Welcome to Darwinex!

WHAT WE DO MATTERS:Here at Bodas.net (The Knot Worldwide) we believe in doing work that matters. In 16 countries around the world, our leading family of brands (The Knot, WeddingWire, Bodas, GigMasters, The Bump, How They Asked, Lasting, and more) inspire, inform, and celebrate our communities as they move through life‚Äôs milestones. From the proposal to creating a home, and starting a family together, we‚Äôre there for every step of the journey. Our couples and business partners depend on us. They're all in. So are we.ABOUT THE ROLE AND OUR TEAM:We are looking for a highly motivated engineering leader with a passion for leading teams to create elegant and scalable software for our users. The right person will have a proven track record delivering engaging, consumer focused products within a data driven, agile environment. In this role you will lead a talented engineering team, partner with product development, and actively participate in both tactical and strategic conversations to determine the evolution of our products.The Knot Invitations is an exciting new line of business for The Knot Worldwide and we are making significant investments in our offering. This role has significant growth opportunity and visibility to stakeholders including the CEO, CPO, and CTO. The Engineering Manager for this team will work cross-organizationally to drive technical architecture vision and be a strong partner to product and design to establish OKRs and set technical vision to achieve business objectives.RESPONSIBILITIES: Oversee an engineering team responsible for our Invitations product vertical.  Ensure the team is operating effectively to reach their goals, are properly supported and deliver quality software. Evolve our platform into a sustainable architecture that supports iterative and fast development. Develop, coach, and mentor multiple engineers at various stages of their career to ensure growth and cultivate emerging leaders. Provide leadership within the team to ensure solutions are built in alignment with company principles. Actively participate in Agile ceremonies including pre-IPM, IPM, standups, and retros. Partner with product and design to plan and deliver OKRs. Actively participate in establishing the broader technical and product strategy that supports our company goals. Partner with Principal Engineers and Architects to set the vision and create the tech roadmap to effectively operate this product and platform. Formulate and proactively look for opportunities to improve the overall effectiveness of the teams. Collaborate with the broader zone and company on key technical initiatives. SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATES HAVE THE FOLLOWING SKILLS: Have 7+ years of proven industry experience with 3+ years of experience leading engineering teams. Deep understanding of distributed system design utilizing both relational and non-relational data stores. Experience working within an Agile based environment. A track record of shipping successful consumer facing products. Possess strong written and verbal communication skills. Comfortable managing multiple work streams and coordinating resources across teams and products. Thrives in a collaborative work culture with teammates located in-office or remote across multiple locations in the US and abroad. Knowledge of A/B testing software and techniques is a plus. The Knot Worldwide provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, or disability.

Who We AreBrooks is a team of passionate people united by a desire to do meaningful work, lead healthy lives and make a difference. We share a focused mission: to inspire everyone to run and be active. That‚Äôs it. No distractions‚Äîit‚Äôs all about the run. Through science, creativity, service, authenticity and connection, we obsess over delivering the best running gear on the planet. We do it our way, with our unique spirit, with a goal of being more relevant to runners than any other brand, day after day and mile after mile. We are determined to innovate, challenging ourselves to lead thought at every turn. Inside these walls and on the roads, tracks and trails, we live and breathe Run Happy, celebrating the positive impact running has on our lives and others. We inject it into all we do because it makes everything better, smarter, more fun and more memorable. Our company culture defines us, bonds us together and creates the conditions for success. It is lived daily as a behavioral expression of our collective set of brand values: Connect with People, Innovate for our Customer, Compete as a Team, Build Trust, Have Fun & Bring Passion, and Be Active. If you‚Äôre on our team, it means you‚Äôre part of creating something extraordinary. all Tec Rep‚Äôs are accountable for an established sell-thru number for a pre-determined store base within their respective territory.Educate and motivate the retailer, consumer, and all key points of contact about Brooks technology and product leadership via product seminars and clinics.Work the sales floor at accounts as assigned ‚Äì be an expert at driving product sell-thru in all channelsRepresent Brooks at national (and selected local) running events and expos -- including set-up, breakdown, distribution of collateral, interaction with consumers and product trial.Provide feedback and analysis via bi-weekly field reports to measure effectiveness of product initiatives and sales strategies; identify new opportunities for growth within or outside the running industry.Maintain appearance of leased company vehicle and all Brooks equipment.Your QualificationsBachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing/Sales/Retail Management preferred.1 ‚Äì 3 years of retail experience (Athletic Specialty preferred).2+ years of Marketing/Sales experience within the sports industry preferredFluency in Spanish and good understanding of business English are an absolute must.Highly-motivated and energetic with an enthusiastic attitudeExcellent verbal and written communication skills in Italian and business English, demonstrating effective listening through concise, clear verbal and written communicationVery strong presentation skills.Excellent interpersonal skills that inspire and build trust resulting in effective working relationships across the company. Works well independently, as well as within a team.Keen attention to detail in planning, organization and execution of tasks, while still seeing the big picture and understanding how all of the pieces fit together and affect one another.Ability to anticipate how a decision made can affect our customers, our partners, our products or other departments‚Äô operations and/or morale; ‚Äúconnecting the dots.‚ÄùDemonstration of innovation and initiative ‚Äì always looking at improving our products and processes while also displaying a willingness to dive into the details and help out wherever necessary.Passionate participation in Brooks‚Äô sports activities a plus, overridden by the ability to understand and empathize with the runner in order to develop loyal, engaging relationships with our customers and the Brooks community.Basic knowledge of retail math, inventory management, product merchandising and retail selling skills.Knowledge of performance athletic footwear/apparel/accessories and their related technologies.Knowledge of the biomechanics of human motion; understanding of injury prevention basics.Understanding of the territory‚Äôs local running community (events, clubs, coaches, specialty retailers).Extensive travel required; able and willing to work weekends and extended hours as required.Must show proof of good driving record upon request.Embraces and lives the Brooks values!Our Offer25 working days of holiday leave per yearCompany car, mobile phone and laptop according to our company policyBonus and merit potentialDiscount on Brooks productsThe opportunity to be part of a great teamPlease note that this role requires 70% travel - valid driving license is a mustPlease submit your CV and motivation in EnglishAt Brooks, we celebrate diversity & equity. description: Overview We‚Äôre excited to have now joined the 7-Eleven family of stores! The Assistant Leader is responsible for assisting management with overall store conditions, in order to maximize guest services and store profitability. The Assistant Store Leader will aid in fostering a coaching environment where employees want to excel, and are recognized for their achievements. The Assistant Leaders must be scheduled to work separate shifts/days with the exception of one day a week. They will oversee facility operations in the absence of Facility Leader.Cultivate a GUEST in Mind Culture. Focus on the wildly important. Be a leader. Be committed to the guest.Responsibilities Provides prompt, courteous customer service by discovering guest‚Äôs needs with management support.  Assists in planning and preparing of schedules.  Prepares shift reports and/or other reports as required by management. Completes DSR and shift analysis reports.  Assists and supports management in calculations of food consumption, and requests purchases of food products, supplies and equipment, as required.  Ensures accuracy of gasoline pump readings.  Supports in the cleaning of shelves, drives, dispensers, restrooms, store interior/exterior, and other designated areas.  Assists management in maintaining building, equipment and grounds.  May assist in analyzing financial data including but not limited to; profit and loss statements, shortage to identify business opportunities and increase of sales.  May assist in analyzing food service results and trends to determine the proper action plans, to leverage the stores food sales and address areas for improvement. Assists management with ordering and vendor check-in.  Works under the direction of the Item Level Inventory Specialist with inventory audits. Contributes in price counting inventory, pricing, stocking and rotating merchandise.  Conducts competitors survey at the direction of management using personal vehicle.*  Effectively reacts to and reports customer complaints tactfully and promptly.  Addresses and follows company policy and procedures and all laws governing restricted beverage and tobacco sales.  Performs service transactions in accordance with company policy such as alcoholic beverage & tobacco sales; lottery sales & redemptions; vendor coupons redemptions; Company approve credit card charges, etc.  Follows credit card, money order, and check cashing policies.  Effectively oversees facility operations during absence of Leader; communicates employee relations problems to management for further handling.  Safeguards cash and merchandise; follow company robbery prevention and reaction procedures as provided in the emergency response and reporting procedures and policy manual.  Reports and follows policies and procedures established to prevent loss of cash and merchandise due to actions by employees, vendors and/or customers.  Ensures the bank deposits are made daily. Follows proper cash handling procedures in accordance with company policies.  Ensures and eliminates safety hazards; reports unsafe acts or conditions to management. Prepares required accident/incident report, immediately reporting such activity to management.  Operates cash register and all point-of-sale equipment efficiently.  Aids in managing the merchandising of the facility by directing sales promotions, implementing new programs, and communicating to vendors and other appropriate personnel on marketing activities. Uses suggestive selling techniques.  Assists in training and coaching to develop top performing employees. Assists management with applicant screening process.  Carries out sales associate responsibilities, as required.  Maintains personal appearance in accordance with company uniform and personal appearance policy for Assistant Store Leaders.  Performs other duties as assigned.  Reports to work on time and when scheduled. QualificationsThe qualifications listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions. Essential functions are job duties that an employee must be able to perform with or without reasonable accommodation. All of the responsibilities listed above are considered essential job functions to this position.Education/ExperienceMust be at least 18 years or older to apply. High School diploma or GED is preferred. Two year degree or above desired. A minimum of one year in retail, fast food, or sales experience is required. Maintains current food handler and food safety certification as required by county. Must be authorized to work in the United States.A valid driver‚Äôs license is required to perform banking responsibilities and to conduct competitor surveys. Reliable transportation and valid automobile insurance is required. Employees are subjected to motor vehicle checks in accordance with company policies if required to drive.Knowledge And SkillsDemonstrated leadership and customer service skills and competencies. Proven success developing team members. Demonstrated ability to use P&L and store reports to affect change. Ability to read and interpret documents such as rules, operating and maintenance instructions and procedure manuals. Excellent oral and written communication and intrapersonal skills. Ability to write routine reports and to speak effectively before customers and employees. Ability to add, subtract, multiply and divide in all units of measure using whole numbers, common fractions and decimals. Ability to exercise sound judgment and work with minimum supervision. Proficient computer knowledge (Microsoft products preferred Word, Excel). PDI/Verifone/Topaz experience preferred.Physical Functions Must be able to stand and/or walk for full shift.  Ability to occasionally lift and/or carry up to 50 pounds from ground to overhead, and/or 60 pounds from ground to waist level,, up to thirty minutes of workday (i.e., to assisting in stocking/maintaining inventory levels).  Ability to push and pull with arms up to a force of 128 pounds (i.e., utilizing hand truck.)  Ability to bend at the waist with some twisting, up to one hour of the workday.  May be required to climb a ladder and/or stool, kneel or crouch to store or retrieve materials and/or place or remove signs.  Ability to grasp, reach, and manipulate objects with hands all day. This handwork requires eye-hand coordination and may require bilateral coordination of hands, up to four hours of the workday. Working Conditions Employee performs approximately 95% of work indoors. Outside work will be required.  Employee is exposed to intermittent indoor cold temperature extremes when working in the walk-in cooler and/or freezer. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions. Essential functions are job duties that an employee must be able to perform with or without reasonable accommodation. All of the responsibilities listed above are considered essential job functions to this position.This job description is subject to change at any time.#INDSJ711

description: In order to support the vision of creating more liveable urban spaces, EIT Urban Mobility is looking for an intern for the Innovation department. The intern will support the team during its phase of consolidation of the department due to the rapid growth of its activity. Especially in the area of communication, marketing and event organisation. The Innovation team is responsible for the continuing development of the Innovation portfolio, monitoring programmes, driving excellence, and providing quality support and service to our Innovation partners. THE CHALLENGE At Eventbrite, people are our number one priority. Our goal of building the platform to power live events and experiences for millions globally relies on our strong foundation of people and culture. We are the face of Eventbrite, and responsible for finding, attracting, and bringing on the best of the best to drive Eventbrite‚Äôs business and award-winning culture forward. You‚Äôll support both our global Talent Acquisition efforts by scheduling candidates and working with our hiring managers and interview panels across our global offices. THE TEAM Our Talent Acquisition team‚Äôs mission is to build pipelines of talent and efficiently hire new Britelings through relationships, influence, branding, and experiences. We have a tight-knit, quick-moving, and fun-loving team of Talent Managers who seek out the best talent for Eventbrite. We believe talent acquisition should be a company-wide effort, that candidate experience comes first, and that hiring should be based on relationships and not transactions.THE ROLEWe are currently hiring a Technical Sourcer for a 12-month contract here at Eventbrite. As a Talent Technical Sourcer, you‚Äôre the anchor for our Talent Acquisition team. You'll support both Recruiters and Hiring Managers in attracting and creating a strong pipeline of diverse passive candidates in Europe. Your sourcing skills will play an integral role in helping us build leading-edge engineering and product teams.THE SKILL SET2+ years of technical sourcing experience in a fast paced environment focused on EPD roles (Engineering, Product and Design).Proven track record of leveraging multiple sourcing channels to identify untapped high caliber talent Ability to research and analyze market intelligence to educate Recruiters and Hiring teams on the talent landscapeExperience tracking funnel metrics and data to increase efficiency and effectivenessDemonstrable record of creating compelling outreach messages for drip campaignsAbility to create future talent pools by building relationships with candidates and keeping candidates warm for future opportunitiesWhat We OfferAt Eventbrite, we strive to support our Britelings and their loved ones through different stages of life with robust and attractive benefits, financial and physical wellness options, and great perks.In addition to offering a competitive salary and company stock, we have other great benefits available. In the Briteland, you‚Äôll find great medical plans, fertility and adoption benefits, wellness reimbursement, generous parental leave, on-site services, and much more.We Care About Your Mental Health And WellbeingOur employees enjoy free coaching sessions with Modern Health. We also offer free therapy sessions with a psychologist. You‚Äôll also have access to private medical insurance for you and your family, that includes dental care. And if you like sports, we have our wellness program to pay for your gym expenses.Ongoing training and career development is an important part of our cultureWe offer unlimited access to courses in Udemy, language exchange programs, internal training, Briteling talks, workshops and weekly sessions with our CEOWork-life balance is extremely important to usOur employees can choose what works best for them: work in one of our offices, be fully remote or the best of both worlds! We believe in a flexible working environment to allow Britelings to perform at their best ensuring a healthy work-life balance. We have recently implemented Britebreak Fridays: all Britelings turn off their computers and take the first Friday of every month off to focus on their wellbeing.About EventbriteEventbrite is a global self-service ticketing and experience technology platform that serves a community of nearly one million event creators in over 180 countries. Since inception, Eventbrite has been at the center of the experience economy, transforming the way people organize and attend events. The Eventbrite platform provides an intuitive, secure, and reliable service that enables creators to plan and execute their live and online events, whether it's an annual culinary festival attracting thousands of foodies, a professional webinar, a weekly yoga workshop or a youth dance class. With over 300 million tickets distributed to more than 4 million experiences in 2019, Eventbrite is where people all over the world discover new things to do or new ways to do more of what they love.Is this role not an exact fit?Sign up to keep in touch and we‚Äôll let you know when we have new positions on our team .Eventbrite is committed to equality of opportunity for all staff, and applications from all suitably qualified individuals are encouraged, regardless of age, disability, sex, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief and marriage and civil partnerships. description: THE CHALLENGEEventbrite has built its business on empowering event creators with solutions to enable their success. In the process, we have touched millions of customers, helping them get together, explore their interests, and pursue their passions through live experiences. Now, we‚Äôre embarking on a journey to further connect our consumers and organizers through delightful commerce experiences.To help us deliver on this ambitious vision, we are on the hunt for a rock-star Product Manager who puts the customer first, is passionate about user experience and lives and breathes data to make decisions. Sounds like you? Let‚Äôs talk.THE TEAMYou‚Äôll be joining a global team of experienced and talented Product Managers, Engineers and Designers who are focused on building a product that empowers and enables customers to participate in great live experiences. We are passionate about events, motivated, collaborative, and a fun-loving team responsible for a high-growth, global business. THE ROLEYou will be responsible for defining a vision, strategy and leading a team in executing a roadmap for Eventbrite‚Äôs checkout experience. You will make data-driven product decisions supported by both metrics and user research. You will work cross-functionally with multiple stakeholders and will collaborate with product managers, engineers, and designers within and across other business units. Your ultimate goal is to build a high quality product that drives engagement from customers.YOU WILLLead the ideation, research, design, development and launch of user-centric commerce productsUnderstand user needs; identify and define product requirementsCreate clear goals for the team. Drive product development with a world-class team of Engineers, Designers and Analysts to deliver impact for our business and usersUse data and metrics to inform your strategy and success criteriaTHE SKILL SET3-5 years of product management experiencePassion for live events, frequently attending events and buying tickets onlineSelf-starter with a solid track record of execution and resultsProven ability to work cross-functionally, collaborate, influence and work as part of a teamData-driven, analytical problem solverUser-first mindset with experience in user research and testingExcellent written and oral communication skillsBONUS POINTSExperience with user facing productsExperience or knowledge of eCommerce platforms / marketplacesWhat We OfferAt Eventbrite, we strive to support our Britelings and their loved ones through different stages of life with robust and attractive benefits, financial and physical wellness options, and great perks.In addition to offering a competitive salary and company stock, we have other great benefits available. In the Briteland, you‚Äôll find great medical plans, fertility and adoption benefits, wellness reimbursement, generous parental leave, on-site services, and much more.We Care About Your Mental Health And WellbeingOur employees enjoy free coaching sessions with Modern Health. We also offer free therapy sessions with a psychologist. You‚Äôll also have access to private medical insurance for you and your family, that includes dental care. And if you like sports, we have our wellness program to pay for your gym expenses.Ongoing training and career development is an important part of our cultureWe offer unlimited access to courses in Udemy, language exchange programs, internal training, Briteling talks, workshops and weekly sessions with our CEOWork-life balance is extremely important to usOur employees can choose what works best for them: work in one of our offices, be fully remote or the best of both worlds! We believe in a flexible working environment to allow Britelings to perform at their best ensuring a healthy work-life balance. We have recently implemented Britebreak Fridays: all Britelings turn off their computers and take the first Friday of every month off to focus on their wellbeing.About EventbriteEventbrite is a global self-service ticketing and experience technology platform that serves a community of nearly one million event creators in over 180 countries. Since inception, Eventbrite has been at the center of the experience economy, transforming the way people organize and attend events. The Eventbrite platform provides an intuitive, secure, and reliable service that enables creators to plan and execute their live and online events, whether it's an annual culinary festival attracting thousands of foodies, a professional webinar, a weekly yoga workshop or a youth dance class. With over 300 million tickets distributed to more than 4 million experiences in 2019, Eventbrite is where people all over the world discover new things to do or new ways to do more of what they love.Is this role not an exact fit?Sign up to keep in touch and we‚Äôll let you know when we have new positions on our team .Eventbrite is committed to equality of opportunity for all staff, and applications from all suitably qualified individuals are encouraged, regardless of age, disability, sex, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief and marriage and civil partnerships. description: THE CHALLENGEEventbrite is seeking Full-stack Software engineers to join us in our mission to bring the world together through live experiences. Last year alone, our platform processed over 150 million tickets across over 3 million events organized by our creators. In this role, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to build features, design APIs, and scale our product as we grow.THE TEAMWe're a people-focused Engineering organization: the women and men on our team value working together in small teams to solve big problems, supporting an active culture of mentorship and inclusion, and committing themselves to learn new things daily. Pair programming, weekly demos, tech talks, and quarterly hackathons are at the core of how we‚Äôve built our team and product. We believe in engaging with the community, regularly hosting free events with some of the top technical speakers, and actively contributing to open source software. Our technology spans across web, mobile, API, big data, machine learning, search, physical point of sale, and scanning systems.Our engineering teams own their services and systems end to end from requirements gathering to deployment to maintenance. Team members follow an on-call rotation to ensure any issues are mitigated immediately and root causes are rectified.THE ROLEWe seek Full-stack Software engineers who are passionate about their craft to join our engineering team in Spain, although we‚Äôre remote friendly. We‚Äôre currently through a transition to a pure Devops culture. We strive for teams completely autonomous and with full ownership of their services and roadmaps. Teams usually consist of front-end engineers, backend engineers, a product manager, a designer, Technical program manager, and an engineering manager. You will solve challenging technical problems and own your impactful products end-to-end. You will contribute to Eventbrite engineering‚Äôs culture of technical excellence through inclusivity and mentorship. This is more than an opportunity to join an amazing team, it is a chance to impact Eventbrite‚Äôs platform and organization at scale.THE TECH STACKEventbrite is one of the world‚Äôs largest Django-powered sites by request volume. Python, Django, and MySQL are the primary off-the-shelf technologies in our stack. We are hosted on AWS. PySOA, our services framework builds on these core technologies. On the frontend, we make extensive use of React and Redux. However, the company is transitioning to a completely new stack (such as Kotlin, DynamoDB, Lambdas, gRPC, Step Functions, etc) where each team will have complete ownership and autonomy.THE SKILL SETYou have 1+ years of experience building applications in at least one popular programming language, such as Python, JS, Java, Kotlin, Go, Rust, Ruby, etc.You have 1+ years of experience using some form of web framework: Django, Symphony, Rails, ASP.net , etc.You experience in building responsive web pages using a combination of HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript with recent experience in ES6Experience using a SQL database: MySQL, PostgreSQL, MSSQL, etc.You care about making sure your code is maintainable and well tested.You have a holistic approach to quality. Passion to learn and to mentor others English and Spanish conversational to advanced levelBONUS POINTSYou have experience working with modern frontend frameworks: React, Backbone/Marionette, etcExperience with state management frameworks like Redux.Experience with cloud services in AWS, Azure, or Google.Experience using non-relational databases like Elasticsearch and Redis Comfortable developing in a container environment like Docker Familiarity with continuous integration tools like Jenkins or CircleCI What We OfferAt Eventbrite, we strive to support our Britelings and their loved ones through different stages of life with robust and attractive benefits, financial and physical wellness options, and great perks.In addition to offering a competitive salary and company stock, we have other great benefits available. In the Briteland, you‚Äôll find great medical plans, fertility and adoption benefits, wellness reimbursement, generous parental leave, on-site services, and much more.We Care About Your Mental Health And WellbeingOur employees enjoy free coaching sessions with Modern Health. We also offer free therapy sessions with a psychologist. You‚Äôll also have access to private medical insurance for you and your family, that includes dental care. And if you like sports, we have our wellness program to pay for your gym expenses.Ongoing training and career development is an important part of our cultureWe offer unlimited access to courses in Udemy, language exchange programs, internal training, Briteling talks, workshops and weekly sessions with our CEOWork-life balance is extremely important to usOur employees can choose what works best for them: work in one of our offices, be fully remote or the best of both worlds! We believe in a flexible working environment to allow Britelings to perform at their best ensuring a healthy work-life balance. We have recently implemented Britebreak Fridays: all Britelings turn off their computers and take the first Friday of every month off to focus on their wellbeing.About EventbriteEventbrite is a global self-service ticketing and experience technology platform that serves a community of nearly one million event creators in over 180 countries. Since inception, Eventbrite has been at the center of the experience economy, transforming the way people organize and attend events. The Eventbrite platform provides an intuitive, secure, and reliable service that enables creators to plan and execute their live and online events, whether it's an annual culinary festival attracting thousands of foodies, a professional webinar, a weekly yoga workshop or a youth dance class. With over 300 million tickets distributed to more than 4 million experiences in 2019, Eventbrite is where people all over the world discover new things to do or new ways to do more of what they love.Is this role not an exact fit?Sign up to keep in touch and we‚Äôll let you know when we have new positions on our team .Eventbrite is committed to equality of opportunity for all staff, and applications from all suitably qualified individuals are encouraged, regardless of age, disability, sex, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief and marriage and civil partnerships. description: The time is now to start your next career step at Celonis, one of the fastest growing global tech companies worldwide!Celonis is the execution management system leader. Powered by its market-leading process mining core, the Celonis Execution Management System provides a set of instruments and applications, with a developer studio and platform capabilities for business executives and users. The Celonis EMS offerings help companies manage every facet of execution management from analytics, to strategy and planning, management, actions, and automations. For Global 2000 companies, transforming to an intelligent enterprise has become a key strategic priority. Celonis has thousands of global customers including ABB, AstraZeneca, Bosch, Coca Cola, Citibank, Dell, GSK, John Deere, L‚ÄôOr√©al, Siemens, Uber, Vodafone, and Whirlpool. All rely on Celonis technology to unlock their full execution capacity and drive change to business processes. Celonis is headquartered in Munich, Germany and New York, US, and has in total 15 offices worldwide. The company has grown 5,000% in 4 years and 300% in the past year. In 2019, Celonis reached a $2.5 billion valuation, after receiving a $290 million Series C funding round. Celonis is continuously expanding, especially in Europe to be able to serve the local markets. Recently offices were opened in Paris, Copenhagen, Stockholm, and Madrid, as Center of Excellence for international tech talent. Particularly in these uncertain times Celonis plays an impactful role in helping customers to use their execution capacity the best way possible. At Celonis, we believe that every company can unlock their full execution capacity - and for that we need you as a Workday HRIS Senior Analyst in Madrid with experience in Corporate Treasury or related finance field. This role is critical to building a best in class Treasury department! Your Responsibilities:Support for Workday HCM & Integrated Business Applications (Core HR, Absence, and Advanced Compensation).Analyze user experience and adoption, determine common pain points, develop content, and deliver targeted trainings as such to facilitate enablementOffer technical solutions to gain process efficiency and improve data integrityContinually enhance the Workday platform, including reporting and analysis capabilities, to meet ever-changing business requirementsCollaborate with HR Operations to develop and implement new features/enhancements.Modify and redevelop business processes and condition rules based on client requirementsSupport new feature implementations by assembling data, gathering workbooks, developing test plans, and supporting UATResearch and troubleshoot system issues/errors and educate end-users on Workday best practices and functionality.Document system policies, adoption plans, and best practices to ensure Workday scalability across global business.Maintain system access and modify tenant security as needed.Requirements: 3+ years of Workday HCM experience in a hands-on-capacity (Minimum of 2 years system experience)Experience with Workday report writing (Advanced, Matrix, Dashboards, Calculated fields) Strong problem-solving skills, with an ability to anticipate needs and resolve issues proactively.Ability to partner with HR/Talent Acquisition to analyze and define business goals and requirements, translate requirements into functional and technical designs, and implement relevant solutions within Workday HCMYou are exceptional at communicating concepts and ideas to stakeholders, in different shapes depending on the contextWe:See people as the fundamental pillar of our success. Therefore, we invest into the personal growth and skill development of each individual alongside with the strength finder test Offer attractive compensation models (best-in-class salary, stock option packages, employee referral bonus, family service, flexible working hours, ‚Ä¶)Are visionary and one of the fastest growing Software-Unicorns in the worldAre experts in the field of Process Mining - the new Celonis Execution Management System provides a set of instruments and applications: the EMS offerings help companies manage every facet of execution management from analytics, to strategy and planning, management, actions and automationsDistinguish ourselves through a unique combination of innovative start-up atmosphere paired with great professionalism and self-responsible workCelonis is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Different makes us better.

description: We are papernest.We have a dream, a world without paperwork. A world where administrative phobics like us live finally protected from the anguish of the forms filling and surcharges for late payment.On the other hand, we will not lie to you, there is much work to do. That‚Äôs why we are looking for committed, creative and enthusiastic people like you to accompany us in the adventure.Since 2015, we have never been idle. With 3.5 million moves a year in France, and 76% of French people stressed by this event, we decided to attack the subject starting with this opportunity. As a result, we have created the only platform that allows you to transfer all your contracts during your relocation, 100% free, 100% online. At the time of our sixth anniversary, we are more than 750 employees, we have accompanied over 800 000 users, and we opened an office in Barcelona.We see things in a big way: a team of ideas bubbling around the globe, a future where our entire administrative life is just a click away.As an international company, listed on the French Tech 120 and based on the vibrant Poblenou district, we are looking for a HR Controlling and Compensation & Benefit Manager. With a direct report to the Head of HR for Spain, you will be the main responsible for all the Compensation & Benefits policies update and analysis. You will also be the leader for all the data related to HR with the EMEA target operating model.You will also be responsible for providing a high level of service through efficient and effective support to internal customers in regards to Compensation & Benefits, Legal & Labor relation and Global Mobility fulfilling the KPIs and objectives defined.Your missionsEnsuring and monitoring monthly payroll and HR Admin processes.Supporting Comp&Ben proposals, Employee Relations, HR Administration Processes, People Services and Analytics, HR Reporting and HR Budget control.Monitoring government regulations, legislation, compensation & benefits trends, researching, benchmarking and analyzing benefit plans, programs and policies.Administering papernest‚Äôs benefits programs (e.g., insurances, meal vouchers, flexible compensation etc.) liaising with the benefits providers/brokers and managing the enrolment, renewal, and distribution processes, ensuring C&B plans are cost-effective and competitive.Managing the global mobility/relocation processes overseeing the sponsorship of work visas and partner with Legal and Company Practises and Conditions to ensure a smooth mobility process.Spearhead global expansion efforts by helping to establish human resource infrastructure in new countries when required.Monitoring organization‚Äôs salary structure and benefits, balancing cost control with the need to attract and retain staff.Following our offboarding process partnering with internal/external stakeholders.Security and Labor Inspections procedures as well as in specific initiatives like Works Councils collective bargaining negotiation and litigation trials preparations, acquisitions, mergers or restructuring impact assessments (dismissals, etc).Your profile:You come from an extensive HR Admin technical background in the areas in scope, owning Payroll, C&B and HR Operations improvement.You have 5+ years working in HR with an emphasis on People Operations; experience working at a global company with national and international brands/site, and a rapid growth start-up environment preferred.You have knowledge of legal and employment-related requirements within Spain (other countries will be valued).You have lead Project Management and HRIS deployment will be highly valued.You have the ability to organize operations and optimise processes.You are also defined by your ability to demonstrate a high degree of confidentiality.Other requirements:Bachelor Degree in Business Administration or an HR Analytics specialisation and you are a master in Excel.Experience in managing and developing teams <5 people.You are friendly, committed and very professional working environment being part of a high impact HR team.Languages:Fluent in Spanish and English (written and oral), French could be a plus.Why papernest?You will be working with talented, smart, and great peopleYou will have high responsibility and autonomy to make as much impact as you can imagineYou will be working in a fast-growing and internationally expanding company with great opportunities for you to step up in your careerYou will work in a meritocracy with test-and-learn and fear-nothing attitude where truths rule and politics have no spaceYour manager:Your manager will be Pauline, Head of HR Management Spain. In search of sunshine, she left her native Normandy to move to Barcelona and join papernest in 2020. Always ready to launch new projects, Pauline will share her ideas with you with enthusiasm! In her free time, she enjoys many activities (hiking, sewing, museums, sports, ...) and loves to gather her friends to share good meals around board games. If you are ready to play the game, we look forward to meeting you!Recruitment process:First call with Elena, Talent Acquisition.Interview with Olivier, our CHRO.Interview with PaulineBusiness caseIf this challenge is yours, we look forward to meeting you!papernest is a disability-friendly company.Remote work applicable upon the company policies.

However, the company is transitioning to a completely new stack (such as Kotlin, DynamoDB, Lambdas, gRPC, Step Functions, etc) where each team will have complete ownership and autonomy.The SkillsetYou have 4+ years of experience building applications at scale in at least one popular programming language, such as Python, Java, Kotlin, Go, Rust, Ruby, etc.You have 2+ years of experience using some form of web framework: Django, Symphony, Rails, ASP.net , etc.You have 2+ years of experience using a SQL database: MySQL, PostgreSQL, MSSQL, etc.You are an efficient, practical programmer with a record of designing and producing dependable code.You care about making sure your code is maintainable and well tested.You have a holistic approach to quality.You are a results-driven self-starter with great communication and collaboration skills; we put a lot of emphasis on being team players.You enjoy teaching and mentoring colleagues.BONUS POINTSExperience with cloud services in AWS, Azure, or Google.You have knowledge of microservices and/or Service Oriented ArchitectureYou have experience working with modern frontend frameworks: React, Backbone/Marionette, etcYou have experience designing and developing APIs, both internal service and HTTP APIsWhat We OfferAt Eventbrite, we strive to support our Britelings and their loved ones through different stages of life with robust and attractive benefits, financial and physical wellness options, and great perks.In addition to offering a competitive salary and company stock, we have other great benefits available. In the Briteland, you‚Äôll find great medical plans, fertility and adoption benefits, wellness reimbursement, generous parental leave, on-site services, and much more.We Care About Your Mental Health And WellbeingOur employees enjoy free coaching sessions with Modern Health. We also offer free therapy sessions with a psychologist. You‚Äôll also have access to private medical insurance for you and your family, that includes dental care. And if you like sports, we have our wellness program to pay for your gym expenses.Ongoing training and career development is an important part of our cultureWe offer unlimited access to courses in Udemy, language exchange programs, internal training, Briteling talks, workshops and weekly sessions with our CEOWork-life balance is extremely important to usOur employees can choose what works best for them: work in one of our offices, be fully remote or the best of both worlds! We believe in a flexible working environment to allow Britelings to perform at their best ensuring a healthy work-life balance. We have recently implemented Britebreak Fridays: all Britelings turn off their computers and take the first Friday of every month off to focus on their wellbeing.About EventbriteEventbrite is a global self-service ticketing and experience technology platform that serves a community of nearly one million event creators in over 180 countries. Since inception, Eventbrite has been at the center of the experience economy, transforming the way people organize and attend events. The Eventbrite platform provides an intuitive, secure, and reliable service that enables creators to plan and execute their live and online events, whether it's an annual culinary festival attracting thousands of foodies, a professional webinar, a weekly yoga workshop or a youth dance class. description: THE CHALLENGEEventbrite is a people-first organization. Our goal of building the global platform for live experience relies on the foundation of top talent and strong company culture. Our team is the face of Eventbrite, and we‚Äôre charged with finding, attracting, and bringing on the best of the best to drive Eventbrite‚Äôs growing business and award-winning culture forward. Hiring the best talent globally is no easy feat. However, we have a talented team who has an inspiring story and mission. Our perfect candidate is someone who can connect that vision and story with top-notch talent.THE TEAMWe're a people-focused Engineering organization: the women and men on our team value working together in small teams to solve big problems, supporting an active culture of mentorship and inclusion, and committing themselves to learn new things daily. Pair programming, weekly demos, tech talks, and quarterly hackathons are at the core of how we‚Äôve built our team and product. We believe in engaging with the community, regularly hosting free events with some of the top technical speakers, and actively contributing to open source software. Our technology spans across web, mobile, API, big data, machine learning, search, physical point of sale, and scanning systems.Our engineering teams own their services and systems end to end from requirements gathering to deployment to maintenance. Team members follow an on-call rotation to ensure any issues are mitigated immediately and root causes are rectified.THE ROLEAs a Software Engineer in the Listings Team, you‚Äôll have a direct impact on the users purchasing tickets from Eventbrite; you‚Äôll work on the page that the attendee faces before starting the Checkout flow.You will own the logic that defines how this page will be rendered, which options will the user have and how the user proceeds to the Checkout page to commit the actual purchase. Technically, this involves talking with different services, such as the ones responsible for delivering the price ranges, the event description, or creating the order itself.You will partner closely with the rest of the Creator and Commerce teams to handle the inventory details, the details of the event provided by different services and the different information shared with the Checkout process.THE TECH STACKOur primary stack for our front-end code is written in React. We use libraries such as React Testing Library, Cypress or Storybook.Most of our back-end code is Python and Django, all running on Amazon AWS with a MySQL database. Some of the other tools that we use are Git, Datadog or Splunk.THE SKILL SET7+ years building applications in a mainstream programming language, ideally Javascript3+ years of experience with a front-end framework, ideally ReactYou have experience in building responsive web pages using a combination of HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript with recent experience in ES6Efficient, practical programmer with a record of producing maintainable codeAbility to take initiative and produce results with great communication and collaboration skillsYou care about making sure your code is maintainable and well tested.You have a holistic approach to quality.Passion to learn and to mentor othersEnglish and Spanish conversational to advanced levelBONUS POINTSExperience in back-end development, ideally with Python or Node.js You have experience designing and developing APIs, both internal service and HTTP APIsExperience using a SQL database: MySQL, PostgreSQL, etcActive Eventbrite user with a passion for live eventsWhat We OfferAt Eventbrite, we strive to support our Britelings and their loved ones through different stages of life with robust and attractive benefits, financial and physical wellness options, and great perks.In addition to offering a competitive salary and company stock, we have other great benefits available.
