description: THE CHALLENGEEventbrite is seeking a Staff Backend Software Engineer to join us in our mission to bring the world together through live experiences. Last year alone, our platform processed over 150 million tickets across over 3 million events organized by our creators. In this role, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to build features, design APIs, and scale our product as we grow.THE TEAMOur team‚Äôs mission is to have a unified, stable and performant Order Processing experience across Eventbrite. Ordering is a Tier 1 service, all orders in Eventbrite go through our services, which implies we have a great responsibility, as a consequence of this the team is currently through a transition to a pure Devops culture. We strive for teams completely autonomous and with full ownership of their services and roadmaps. We expect an important growth of physical events in the following months, we are doing full rewrite to improve our scalability, availability and innovation and we need people to help us scale our services, from design to implementation.THE ROLEWe seek staff software engineers who are passionate about their craft to join our engineering team in Spain, although we‚Äôre remote friendly. We‚Äôre currently through a transition to a pure Devops culture. We strive for teams completely autonomous and with full ownership of their services and roadmaps. Teams usually consist of front-end engineers, backend engineers, a product manager, a designer, Technical program manager, and an engineering manager. You will solve challenging technical problems and own your impactful products end-to-end. You will contribute to Eventbrite engineering‚Äôs culture of technical excellence through inclusivity and mentorship. This is more than an opportunity to join an amazing team, it is a chance to impact Eventbrite‚Äôs platform and organization at scale.THE TECH STACKThe Eventbrite stack lives in AWS and primarily consists of React and native apps on the frontend and a mix of Django and SOA on the backend. We have python, node and golang in our application layer. We have a mix of datastores with a strong MySQL presence. However, this team is about to start a migration to a completely new stack (such as Kotlin, DynamoDB, Lambdas, gRPC, Step Functions, etc) where the team will have complete ownership and autonomy. We will do a full rewrite of the ordering system and we expect you to participate not only in the implementation but also in the decision making, ranging from design to choosing our stack.TTHE SKILL SETYou have 5+ years of experience building applications at scale in at least one popular programming language, such as Python, Java, Kotlin, Go, Rust, Ruby, etc.Experience with cloud services in AWS, Azure, or Google.You have knowledge of microservices and/or Service Oriented Architecture.Comfortable with leading large cross-functional initiatives, and collaborating with engineering teams and other stakeholders.Good understanding of Web Service, API, REST and RPC.You are an efficient, practical programmer with a record of designing and producing dependable code.You care about making sure your code is maintainable and well tested.You have a holistic approach to quality.You are a results-driven self-starter with great communication and collaboration skills; we put a lot of emphasis on being team players.You enjoy teaching and mentoring colleagues.BONUS POINTSExperience with distributed systems and large scale systemsWhat We OfferAt Eventbrite, we strive to support our Britelings and their loved ones through different stages of life with robust and attractive benefits, financial and physical wellness options, and great perks.In addition to offering a competitive salary and company stock, we have other great benefits available. In the Briteland, you‚Äôll find great medical plans, fertility and adoption benefits, wellness reimbursement, generous parental leave, on-site services, and much more.We Care About Your Mental Health And WellbeingOur employees enjoy free coaching sessions with Modern Health. We also offer free therapy sessions with a psychologist. You‚Äôll also have access to private medical insurance for you and your family, that includes dental care. And if you like sports, we have our wellness program to pay for your gym expenses.Ongoing training and career development is an important part of our cultureWe offer unlimited access to courses in Udemy, language exchange programs, internal training, Briteling talks, workshops and weekly sessions with our CEOWork-life balance is extremely important to usOur employees can choose what works best for them: work in one of our offices, be fully remote or the best of both worlds! We believe in a flexible working environment to allow Britelings to perform at their best ensuring a healthy work-life balance. We have recently implemented Britebreak Fridays: all Britelings turn off their computers and take the first Friday of every month off to focus on their wellbeing.About EventbriteEventbrite is a global self-service ticketing and experience technology platform that serves a community of nearly one million event creators in over 180 countries. Since inception, Eventbrite has been at the center of the experience economy, transforming the way people organize and attend events. The Eventbrite platform provides an intuitive, secure, and reliable service that enables creators to plan and execute their live and online events, whether it's an annual culinary festival attracting thousands of foodies, a professional webinar, a weekly yoga workshop or a youth dance class. We have recently implemented Britebreak Fridays: all Britelings turn off their computers and take the first Friday of every month off to focus on their wellbeing.About EventbriteEventbrite is a global self-service ticketing and experience technology platform that serves a community of nearly one million event creators in over 180 countries. description: Being part of an innovative and disruptive gaming company is your dream? Social Events: regular events include: learning Lab, Thirsty Thursday, seasonal events, summer and Christmas parties, sporting competitions, a football team and more!Sabbatical for every four years of service: you have the chance to take six weeks paid leave. (Istio, Grafana, Prometheus, etc) is a big plus;A strong team player, willing to share knowledge with other team members and help out where needed;You have strong verbal and written English language skills.What we offer:The dynamic and creative environment within international teams;The variety of self-education courses on our e-learning platform;The participation in meetups and conferences sponsored by vpTech locally and internationally;Up to 3 days of remote work per week;Video games, beer and quiz parties with colleagues.Belonging to Veepee, <vpTech/> is one of the biggest Tech community in Europe with more than 1000 IT collaborators around Europe.From Warsaw to Barcelona, through Lyon, Nantes, Lausanne, Tel Aviv, Brussels, Nice, Amsterdam and Paris, all our projects are jump on this new adventure?Need more info > https://careers.vente-privee.com/en/vptech/

description: MissionWe are seeking a talented immunologist to design, execute and lead new drug development efforts from early discoveries to preclinical stages. As a successful candidate, you will be part of a dynamic cross-functional team dedicated to finding new therapeutic options for autoimmune and inflammatory skin disease. The scientist will have the opportunity to act as project team lead, and champion drug development programs by driving highly collaborative efforts with peers, stakeholders and external partners. You are expected to design and conduct research, as well as to oversee a team dedicated to identifying and validating new targets up to transition to preclinical development. We are looking for a senior immunologist who is passionate about using her/his deep understanding of autoimmune and inflammatory disease to make impactful contributions to clinical drug development, from exploratory research to preclinical development.Tasks and ResponsibilitiesProvide exceptional technical knowledge and leadership to drive drug discovery projects, working with a cross-functional team that includes clinical scientists, bioinformatics and discovery scientists.Translating exploratory hypothesis into a strategy to develop preclinical candidates with the ability to simultaneously lead and/or support more than one project.Have deep scientific expertise of cellular and molecular human immunology to champion, oversee and execute new drug development projects starting from early hypotheses.Design, perform and execute the development of key internal capabilities (tools, assays, workflows, etc.) to study human immunity at the molecular and cellular level, mentoring other peer scientists as well as external collaborators.Present experimental results and research plans to multiple audiences.A key responsibility is to enable complex cross-functional projects that involve internal and external partnerships, using your deep knowledge in immunology and ability to coordinate and influence scientific collaborations to lead drug development efforts.Education & ExperiencePh.D. in Molecular/Cellular Immunology or related field with successful postdoctoral studies and preferentially experience in drug discovery gained in an industrial environment.Extensive knowledge and hands-on experience in human immunology including deep understanding of T, B and NK and myeloid cell biology. Knowledge of Treg biology is preferred. Ability to design and execute complex flow cytometry assays as well as experience with cell sorting is essential. Demonstrated cell biology expertise including cell line engineering (cell lines and primary leukocytes) using CRISPR and imaging techniques (confocal, time-lapse microscopy, etc.) will be given preference. Experience in single cell RNA-seq sample preparation and data interpretation is desirable.Expertise is mouse immunology and in vivo studies would be a plus.Recognized success in carrying out independent projects in autoimmune disease and inflammation is preferred, ideally demonstrated by relevant publications in the field. Leadership, collaborative spirit, self-motivation and ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously while delivering results under tight deadlines. Candidates with demonstrated experience supporting and leading cross-functional teams are highly encouraged to apply.Strong communication skills in English is a must. Ability and enthusiasm to collaborate, lead and motivate peers and collaborators, critically evaluate data and articulate solutions to complex projects to achieve demanding project goals is necessary.
location: Sant Fel√≠u de Llobregat, Catalu√±a, Espa√±a
industry: Industria farmac√©utica

Be part of something bigger!BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world and is advancing the world of health by improving medical discovery, diagnostics and the delivery of care. We have over 65,000 employees and a presence in virtually every country around the world to address some of the most challenging global health issues.Our vision for Peripheral Intervention at BDOur Peripheral Intervention (PI) business unit offers a comprehensive range of medical products, devices and services for the treatment of peripheral arterial and venous disease, cancer detection, and end-stage renal disease and maintenance.About the roleAn exciting opportunity has arisen to join the Sales division at BD. The position will report into the Sales Lead.We continue to grow through outstanding and innovative driven products and the clinical and market knowledge of our sales team. This is an opportunity to join a professional and inspiring team, helping to continue our growth and success in changing clinical practice and surgical techniques.Main responsibilities will include:Understand and sell efficiently within the local business model and partner framework.Proficient disease, therapy and product knowledge and leveraging said knowledge in selling situations with clinical and non-clinical partners.Deep knowledge of health-economics and tender processes, with potential to influence key decision maker criteria for impactful outcomes.Uncover and develop partner needs, both for clinical and non-clinical partners, including benefit-based solutions and effective handling of partner objections.Segment accounts and target/allocate resources and budget appropriately, including tracking targets and outcomes through SFDC.Understand, align with BD policies and serve as an ambassador for BD with internal/external partners in multiple settings.Match selling skills and messaging appropriately and leverage relationships between partners to move business objectives forward.Engage in self-development, including attendance in sales meetings, professional skills trainings and product trainings.Performance metrics:Delivery of quarterly objectives set with Sales Manager.Completion and regular analysis/updates of Business Plans for key strategic accounts, including sales targets against forecast and quarterly action plans.Corporate CRM updates (SFDC), including timely entries of sales calls, call objectives, outcomes and next steps for accounts and key partners.About youWe are looking for someone with University/College degree in Life Science, with validated experience in sales within medical devices or biotech industry and proficiency in English. You will also bring:Sales experience in Peripheral Interventional business, knowledge of disease state and related therapies with competitive knowledge.Uncover and develop partner needs, both for clinical and non-clinical stakeholders, including benefit-based solutions and effective handling of partner objections.Influence and negotiate based on value, with potential to create ideal bargaining positions that result in increased margins.Develop and influence key decision, making criteria in favour of BDI Peripheral Interventional therapies, including resolution of risks and concerns.Understand, interpret and sell with clinical data to impact key decision making criteria with different partners.Willingness and ability to travel and with a clean driving record.Click on apply if this sounds like you!Why join us?A career at BD means being part of a team that values your opinions and contributions and that empowers you to bring your authentic self to work. Here our associates can fulfill their life‚Äôs purpose through the work that they do every day.You will learn and work alongside inspirational leaders and colleagues who are equally passionate and committed to fostering an inclusive, growth-centered, and rewarding culture. Our Total Rewards program ‚Äî which includes competitive pay, benefits, continuous learning, recognition, career growth, and life balance components ‚Äî is designed to support the varying needs of our diverse and global associates.Becton, Dickinson and Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, age, sex, creed, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, marital or domestic or civil union status, familial status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetics, disability, or any other protected status.To learn more about BD visit https://emea.jobs.bd.com/

description: WeGetFinancing (https://wegetfinancing.com) is operated by Emerging Payments Technologies, a USA company with offices in New Jersey. (EST or CET timezones).We want to grow our development team, located across Europe, and we are looking for a Quality Assurance engineer.What you will doAs part of the WeGetFinancing development team, you will be responsible for the QA processes of our platform's different components.You will be the first QA profile to join an existing engineering team by supporting the current team in test automation. As part of your responsibilities, you will need to help the team identifying bugs before they hit production and implementing a strong QA flow for our different Jenkins pipelines. You will be creating reports of the QA status of the various builds before they hit production.What you need to bring+2 years of experience with Python.Experience with pytest, cypress, selenium, robot framework, or similar testing tools.Experience with Jenkins or a similar environment.Writing docker containers and managing them with docker-compose.Basic knowledge of AWS.University degree in Computer Science or related.Fluency (both written and spoken) in English.Bonus points ifPrevious experience with Agile methodology.Knowledge of Git and git-flow.Knowledge of relational databases and SQL language.Linux/Unix knowledge.Experience creating or consuming REST APIs (JSON, XML) and Swagger/OpenAPI.Experience with eCommerce and payment methods.Links to GitHub/BitBucket public repositories with relevant projects, pull-requests, or any open source project participation.We offerCompetitive salary.Full remote position.Standard vacations package (national holidays + standard holidays).

Elastic is a search company built on a free and open heritage. Anyone can use Elastic products and solutions to get started quickly and frictionlessly. Elastic offers three solutions for enterprise search, observability, and security, built on one technology stack that can be deployed anywhere. From finding documents to monitoring infrastructure to hunting for threats, Elastic makes data usable in real time and at scale. Thousands of organizations worldwide, including Cisco, eBay, Goldman Sachs, Microsoft, The Mayo Clinic, NASA, The New York Times, Wikipedia, and Verizon, use Elastic to power mission-critical systems. Founded in 2012, Elastic is a distributed company with Elasticians around the globe and is publicly traded on the NYSE under the symbol ESTC. Learn more at elastic.co.Right now, we are on the lookout for talented Java Engineers to join our Elasticsearch - Distributed Systems team and focus on critical features that affect how Elasticsearch scales and provides reliability to our users. This team maintains critical components of Elasticsearch such as snapshot/restore and replication. You can be based (pretty much) anywhere in the world.What You Will Be DoingPushing the limits on the number of shards, nodes, and petabytes that Elasticsearch can handle todayEnsuring users can reliably backup and restore Elasticsearch at scaleBuilding and enhancing fundamentally hard features such as cross-cluster replication or a changes APIProviding enhanced capabilities for data management Look into all kinds of issues, including performance or concurrency issues, and propose solutions.Supporting our support engineers with the harder problems.What You Will Bring AlongYou have strong skills in core Java and are conversant in the standard library of data structures and concurrency constructs, as well as newer features like lambdas.You have a deep technical proficiency in algorithmsYou have proven your ability to understand and work on complex, highly distributed systems.You are able to take on projects and guide them from beginning to end. This covers both technical design and working with other engineers to develop needed components.You demonstrate the ability to build and debug features with a broad impact on a product and that run on multiple machines.Bonus points for knowledge of:Data storesSearch, analytics, LuceneStrong knowledge of the JDKAdditional Information - We Take Care of Our PeopleAs a distributed company, diversity drives our identity. Whether you‚Äôre looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life. Your age is only a number. It doesn‚Äôt matter if you‚Äôre just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.We strive to have parity of benefits across regions and while regulations differ from place to place, we believe taking care of our people is the right thing to do.Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary Health coverage for you and your family in many locationsAbility to craft your calendar with flexible locations and schedules for many rolesGenerous number of vacation days each yearDouble your charitable giving - We match up to $1500 (or local currency equivalent)Up to 40 hours each year to use toward volunteer projects you loveEmbracing parenthood with minimum of 16 weeks of parental leaveDifferent people approach problems differently. We need that. Elastic is committed to diversity as well as inclusion. We are an equal opportunity employer and committed to the principles of affirmative action. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. If you require any reasonable accessibility support, please complete our Candidate Accessibility Request Form.

description: Elastic is a search company built on a free and open heritage. Anyone can use Elastic products and solutions to get started quickly and frictionlessly. Elastic offers three solutions for enterprise search, observability, and security, built on one technology stack that can be deployed anywhere. From finding documents to monitoring infrastructure to hunting for threats, Elastic makes data usable in real time and at scale. Thousands of organizations worldwide, including Cisco, eBay, Goldman Sachs, Microsoft, The Mayo Clinic, NASA, The New York Times, Wikipedia, and Verizon, use Elastic to power mission-critical systems. Founded in 2012, Elastic is a distributed company with Elasticians around the globe and is publicly traded on the NYSE under the symbol ESTC. Learn more at elastic.co.The Observability team is in charge of developing solutions that focus on application developers and engineers that run infrastructure and services supporting these applications. Elasticsearch is an efficient datastore for logs, metrics, and application traces, supporting the three pillars of observability. The Observability team builds and maintains solutions that make getting insights from this data turnkey and efficient, such as our APM, Infrastructure Monitoring, Logs, and Uptime solutions. When developing these solutions, we think about the problem end-to-end: how do we automatically collect data from common data sources, how do we store it efficiently in Elasticsearch, how do we present this information to the user, what actions do we take on the insights from the data? All of these aspects are important in bringing a turnkey solution to the market.As a Senior JavaScript engineer on the Observability team, you'll primarily be working on UIs and APIs in Kibana devoted to curated observability users. You'll be working with the UI team and product management to build high quality, intuitive and innovative UIs and robust API to drive the experience.Engineering philosophyWe believe that engineering complex, pluggable software for the web that is built to last the test of time is both tricky and exciting. Doing so requires a team of diverse individuals, with sharp minds and the ability to empathize with our users, working together with mutual respect and a common mission.We care deeply about giving you full ownership of what you're working on. Our company fundamentally believes great minds achieve greatness when they are set free and are surrounded and challenged by their peers, which is clearly visible throughout our organization. At Elastic, hierarchy does not determine how decisions get made. We feel that anyone needs to be in the position to comment on anything, regardless of their role within the company.What You Will Be DoingWork on new and exciting Elastic products.Develop the APM, Logs, Metrics, Integrations, Agent Management UIs and APIs in Kibana.Collaborate with fellow JavaScript engineers.Collaborate with product design, server team, agent engineers and the Kibana team.What You Will Bring AlongJavaScript programming skillsExperience with one modern MVC style JS FrameworkAbility to work in a fast paced start-up environmentExcellent verbal and written communication skills, a great teammate with strong analytical, problem solving, debugging and troubleshooting skillsStrong preference for Open Source experienceAbility to work independentlyYou might haveExperience with React and TypescriptExperience with Node.jsExperience writing automated testsExposure to Observability, Performance or Availability tools or servicesAdditional Information - We Take Care of Our PeopleAs a distributed company, diversity drives our identity. Whether you‚Äôre looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life. Your age is only a number. It doesn‚Äôt matter if you‚Äôre just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.We strive to have parity of benefits across regions and while regulations differ from place to place, we believe taking care of our people is the right thing to do.Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary Health coverage for you and your family in many locationsAbility to craft your calendar with flexible locations and schedules for many rolesGenerous number of vacation days each yearDouble your charitable giving - We match up to $1500 (or local currency equivalent)Up to 40 hours each year to use toward volunteer projects you loveEmbracing parenthood with minimum of 16 weeks of parental leaveDifferent people approach problems differently. We need that. Elastic is committed to diversity as well as inclusion. We are an equal opportunity employer and committed to the principles of affirmative action. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. If you require any reasonable accessibility support, please complete our Candidate Accessibility Request Form.

description: About The RoleThe EMEA Client Response Data Team requires a Data Research Analyst to provide support for complex data cases that get escalated to our team. You will work closely with Client Service Support, Data Product Management and Data Operations to ensure resolution of these issues. Our analysts are required to research identified issues, ensure timely resolution, and communicate outcomes to all appropriate team members. Timely resolution requires coordinating resources across various data teams. More importantly, you will help in identifying the trends of data cases submitted and come up with strategies to reduce the number of data issues submitted. The position is based in our Data & Development Center EMEA and will report to the Leader of the Client Response Team.Job Responsibilities Demonstrate a high sense of ownership of the issues in the data ticket queue to be responsive and provide timely updates, follow-up, expedition, and resolution. Collaborate strongly with the global data teams Continuously evaluate procedures, create and enhance analytical tools, and implement process improvement projects. Using project management methodology such as LEAN Six Sigma to track, evaluate and determine resolution approach for complex data issues. Act as an expert regarding investment data points and calculations including new financial regulations (Solvency II, MIFID II, etc.) Understand roles, responsibilities, and expertise of internal stakeholders to expedite issue resolution. Translate requests from internal clients into detailed written specifications and user stories.Qualifications A bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent is required Proficient oral and written communication skills. Fluent in English. Fluency in Dutch is preferred. Knowledge of other European languages is advantageous. Collaborates well in a team environment, have the ability to communicate and work with team members from diverse backgrounds, in a conscientious and inclusive way. Sensitive to clients‚Äô needs Solid understanding of the financial industry and passionate about investment data. Strong organizational and time-management skills, capable of handling high volumes of data and meeting strict deadlines You will be collaborating with cross functional teams and leading from the front when it comes to different types of data so experience within data methodology/quality and processes is a big bonus. Previous experience in project management is preferred. A deep customer service focus and strong attention to detail.302_MstarEurServSL Morningstar Europe Services, S.L. Legal Entity

Elastic is a search company built on a free and open heritage. Anyone can use Elastic products and solutions to get started quickly and frictionlessly. Elastic offers three solutions for enterprise search, observability, and security, built on one technology stack that can be deployed anywhere. From finding documents to monitoring infrastructure to hunting for threats, Elastic makes data usable in real time and at scale. Thousands of organizations worldwide, including Cisco, eBay, Goldman Sachs, Microsoft, The Mayo Clinic, NASA, The New York Times, Wikipedia, and Verizon, use Elastic to power mission-critical systems. Founded in 2012, Elastic is a distributed company with Elasticians around the globe and is publicly traded on the NYSE under the symbol ESTC. Learn more at elastic.co.Right now, we are on the lookout for talented Java Engineers to join our Elasticsearch - Distributed Systems team and focus on critical features that affect how Elasticsearch scales and provides reliability to our users. This team maintains critical components of Elasticsearch such as snapshot/restore and replication. You can be based (pretty much) anywhere in the world.What You Will Be DoingPushing the limits on the number of shards, nodes, and petabytes that Elasticsearch can handle todayEnsuring users can reliably backup and restore Elasticsearch at scaleBuilding and enhancing fundamentally hard features such as cross-cluster replication or a changes APIProviding enhanced capabilities for data management Look into all kinds of issues, including performance or concurrency issues, and propose solutions.Supporting our support engineers with the harder problems.What You Will Bring AlongYou have strong skills in core Java and are conversant in the standard library of data structures and concurrency constructs, as well as newer features like lambdas.You have a deep technical proficiency in algorithmsYou have proven your ability to understand and work on complex, highly distributed systems.You are able to take on projects and guide them from beginning to end. This covers both technical design and working with other engineers to develop needed components.You demonstrate the ability to build and debug features with a broad impact on a product and that run on multiple machines.Bonus points for knowledge of:Data storesSearch, analytics, LuceneStrong knowledge of the JDKAdditional Information - We Take Care of Our PeopleAs a distributed company, diversity drives our identity. Whether you‚Äôre looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life. Your age is only a number. It doesn‚Äôt matter if you‚Äôre just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.We strive to have parity of benefits across regions and while regulations differ from place to place, we believe taking care of our people is the right thing to do.Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary Health coverage for you and your family in many locationsAbility to craft your calendar with flexible locations and schedules for many rolesGenerous number of vacation days each yearDouble your charitable giving - We match up to $1500 (or local currency equivalent)Up to 40 hours each year to use toward volunteer projects you loveEmbracing parenthood with minimum of 16 weeks of parental leaveDifferent people approach problems differently. We need that. Elastic is committed to diversity as well as inclusion. We are an equal opportunity employer and committed to the principles of affirmative action. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. description: QualificationsMaster's degree and excellent academic record Initial professional experience in strategic purchasing and/or supply managementExceptional analytical and quantitative problem-solving skillsAbility to work collaboratively in a team environmentProven record of leadership in a work setting and/or through extracurricular activities Mobile and excited to take on longer international assignmentsMobile and excited to take longer international assignmentsAbility to communicate complex ideas effectively, both verbally and in writing, in English and in SpanishWhat You'll DoYou‚Äôll work with colleagues and clients from a wide range of business areas across Europe to develop purchasing strategies that support clients' business objectives and give them a competitive edge.In this client-facing role, you‚Äôll play a key part in driving process improvement, delivering successful business results, and developing broad based strategies for a diverse set of clients. Examples of the type of work associated with this role could include driving strategic sourcing to capture value, defining new operating model by optimizing Source-to-Pay processes through digitally-enabled procurement transformation programs, designing new organizational structure and reporting relationships, and/or instituting rigorous governance and performance-management methods.In addition to working directly with clients, you will also collaborate with colleagues worldwide to build and shape our expertise and approaches to purchasing and supply management optimization, continually developing your own knowledge as well as that of the firm.Your application should be in English and include a cover letter, your CV, and your transcripts (high school, university, etc.) indicating all relevant grades.Who You'll Work WithYou‚Äôll be working with McKinsey‚Äôs Operations practice and will be based in Madrid.Our Operations practice assists our clients in solving complex operational challenges. Blending strategic thinking with hands-on practicality, our teams of consultants and experts work to develop and implement operational strategies that solve our clients' most critical problems.Our Procurement group is part of our Operations practice, providing clients with support and advising their management teams on strategic and operational questions such as global sourcing, e-procurement, supplier development, and the formation of purchasing organizations.You will be part of our Operations Excellence Program (OEP), a two-year training program during which you will acquire the necessary knowledge to help companies achieve excellence in their operations. Along with other members of the OEP community, you will dedicate one day every other week to functional training and knowledge development under the leadership of our operations experts.

description: The Enterprise Account Executive team at Stripe works to help some of the largest and fastest-growing businesses in the world take advantage of Stripe. You‚Äôll lead and coach high-performing sales executives, helping them deliver on ambitious targets, as well as roll up your sleeves to work directly with prospective Stripe customers.We are looking for a self-starting leader who has demonstrated success dealing with ambiguity, operating in a high-growth environment, and solving complicated problems with limited oversight. Ideal candidates will have management and leadership experience scaling a technology sales team, superior communication skills, and a knack for understanding unique customer needs.In This Role You Will Recruit, train and lead a team of sales professionals Build new processes and sales plays for a growing Digital Native & Enterprise business Develop the long-term vision and strategy for the team and manage day-to-day operations, with a focus on performance against key sales metrics. Coach and guide the team in developing consultative and solution-based sales skills through all facets of the sales cycle. Play a personal and direct role in building and maintaining enduring customer relationships, up to C-level. Inspire, motivate and enable personal and career development of team members, both to promote career growth and to increase impact for Stripe. Work collaboratively and cross-functionally across the organisation to help shape Stripe‚Äôs products and solutions to meet customer needs. We Are Ideally Looking For Someone With 10+ years of sales experience and 5+ years of people management experience. Demonstrated experience leading sales in a high-growth technology environment. Ability to hire, train and coach a high-performance sales team. Ability to build strategic executive relationships with customers and industry thought leaders. Demonstrated passion for helping to scale new technology businesses. Ability to understand and articulate technical concepts, and translate them into industry- or business-relevant terms. Nice To Haves Prior experience leading a team in an international office of a US HQ‚Äôd company.  Prior experience in the payments industry.

description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts. Job Category Sales Job Details  We are looking for a passionate people leader with exceptional expertise in building, growing and coaching high performance Solutions Engineering teams for Specialists and Architects in SEMEAReporting to the Leader for Solutions Engineering SEMEA, you will be leading the Solutions Engineering Specialists and Architects organisation across all industries with your management team.As a key member of the SE SEMEA leadership team, you will work closely with the sales leadership and their sales teams in Salesforce to ensure the Solutions Engineering teams are optimised to drive our strategies and growth plans in the region.You Will Be Instrumental In Engaging, Managing And Closing Strategic Deals, Where Salesforce Is Striving To Deliver Business And Data Transformation To Our Customers' Long-term Sustainable Success And Demonstrate a Commitment To Our Core Values Trust Customer Success Innovation EqualityYou are a Forward Thinker, Thought Leader with a passion for our Salesforce Products, Architecture and Digital Transformation and the value it brings. Pivotal to this will be your understanding of industry trends and market opportunities to engage with CXOs in transforming their organisations and providing strategic counsel to CXOs and executives within the data landscape. This will include the ability to advise CXOs and executives on strategies for data transformation, data culture, industry trends and digital innovation in a compelling and engaging fashion. You have numerous examples of bringing new thinking to customers, your team and your current company.You will guide, advise, and support your team of Solutions Engineers in deal shaping , sales partnering as well as manage team resourcing, coaching and career planning. You are instrumental in leading the team through change, scaling, and bringing together the various SEs to work as one team. Being a senior leader of this Solutions Engineering team, you will also be responsible for developing our managers to be our future leaders, and ensuring that there is an effective succession plan.Who You AreThe successful candidate has the breadth and depth of experience in solution and value-based selling, having deep relationships with C-level executives and track record of selling data transformation and wall-to-wall solutions at the C-level.You have demonstrated success in building and managing a high performance Solutions Engineering organisation with a will to win, and continuous improvement, and the ability to evaluate, develop and reshape an existing team as necessary while mentoring and inspiring the team.Additionally, you have a track record of success in the following areas: Exceptional Leadership. An experienced leader who has developed and led managers and individual contributors in the software industry, preferably from a presales/Solutions Engineering perspective or related customer facing functions. Demonstrated success in mentoring and inspiring a Solutions Engineering team to focus on innovation, employee & customer success to drive growth.Stakeholder Management. Proven collaborator and relationship builder up to C-level across multi-functions. Ability to effectively manage internal and external stakeholders to drive results.Technically Astute. Strong background in Solutions Engineering in the enterprise software industry, with a passion for technology, preferably in the data and analytics space ‚Äì Business Intelligence, ETL, Analytics, AI/ML, CRM, Big Data, Data Science and Enterprise Architecture.Strong Communicator. Excellent verbal, written communication, and presentation skills.Adaptable and Transformational. Used to working in high growth, matrix organisation where you have influenced, led and driven change, taking the business to the next level through disruptive thinking and innovation.Data Driven. A highly passionate data advocate with strategic and analytical skills in using data to measure and drive effectiveness and performance.Key ResponsibilitiesHire, Develop, Retain. Lead and grow the Solutions Engineering Specialists & Architect team ensuring we continue to hire and retain top talent in the market, providing career growth opportunities, developing our next-gen leadership and effective succession planning.Leadership. Partner with sales leadership to provide strategy and support for business development, accounts development, pipeline generation and deal management. Ensure each SE is enabled, empowered and accountable to deliver high quality work and excellent customer experience.Focus on Innovation. Ensure the team is constantly improving our approach to solution and value-based selling. Drive strategic initiatives and programs as needed to actively drive growth and support the teams career development and advancement.Executive Engagement. Develop and deliver outstanding Analytics Vision, Point of View and Value Proposition to all levels of an organisation including CXOs and executive management. Build and nurture C-level relationships across key accounts to solidify our partnership and commitment to the customers, while penetrating deeper within accounts.Core Values. Embody Salesforce values and provide exemplary leadership. Accommodations If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form. Posting Statement At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesfore.com or Salesforce.org.Salesforce welcomes all.

description: QualificationsMaster's degree (‚ÄúLicenciatura‚Äù) in finance, economics, business administration, actuarial or engineering obtained within the last 4 yearsPrevious experience in the insurance industry is an advantageStrong experience in Excel and PowerPoint; advanced software knowledge (e.g. Alteryx, Tableau, etc.) is a plusExcellent problem solving and analytical skills Strong interest and ability to collect, analyze and synthesize data Ability to work collaboratively in a team environmentSkills to communicate complex ideas effectively and in a structured mannerFluency in Portuguese, Spanish and English (spoken and written); other languages like German, French and/or Dutch is a plusWhat You'll DoYou will develop a strong understanding of the insurance industry, products, players and functions in Europe with a special focus on Iberia.In this role, you will be involved in client development activities, knowledge creation support and internal and external reputation building initiatives. Through project-based work and collaboration with colleagues, you will deal with new intellectual challenges daily and improve key management skills like problem-solving, communication structuring or effective team working, among many others.You will also be responsible for presenting results of your research to consultants at all tenures, while getting their always constructive feedback in a recurrent way in order to help you in your development. You‚Äôll have the opportunity to gain new skills and build on the strengths you bring to the firm. You will receive exceptional training as well as frequent coaching and mentoring from colleagues.The offer is for a period of 6-24 months depending on the candidate's availability.Please note that your CV should be in English.Who You'll Work WithYou will work in our Barcelona office as part of our Panorama Financial Institutions and Insights Consulting (PFIC) - Insurance Client Capabilities Network (CCN) team. You will support a C&I specialist and a C&I expert directly in serving Iberian insurance clients.During your internship, you will work and collaborate on a daily basis with both consultants and members of our PFIC team of multiple markets across the globe with special relevance of European colleagues.You will feel part of a much broader team, always accessible to support you and provide you development opportunities in the firm.

description: About FTI ConsultingFTI Consulting is a global business advisory firm, dedicated to helping organisations navigate and manage a diverse range of complex issues and business challenges. Our expertise covers the spectrum of Corporate Finance & Restructuring, Economic Consulting, Forensic & Litigation Consulting, Strategic Communications and Technology. We are a company of more than 4,600 professionals with annual revenues in excess of $1.8 billion, with offices located in every major business centre in the world.Our professionals are some of the most experienced leaders in their fields, and advise across a range of industries. Our clients engage us for high-stakes concerns or emerging opportunities that require specialised expertise, and over the past two decades we have been engaged to work behind the headlines on some of the biggest news stories to date.FTI Consulting is a fast growing and vibrant place to work. Steered by our values of Integrity, Creativity, Achievement, Empathy and Respect, its meritocratic culture invites both collaboration and healthy debate. We are large enough to be trusted by our clients to solve their biggest issues and yet small enough to know our colleagues on a personal level enabling better team working and a supportive culture to develop your career goals and ambitions.About Technology:Our Technology practice helps clients manage the risk and cost of e-discovery. From forensic data collection to fully managed document review services we collaborate with our clients to deliver strategic solutions tailored to their unique legal requirements. With keen focus on the productivity and defensibility of document review, clients rely on our comprehensive portfolio of software and services expertise and address matters ranging from internal investigations to large-scale litigation with global e-discovery requirements.About the Role:This Consultant position is a part of FTI Consulting's E-discovery Consulting and Digital Forensic team. From the Technology segment we are in the position to deliver to our clients a large portfolio of services which includes the application of a comprehensive computer forensic methodology which includes the Identification, preservation, processing and analysis of ESI in order to present evidences for all purposes that can be used in any kind of litigation or internal investigation, in addition, following a partnership with Relativity, we are able to provide clients with the combination of E-Discovery wide experience and our own flagship web-based document repository, Ringtail.As part of the Madrid based team, the Consultant will be cross-trained in various Digital Forensics and E-discovery skills and will assist on all phases of our projects.Key Responsibilities:You will be part of a cross-functional team that manages all areas related to the identification, collection, extraction, migration, processing, analysis, conversion, quality assurance, tracking, and management of client data. This could involve: Liaising with clients and project managers regarding client requests and manage expectations. Utilise industry standard and bespoke software to access, extract and handle data from phones, mobile devices, computers and storage media, following forensic standards, on-site, at client premises, around Spain and abroad. Use of worldwide recognised tools to preserve data maintaining in all times the corresponding Chain of Custody, ensuring data integrity during all phases. Utilising industry standard and bespoke software to access, extract and cull data from electronic evidence sources. Assuming responsibility for day-to-day data processing, conversion, analysis, quality control, import and other specialized tasks including interaction with other consultants, supervisors, and client personnel. Co-ordinating closely with colleagues within and across teams to manage the delivery of client requirements. Being customer-service-oriented to meet client deadlines, including working out of business hours when necessary. Travelling as required to ensure effective management of case activities. (Minimal notice possible). Education and Qualifications: Minimum 2:1 degree in law or a technology focused subject such as computer science, forensic computing or information systems, or equivalent experience. Fluent in Spanish and English is required.Skills and Competencies: Technically savvy with a strong proficiency in Microsoft Windows and related software, especially Microsoft Office applications (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.). Self developer that demonstrates an ability to solve complex problems with well thought out innovative solutions. Ability to manage time and prioritise tasks effectively. Ability to work effectively as part of a team and support the team's goals above individual goals. Ability to work in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment while handling multiple tasks through completion. Good communicator who can perform in a client facing role. Flexible with working hours and has the ability to work in a cross-functional team. Experience: Familiarity with personal computer and server hardware, operating systems and software, possibly having some experience of working in a computer forensics, e-Discovery or technology related role or university project. Familiarity with forensic principles and technologies. Desirable knowledge and experience in the use of Computer Forensic tools such as Encase, Nuix, FTK, UFED, Oxygen Forensics, BlackBag, among others. Knowledge of and experiencing in configuring and operating Ringtail, Relativity or any other e-discovery tool as a document review management application desirable . Use of Concordance, Summation or Introspect desirable. A good understanding of transact SQL and relational databases desirable. Knowledge of data manipulation, data conversion, and data analysis activities in a SQL database and MS Access desirable. Familiarity with email server software (Microsoft Exchange, Lotus Notes) desirable. Knowledge of programming (Python, Java, Visual Basic, PowerShell) desirable. We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.

description: Do you have an appetite for all things Food & Beverage? Are you as keen as mustard where service is concerned, whilst ensuring back of house is in order - whether it be a plate full of numbers, setting a rota or laying the table for a successful team. Then why not come and join us at the Radisson Hotel Group to Make Every Moment Matter! where our guests can relax and enjoy the experience!Our Food & Beverage Service Team are sophisticated hosts with an instinctive ability to anticipate guests‚Äô needs by being in the right place at the right time and delivering a hospitality experience that goes above and beyond - creating memorable moments for our guests.As Food & Beverage Supervisor, you will join a team that is passionate about delivering exceptional service where we believe that anything is possible, whilst having fun in all that we do!Interested then why not say Yes I Can! as we are looking for passionate people just like you!Key Responsibilities of the Food & Beverage Supervisor:Supports the smooth running of the food & beverage department, where all aspects of the guest food & beverage service experience are delivered to the highest levelsWorks proactively to improve guest satisfaction and comfort, delivering a positive and timely response to guest enquiriesDelivers on plans and objectives where food & beverage initiatives & hotel targets are achievedSupervises the food & beverage team fostering a culture of growth, development and performance within the departmentAccountable for ensuring that costs and inventory are controlled, that productivity and performance levels are attainedBuilds and maintains effective working relationships with all key stakeholdersTakes the lead to deliver departmental programmes that advance service standards, profitability and cost controlEnsures adherence and compliance to all legislation where due diligence requirements and best practice activities are planned, delivered and documented for internal and external audit, performing follow-up as requiredRequirements of the Food & Beverage Supervisor:Experience in food & beverage serviceStrong supervisory and managerial skills with a hands-on approach and lead-by-example work styleCommitment to delivering exceptional guest service with a passion for the hospitality industryAbility to find creative solutions with proven problem-solving capabilities offering support where requiredPersonal integrity, with the ability to work in an environment that demands excellence, time and energyExperience of working with IT systems on various platformsStrong communication skills Fluent in spanish and englishCAREERSJoin us in our mission to make every moment matter for our guests and be part of the most inspired hotel company in the world. At Radisson Hotel Group we believe that people are our number one asset. As one of the world‚Äôs largest hotel companies, we are always looking for great people to join our team. If this sounds like an ambition you share, then start with us.To find out more about the Radisson Hotel Group, our Culture and Beliefs, then why not visit us at careers.radissonhotels.com.

description: Thrive in the dynamic and challenging environment of a contract development and manufacturing organization. Driven to excel through self-leadership and thriving team engagement. If this describes you, then look no further than LSNE. We have the experience, expertise and a successful track record in completing development of life-changing pharmaceuticals and medical devices. Together with our clients, we work to bring about treatment of many forms of cancers, Diabetes, communicable diseases, and many other illnesses. Come make a difference. Your work will matter and your contributions will be significant in these endeavors. Join our team!FunctionsPerform their duties following quality criteria, health and safety standards. Carry out the functions of their position in accordance with the Behavioral Values established by the company. Work in accordance with GMP regulations. Report the work done and the needs of the Microbiological Quality Control department to the person in charge of the quality unit. Supervision and control of the work performed by the personnel under their charge. Administration and control of the department's resources and materials. Preparation, review, approval and control of the GMP documentation generated in the microbiological quality control laboratory. Maintain updated GMP documentation that applies to the microbiological quality control laboratory. Verification and management of new monographs and updates in Pharmacopoeias. Management, investigation and participation in the actions of the quality events detected in the microbiological quality control laboratory: results out of specifications (OOS), out of trend (OOT), deviations, Change Controls (CC) and Preventive Actions and corrections (CAPA), claims, rejections and withdrawals. Verification and monitoring of the execution of environmental and personnel controls to ensure microbiological control in the different areas. Management, review and monitoring of clothing qualifications for entry to classified rooms. Supervision and control of staff behavior in classified and unclassified rooms. Initial and continuous training of the Microbiological Quality Control Laboratory staff, in the different instrumental techniques and procedures that apply. Coordinate, together with the staff of the Quality Control laboratory, the calibration, verification and maintenance of the department's equipment. Supervision and maintenance of the organization and cleaning of the laboratory. Supervision and interpretation of microbiological results. Preparation, review and evaluation of trends generated in the microbiological quality control laboratory. Management and defense during internal and external audits (clients or competent authorities) as well as visits that take place within the Microbiological Quality Control laboratory. Collaboration with the quality assurance department for the establishment of corrective and / or preventive action plans. Preparation of the necessary documentation for registration processes and collaboration in answering deficiency letters. Report the department's KPls according to the established frequency. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified.

description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts. Job Category Sales Job Details Due to the continued growth of our public sector sales teams we are now seeking a proven leader to manage and grow our Public Sector sales team across EMEA. This role reports into the Senior Vice President, Sales, EMEA.The AVP, Public Sector leader will lead the broader EMEA public sector team, will be able to articulate the value of cloud computing to government, and has a proven track record of direct sales and sales management success in software or technology consulting across Public Sector verticals of Government, (Local & Central), Education and Health. An extensive network of senior government relationships will be required to support both the delivery of our Tableau values and growth with EMEA Government customers.What‚Äôs in it for you?This is a high growth opportunity working with our Global Public Sector Business Unit that will see you at the forefront of new technology on the market leading Tableau Platform. With a business culture that has the customer‚Äôs interests at the core of everything we do, Tableau will set you up for success.Responsibilities Lead the go to market strategy for the EMEA Public Sector market to achieve high levels of both revenue growth and customer success.  Second line leadership of Regional VP‚Äôs across EMEA.  Accurately manage the sales forecasting process for the assigned territory.  Lead and coach the team to achieve/exceed their annual sales quotas by thoroughly qualifying all leads and sales opportunities and to leverage business from new and established relationships.  Partner closely with the Tableau and Salesforce teams and contribute positively across the functions.  Work closely with our Tableau and Salesforce Partner ecosystems in support of our developing and delivering Tableau solutions.  Assist the Account Managers to drive strategic initiatives into the targeted communications accounts.  To lead and coach strategy development and execution, negotiations and close business. Minimum Qualifications At least 10 years in a senior direct sales management role.  Consistent over-achievement of quota, revenue goals, and delivering revenue growth.  Experience in application software sales to enterprise and public sector customers.  Demonstrable experience in building successful sales teams.  Knowledge of the Analytics/BI industry ideally, along with its value to Public Sector  Strong commercial skills and experience.  An extensive network of senior government relationships across a variety of Government accounts. Desired Skills Background working in the IT Software industry, ideally within Analytics/BI arena;  Experience in enterprise software sales, with a strong preference within Public Sector  Experience in IT Consultancy and Advisory services.  Accommodations If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form. description: Spain | Remote | Work from Home |¬øAmas los datos? ¬øVives en espania? ¬øQuieres trabajar de forma remota? ¬°Sea parte de este equipo!Why you?Are you a Mysql DBA who lives in Portugal? Do you want to work remotely? Are you community minded? Do you blog, contribute to the Open Source community? Are you inspired by ever-shifting challenges, constant growth and collaboration with a team of peers who push you constantly to up your game? At Pythian, we are actively shaping what it means to be an open-source database engineer and administrator, and we want you to be a part of the world‚Äôs top team of MongoDB, Cassandra, PostgreSQL and MySQL professionals.What will you be doing?As a MySQL Database Consultant (DBC) you will work as part of Pythian's open source team and supply complete support for all aspects of database and application infrastructure to a variety of our customers. Our collaborative Mongo environment means everyone works together to solve complex puzzles and develop innovative solutions for our customers. You'll work closely with the customer teams to understand their needs, in both a project based and long term support capacity.You'll create and document database standards, create optimized queries, indexes, and data structure.Monitor and support database environments and serve as an escalation point for complex troubleshooting and interactive production support.Use database vendor provided tools and Pythian developed accelerators to performance tune various database system, specific queries and applications scenarios.Diagnose and address database performance issues using performance monitors and various tuning techniques.Identify areas of opportunity and recommend appropriate improvement suggestions.Cross-functional training in NoSQL, Site Reliability Engineering and DevOps methodologies are encouraged.When you're not fixing things, you'll be authoring new blog posts on interesting topics for our open-source community to digest, creating new articles in our customer facing knowledge base for more frequently seen issues, and hosting webinars amongst other things like participating in conferences and meetups promoting Pythian to the open source community.What do we need from you?While we understand you might not have everything on the list, to be the successful candidate for the MySQL DBC job you are likely to have skills such as;Knowledge and experience in installing, configuring and upgrading MySQL databases & tools relevant in MySQL Administration. Experience administering PostgreSQL in virtualized and cloud environments, especially AWS, GCP or Azure.Experience with scripting (bash/python) and software development (C++, Java, Go) Automation technologies such as Ansible, Terraform, Puppet, Chef, SALT experience.Debugging skills and the ability to troubleshoot methodically, identifying and applying fixes for known errors, and when necessary, capacity to think outside of the box to resolve complex issuesVery good documentation skills.Our perfect candidate would also have strong knowledge with prior production experience of PostgreSQL alsoNice to haves include; Understanding of current IT service standards such as ITIL. Being a contributor to Open Source projects relevant to PostgreSQL, MySQL or other database or infrastructure software.Por qu√© elegir Pythian?Utilizamos las √∫ltimas tecnolog√≠as y metodolog√≠as y ofrecemos:Salario y beneficios competitivos.Un entorno que inspira la innovaci√≥n.Horarios flexibles que permiten el equilibrio entre trabajo y una vida sana.Programas de incentivo diferenciados (certificaciones, entrenamientos, indicaciones, etc.) ¬°Sea parte de este equipo!Why PythianPythian excels at helping businesses use their data and cloud to transform how they compete and win in this ever-changing environment by delivering advanced on-prem, hybrid, cloud and multi-cloud solutions to solve the toughest data challenges faster and better than anyone else. Founded and headquartered in Ottawa, Canada in 1997, Pythian now has more than 300 employees located around the globe with over 350 clients spanning industries from SaaS; media; gaming; financial services; e-commerce and more. Pythian is known for its technology-enabled data expertise covering everything from ETL to ML. We pride ourselves on our ability to deliver innovative solutions that meet the specific data goals of each client and have built meaningful partnerships with major cloud vendors AWS, Google and Microsoft. The powerful combination of our extensive expertise in data and cloud and our ability to keep on top of the latest bleeding edge technologies make us the perfect partner to help mid and large-sized businesses transform to stay ahead in today‚Äôs rapidly changing digital economy. If you are a MySQL Database Consultant; live in anywhere in Spain; love your data and want to love your career then join us!DisclaimerFor this job an equivalent combination of education and experience, which results in demonstrated ability to apply skills will also be considered.Pythian is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.The successful applicant will need to fulfill the requirements necessary to obtain a background check.Applicants must be legally authorized to work in their country of residence permanently‚Äì Pythian will not relocate, sponsor, or file petitions of any kind on behalf of a foreign worker to gain a work visa, become a permanent resident based on a permanent job offer, or to otherwise obtain authorization to work.No recruitment agencies

description: Spain | Remote | Work from Home |¬øAmas los datos? ¬øVives en espania? ¬øQuieres trabajar de forma remota? ¬°Sea parte de este equipo!Why you?Are you a Mysql DBA who lives in Portugal? Do you want to work remotely? Are you community minded? Do you blog, contribute to the Open Source community? Are you inspired by ever-shifting challenges, constant growth and collaboration with a team of peers who push you constantly to up your game? At Pythian, we are actively shaping what it means to be an open-source database engineer and administrator, and we want you to be a part of the world‚Äôs top team of MongoDB, Cassandra, PostgreSQL and MySQL professionals.What will you be doing?As a MySQL Database Consultant (DBC) you will work as part of Pythian's open source team and supply complete support for all aspects of database and application infrastructure to a variety of our customers. Our collaborative Mongo environment means everyone works together to solve complex puzzles and develop innovative solutions for our customers. You'll work closely with the customer teams to understand their needs, in both a project based and long term support capacity.You'll create and document database standards, create optimized queries, indexes, and data structure.Monitor and support database environments and serve as an escalation point for complex troubleshooting and interactive production support.Use database vendor provided tools and Pythian developed accelerators to performance tune various database system, specific queries and applications scenarios.Diagnose and address database performance issues using performance monitors and various tuning techniques.Identify areas of opportunity and recommend appropriate improvement suggestions.Cross-functional training in NoSQL, Site Reliability Engineering and DevOps methodologies are encouraged.When you're not fixing things, you'll be authoring new blog posts on interesting topics for our open-source community to digest, creating new articles in our customer facing knowledge base for more frequently seen issues, and hosting webinars amongst other things like participating in conferences and meetups promoting Pythian to the open source community.What do we need from you?While we understand you might not have everything on the list, to be the successful candidate for the MySQL DBC job you are likely to have skills such as;Knowledge and experience in installing, configuring and upgrading MySQL databases & tools relevant in MySQL Administration. Experience administering PostgreSQL in virtualized and cloud environments, especially AWS, GCP or Azure.Experience with scripting (bash/python) and software development (C++, Java, Go) Automation technologies such as Ansible, Terraform, Puppet, Chef, SALT experience.Debugging skills and the ability to troubleshoot methodically, identifying and applying fixes for known errors, and when necessary, capacity to think outside of the box to resolve complex issuesVery good documentation skills.Our perfect candidate would also have strong knowledge with prior production experience of PostgreSQL alsoNice to haves include; Understanding of current IT service standards such as ITIL. Being a contributor to Open Source projects relevant to PostgreSQL, MySQL or other database or infrastructure software.Por qu√© elegir Pythian?Utilizamos las √∫ltimas tecnolog√≠as y metodolog√≠as y ofrecemos:Salario y beneficios competitivos.Un entorno que inspira la innovaci√≥n.Horarios flexibles que permiten el equilibrio entre trabajo y una vida sana.Programas de incentivo diferenciados (certificaciones, entrenamientos, indicaciones, etc.) ¬°Sea parte de este equipo!Why PythianPythian excels at helping businesses use their data and cloud to transform how they compete and win in this ever-changing environment by delivering advanced on-prem, hybrid, cloud and multi-cloud solutions to solve the toughest data challenges faster and better than anyone else. Founded and headquartered in Ottawa, Canada in 1997, Pythian now has more than 300 employees located around the globe with over 350 clients spanning industries from SaaS; media; gaming; financial services; e-commerce and more. Pythian is known for its technology-enabled data expertise covering everything from ETL to ML. We pride ourselves on our ability to deliver innovative solutions that meet the specific data goals of each client and have built meaningful partnerships with major cloud vendors AWS, Google and Microsoft. The powerful combination of our extensive expertise in data and cloud and our ability to keep on top of the latest bleeding edge technologies make us the perfect partner to help mid and large-sized businesses transform to stay ahead in today‚Äôs rapidly changing digital economy. If you are a MySQL Database Consultant; live in anywhere in Spain; love your data and want to love your career then join us!DisclaimerFor this job an equivalent combination of education and experience, which results in demonstrated ability to apply skills will also be considered.Pythian is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.The successful applicant will need to fulfill the requirements necessary to obtain a background check.Applicants must be legally authorized to work in their country of residence permanently‚Äì Pythian will not relocate, sponsor, or file petitions of any kind on behalf of a foreign worker to gain a work visa, become a permanent resident based on a permanent job offer, or to otherwise obtain authorization to work.No recruitment agencies

description: Buscamos a un candidato con ganas de trabajar, experiencia en un puesto similar de venta y recomendaci√≥n activa de dermocosmetica, aromaterapia, productos naturales, productos de micronutrici√≥n. Imprescindible ingl√©s y se valorar√°n otros idiomas ( Ruso, chino, franc√©s, alem√°n).Formar√°s partes de un equipo multidisciplinar con muy buen rollo de trabajo!Envia tu C.V. a hello@farmaciaprincesabcn.com.

QualificationsMasters degree and excellent academic record Previous experience in operations, e.g. implementation of lean manufacturing concepts or Six Sigma, digital manufacturingExceptional analytical and quantitative problem-solving skillsAbility to work collaboratively in a team environmentProven record of leadership in a work setting and/or through extracurricular activities Mobile and excited to take on longer international assignmentsAbility to communicate complex ideas effectively, both verbally and in writing, in English and in SpanishWhat You'll DoYou will work in teams of consultants providing expertise in engineering and manufacturing, helping clients to achieve new performance highs.In this role, you will make an important contribution to the analysis, design, and implementation of lean manufacturing and management approaches, developing tailor-made solutions and working closely with clients to ensure positive impact and sustainable results.In addition to working directly with clients, you will also share your experience and insights with colleagues internationally, thereby expanding our knowledge and refining our approaches in the field of lean management.Your application should be in English and include a cover letter, your CV, and your transcripts (high school, university, etc.) indicating all relevant grades.Who You'll Work WithYou‚Äôll be joining our office in Madrid and working with McKinsey‚Äôs Operations practice in Europe. Our Operations practice assists our clients in solving complex operational challenges. Blending strategic thinking with hands-on practicality, our teams of consultants and experts work to develop and implement operational strategies that solve our clients' most critical problems.Our Manufacturing service line is part of our Operations Practice and helps leading companies in all industries develop and implement future-oriented lean manufacturing strategies. Our clients include leading companies worldwide from a wide range of industries. We offer their managements support and advice on strategic and operational questions relating to Manufacturing.You will be part of our Operations Excellence Program OEP), a two-year training program during which you will acquire the necessary knowledge to help companies achieve excellence in their operations. Along with other members of the OEP community, you will dedicate one day every other week to functional training and knowledge development under the leadership of our operations experts.
