Experience administering PostgreSQL in virtualized and cloud environments, especially AWS, GCP or Azure.Experience with scripting (bash/python) and software development (C++, Java, Go) Automation technologies such as Ansible, Terraform, Puppet, Chef, SALT experience.Debugging skills and the ability to troubleshoot methodically, identifying and applying fixes for known errors, and when necessary, capacity to think outside of the box to resolve complex issuesVery good documentation skills.Our perfect candidate would also have strong knowledge with prior production experience of PostgreSQL alsoNice to haves include; Understanding of current IT service standards such as ITIL. Being a contributor to Open Source projects relevant to PostgreSQL, MySQL or other database or infrastructure software.Por qu√© elegir Pythian?Utilizamos las √∫ltimas tecnolog√≠as y metodolog√≠as y ofrecemos:Salario y beneficios competitivos.Un entorno que inspira la innovaci√≥n.Horarios flexibles que permiten el equilibrio entre trabajo y una vida sana.Programas de incentivo diferenciados (certificaciones, entrenamientos, indicaciones, etc.) ¬°Sea parte de este equipo!Why PythianPythian excels at helping businesses use their data and cloud to transform how they compete and win in this ever-changing environment by delivering advanced on-prem, hybrid, cloud and multi-cloud solutions to solve the toughest data challenges faster and better than anyone else. Founded and headquartered in Ottawa, Canada in 1997, Pythian now has more than 300 employees located around the globe with over 350 clients spanning industries from SaaS; media; gaming; financial services; e-commerce and more. Pythian is known for its technology-enabled data expertise covering everything from ETL to ML. We pride ourselves on our ability to deliver innovative solutions that meet the specific data goals of each client and have built meaningful partnerships with major cloud vendors AWS, Google and Microsoft. The powerful combination of our extensive expertise in data and cloud and our ability to keep on top of the latest bleeding edge technologies make us the perfect partner to help mid and large-sized businesses transform to stay ahead in today‚Äôs rapidly changing digital economy. If you are a MySQL Database Consultant; live in anywhere in Spain; love your data and want to love your career then join us!DisclaimerFor this job an equivalent combination of education and experience, which results in demonstrated ability to apply skills will also be considered.Pythian is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.The successful applicant will need to fulfill the requirements necessary to obtain a background check.Applicants must be legally authorized to work in their country of residence permanently‚Äì Pythian will not relocate, sponsor, or file petitions of any kind on behalf of a foreign worker to gain a work visa, become a permanent resident based on a permanent job offer, or to otherwise obtain authorization to work.No recruitment agencies

description: WHAT WE DO MATTERS:Here at Bodas.net (The Knot Worldwide) we believe in doing work that matters. In 16 countries around the world, our leading family of brands (The Knot, WeddingWire, Bodas, GigMasters, The Bump, How They Asked, Lasting, and more) inspire, inform, and celebrate our communities as they move through life‚Äôs milestones. From the proposal to creating a home, and starting a family together, we‚Äôre there for every step of the journey. Our couples and business partners depend on us. They're all in. So are we.ABOUT THE ROLE AND OUR TEAM:We are looking for a highly motivated engineering leader with a passion for leading teams to create elegant and scalable software for our users. The right person will have a proven track record delivering engaging, consumer focused products within a data driven, agile environment. In this role you will lead a talented engineering team, partner with product development, and actively participate in both tactical and strategic conversations to determine the evolution of our products.The Knot Invitations is an exciting new line of business for The Knot Worldwide and we are making significant investments in our offering. This role has significant growth opportunity and visibility to stakeholders including the CEO, CPO, and CTO. The Engineering Manager for this team will work cross-organizationally to drive technical architecture vision and be a strong partner to product and design to establish OKRs and set technical vision to achieve business objectives.RESPONSIBILITIES: Oversee an engineering team responsible for our Invitations product vertical.  Ensure the team is operating effectively to reach their goals, are properly supported and deliver quality software. Evolve our platform into a sustainable architecture that supports iterative and fast development. Develop, coach, and mentor multiple engineers at various stages of their career to ensure growth and cultivate emerging leaders. Provide leadership within the team to ensure solutions are built in alignment with company principles. Actively participate in Agile ceremonies including pre-IPM, IPM, standups, and retros. Partner with product and design to plan and deliver OKRs. Actively participate in establishing the broader technical and product strategy that supports our company goals. Partner with Principal Engineers and Architects to set the vision and create the tech roadmap to effectively operate this product and platform. Formulate and proactively look for opportunities to improve the overall effectiveness of the teams. Collaborate with the broader zone and company on key technical initiatives. SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATES HAVE THE FOLLOWING SKILLS: Have 7+ years of proven industry experience with 3+ years of experience leading engineering teams. Deep understanding of distributed system design utilizing both relational and non-relational data stores. Experience working within an Agile based environment. A track record of shipping successful consumer facing products. Possess strong written and verbal communication skills. Comfortable managing multiple work streams and coordinating resources across teams and products. Thrives in a collaborative work culture with teammates located in-office or remote across multiple locations in the US and abroad. Knowledge of A/B testing software and techniques is a plus. The Knot Worldwide provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, or disability.

description: Marketing Intern ‚Äì Italian MarketAbout the jobThis is a paid marketing internship position that will support the Marketing team for Le Mini Macaron with Italian market activation. INTERESTED CANDIDATES SHOULD SEND CV AND COVER LETTER (ENGLISH ONLY) TO CAMELIABEAUTYJOBS@GMAIL.COM. DUE TO HIGH VOLUME OF APPLICANTS, ONLY THESE SUBMISSIONS WILL BE CONSIDERED. NOTE: POSITION IS BASED IN BARCELONA AT OUR OFFICE (THIS IS NOT A REMOTE WORKING POSITION). Key DutiesWork directly with social media manager in activation and day-to-day management of Italian social media platforms.Daily social media engagement with Italian Le Mini Macaron community and the Italian nail, fashion and beauty industry.Assist with Italian community management; answer questions and concerns on our Italian Instagram and Facebook.Assist with Italian PR: influencer pitches and follow up, press releases, research and press clippings.Assist with Influencer/PR mailers preparation and shipment.Engish-Italian translation as needed. The ideal candidate has the following qualities and experience: Marketing school degree with a strong creative backgroundExcellent written and oral communication skills in Italian and English. Spanish will be a plus.High-level knowledge of the following social media platforms: Instagram, Tik Tok, Facebook and Pinterest.Creative and aware of all social media trends.Comfortable appearing on camera.High attention to detail, organized, and the ability to multitaskQuick learner and adapts to a fast-paced environmentSelf-motivated and good time managementSense of urgency and good time management skillsPrior experience in beauty preferred DurationMinimum 6 months, full timeAbout Camelia BeautyCamelia Beauty is a beauty start-up that was originally created 8 years ago in Shanghai. We are a young, dynamic and international company that has created the brand Le Mini Macaron, which is sold in Sephora, ULTA, ASOS, Galeries Lafayette, La Rinascente, Urban Outfitters, Feelunique, and other beauty retailers and department stores. Our brand has been featured in such leading media as Elle, Marie Claire, Cosmopolitan, Glamour, Teen Vogue, Refinery 29, PopSugar, NYLON, and many others. We are looking for dynamic, creative and motivated individuals to join our team. www.leminimacaron.com / www.leminimacaron.euInstagram: @leminimacaron#leminimacaron

To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts. Job Category Products and Technology Job Details Team OverviewThe Office of Ethical and Humane Use (OEHU) was formed with a mandate to ensure that Salesforce technology is used to help, not harm, society and uphold the basic human rights of every human being.OEHU is seeking a Senior Manager/ Director to play a pivotal role in the development of product policies around the Ethical and Humane Use of Salesforce Technology and serve as the EMEA lead for our Office. Working together with the Chief Ethical and Humane Use Officer and policy team, they will deliver product policy recommendations and implementation strategies across Salesforce that shape the use of our technology in alignment with Salesforce‚Äôs ethical use principles.Role OverviewThe ideal candidate will have Trust & Safety and/or product policy experience within a technology company. They will have an understanding of the potential societal repercussions of emerging technologies and familiarity with principles that can be used to govern and resolve related ethical issues. You will engage regional stakeholders to capture and integrate a wide range of perspectives into our product policy making process The candidate will have strong research experience and analytical skills to gather facts, assess patterns and recommend a path forward. You will work with Legal, Product, and Security teams to implement solutions to assure our technology is used for good.Job ResponsibilitiesIncorporate research and stakeholder expertise to craft new and/or update existing product use policies that focus on the ethical and humane use of Salesforce technologies.Act as a regional point of contact for the Office of Ethical and Humane Use and maintain close working relationships with senior stakeholders across the business to ensure alignment in applying product policy principles and addressing ethical risk in international markets.Coordinate with Global Strategy teams to identify and assess ethical product use in international markets.Collaborate with Product teams to craft product-specific policy applications and automation tools.Conduct investigations, enforce our product policies, and identify product vulnerabilities and ethical risks.Stay informed about the dynamic global regulatory landscape, industry trends, and internal operations. Help Ethical and Humane Use team quickly make sense of large volumes of information to determine how global events may impact the use of Salesforce‚Äôs platform and its customers.Minimum Requirements7+ years of relevant work experience in Trust & Safety, Product Policy, or similar roles in a technology company.Experience working on topics across diverse international markets.Preferred RequirementsDemonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced environment and juggle competing priorities.Demonstrated cross-functional team influence.Strong analytical ability-- able to take a complex problem, synthesize detailed information from multiple sources, and construct nuanced top-line recommendations on the path forward. Ability to consider an issue from multiple points of view and weigh the merits of all perspectives.Strong communication skills-- comfortable presenting ideas to diverse teams and individuals in multiple formats, from slide decks, memos, to informal chats. You know that a huge part of communication is listening and making sure others feel heard.Product policy writing experience- ability to assess the pros and cons of various policy options and their potential unintended effects and pitfalls.Strong understanding of the ethical challenges related to diverse communities in interacting with technology.Project management experience- Measurable success in running complex programs from conception to completion. Ability to manage multiple competing projects and maintain high degree of organization.Fluency in English and other European languages.Strong awareness of geopolitical landscape. Accommodations If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Job Category Sales Job Details The Account Executive role at Salesforce could be the right fit for your career move. We are currently recruiting high-energy, driven Account Executive with relevant experience in Software or IT Solution sales, value-driven sales approach. Ideal candidates should possess strong B2B sales and account management experience and a good knowledge of clients in Spain. Salesforce offers a fast-paced, innovative environment where you will be provided the tools, resources, and outstanding leadership to sell business application solutions. These individuals are committed to winning, but also benefit from seasoned leadership and an incredible, loyal and passionate customer base ideal for up-selling and cross-selling our growing suite of Cloud Computing applications and platform.Job Details Learn Salesforce award winning products, platform and value proposition Work in partnership with our team of Business Developers, Pre-sales and marketers for all sales leads and sales opportunities Drive a high volume of sales by managing the complete sales process on an assigned territory Assigned to Mid Market accounts in Spain Up-selling and leveraging business from new and established customer relationships Strengthen client relationships through regular engagement and face-to-face meetings Managing industry events and user groups to generate market interest Attend industry recognised sales training programmes Further development of sales techniques through our Sales Academy, Bootcamp and Sales Productivity teamsRequirementsfor the Role 5 years Technology sales experience (preferably Software or Business Applications) Solid sales forecasting abilities and revenue achievement Successful history of net new business sales ideally with Mid-Size Customers A background in inbound and outbound prospecting and closing of new business Consistent overachievement of quota and revenue goals Fluent in Spanish and EnglishAbout SalesforceSalesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. The company was founded on three disruptive ideas: a new technology model in cloud computing, a pay-as-you-go business model, and a new integrated corporate philanthropy model. These founding principles have taken our company to great heights, including being named one of Forbes‚Äôs ‚ÄúWorld‚Äôs Most Innovative Company‚Äù five years in a row and one of Fortune‚Äôs ‚Äú100 Best Companies to Work For‚Äù eight years in a row. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, and this level of growth equals incredible opportunities to grow a career at Salesforce. Together, with our whole Ohana (Hawaiian for "family") made up of our employees, customers, partners and communities, we are working to improve the state of the world. description: About CSS Compliance Solutions Strategies (CSS) is a trusted global RegTech partner that uniquely brings together innovative technology- driven solutions to support financial services firms in navigating a clear and strategic path through the complex and fragmented global regulatory space. Our solutions and services help firms meet regulatory deadlines while optimizing compliance data, operations and technology. CSS covers a full range of global compliance disciplines spanning fund reporting, transaction reporting, investment monitoring, compliance management, compliance services and managed services with a complementary, centralized approach to the strategic management of regulatory data called RBOR (Regulatory Book of Record). For more information on CSS, please visit: www.cssregtech.com. Job SummaryAs a member of the CSS Software Development team, you will participate in the frontend design and development of a brand new online regulatory reporting system. CSS is an equal opportunity employer

description: Summary At the Apple Store, you connect business professionals and entrepreneurs with what they need in order to put Apple solutions to work in their businesses. As a Business Expert, you help them learn about Apple products and explore various possibilities. You‚Äôre part of a team that‚Äôs passionate about helping businesses succeed. With your understanding of business needs and enthusiasm for Apple, you find great satisfaction in offering powerful, innovative solutions to each customer.  Key Qualifications Understanding of how businesses use technology and what Apple solutions can offer them.Comfort using the phone to interact with customers and to position business solutions.Ability to facilitate business experiences through in-store briefings, workshops, and events. Description As a Business Expert, you introduce Apple solutions, technology, and services to business customers. You spend time on the sales floor, meeting first-time and current business customers and learning their needs. You generate new leads and build relationships, connecting over the phone or through in-store workshops and events. You discover customer needs through briefings and work with the Business Team to prepare and present proposals. For customers with more complex needs, you work with the entire Business Team to craft the ideal solutions. Finally, you inform and offer customers the complete suite of sales support options. By engaging customers to think about the possibilities of Apple technology in their businesses, you help build success - not only for your team, but for our customers as well.  Additional Requirements ‚Ä¢ You have experience selling in the business market. ‚Ä¢ You‚Äôre comfortable developing qualified leads by phone.‚Ä¢ You have strong people and presentation skills, and excellent written and verbal communication skills. ‚Ä¢ You‚Äôll need to be flexible with your schedule. Your work hours will be based on business needs. Role Number: 114438046

description: Summary Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. The people here at Apple don‚Äôt just craft products - they build the kind of wonder that ºs revolutionized entire industries. It‚Äôs the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it. Are you interested in being part of a team that continues to innovate the way people and machines interact? The launch of Siri was a defining moment in the history of Artificial Intelligence. Siri offers a faster, easier way to get things done on your Apple devices, even before you ask. Millions of people now use Siri to send messages, play their favorite song or even take a selfie. The AI/ML team is passionate about technology with a focus on enriching the customer experience. description: Description And RequirementsBMC helps customers run and reinvent their businesses in the digital age by tackling their IT management challenges, championing their innovation, and celebrating their success.Every BMC employee has the potential to have a tremendous impact on customer success‚Äîand when customers thrive, we all do.BMC offers bold and fearless career-seekers like you the opportunity to expand your skills, your network, and your horizons as you work to enable customer growth and innovation every day. You will be surrounded by peers who inspire you, drive you, support you, and make you laugh out loud, in an environment that fosters individuality, respect, and personal ambition.CUSTOMER VALUE SPECIALISTThe Customer Value Specialist (CVS) is a BMC specialist role responsible for driving customer adoption of BMC products and helping customers achieve successful outcomes. As a BMC product specialist, you will champion the capabilities of our products and know how specific BMC products enable value in customer organizations today, and in the future. It is an exciting customer facing role that puts you at the forefront of supporting our customers by inspiring them to think about how our products can support their broader business needs. You know how to solve the most tactical and strategic problems for your customers as well as identify opportunities for new use cases and expansion. You have methodical product use case orientation, with a focus on all thing‚Äôs adoption. You are the ‚Äúadvisor‚Äù able to support and guide our customers to be successful using our products.This role is a highly consultative role that does not perform implementation or configuration of solutions, but is the day-to-day contact to guide customer resources to maximize the adoption of BMC products and educating and enabling them on best practices that enable them to drive stronger and more engaged customer relationships through our products. This role interfaces with the customer across executive, IT service owner, enterprise architects and development teams throughout the customer journey: with an eye toward continuous customer advocacy and laser focus on helping customers adopt BMC products and achieve their business outcomes.To Achieve These Goals, The Mission Of Customer Value Specialist Team Will Be ToUltimately, the overarching goal of the Value Specialist is to ensure BMC customers achieve their stated business outcomes, realize value from their investments in BMC software and to fully adopt our products. For BMC to succeed, our customers need to succeed ‚Äì and the Value Specialist will be on the front lines of this mission.Raise the bar for the overall BMC customer experience through seamless, outcome-driven engagement throughout the customer journey ‚Äì with a focus on the user portion of that journeyBe the change agent force that continuously advocated for and on behalf of the customer, providing unbiased, actionable, customer-driven feedback to BMC product and sales leadershipProvide real-time visibility into the overall status and health of BMC‚Äôs customersMaintain a real time understanding of BMC‚Äôs customers and their adoption of our products Job ResponsibilitiesOverarching responsibilities and objectives of the role include the following:Driving adoption of BMC products & solutionsImproving overall customer experience throughout the customer journey, and delight our customers Cultivating, retaining & expanding BMC customer relationshipsTo deliver on those three overarching responsibilities, the Value Specialists must work with customers to:Demonstrate deep understanding of BMC products, core product features and use cases and their application within a customer‚Äôs complex environmentAbility to relate the product to value and expected customer outcomes in an easy-to-understand, implementable adoption plan that will help guide our customers to achieve those outcomes Identify customer adoption challenges, CSAT risks and other indicators of churn riskDevelop and manage remediation plans to alleviate customer challenges Demonstrate product features beyond central functionality to help customers achieve specific business results Develop and nurture trusted relationships with the customer Identify gaps (& opportunities) in the customer‚Äôs knowledge/utilization of BMC products consistent with their stated business goalsDevelop an approach to close gaps and roll into the customer value adoption plan, collaborating appropriately with the BMC sales and services team to identify and further vet expansion opportunities and pipeline that fits with our customer‚Äôs desired outcomes In addition to core customer-facing responsibilities above, Product Specialists must also:Track all engagement and touchpoints with accounts and provide continuous, unbiased intelligence on status of customer‚Äôs overall healthDemonstrate a solid appreciation for the implications of customer adoption on BMC Net Revenue Retention Rates (NRR)Capture and provide targeted feedback into the BMC R&D teams to ensure critical mass customer feedback on BMC solutions is appropriately addressed in future innovationChampion on behalf of the customer for product improvements and product advancements Competencies and Experience Needed for SuccessBachelor‚Äôs degree in technology-related field and prior experience with SaaS is ideal for this role Customer focused and demonstrable passion about customer success8+ years in customer-facing roles of progressing seniority, featuring a mix of technical complexity and enterprise architecture, influencing, program management, and execution skillsIdeally, roles/experience would have been focused in enterprise software or IT consulting: as a pre-sales consultant, technical account manager or customer success manager Proven ability to quickly understand customer‚Äôs business processes/context (Sales, Marketing, Services, Support), business applications and automation requirementsTechnical background in IT Service Management, Workload Automation and/or IT Operations Management solutions is a plus, though not requiredCapable project/program management skills with ability to synthesize customer success outcomes into well-structured adoption plans that description: Job DescriptionAt Zendesk, we get excited about building software that delivers the ultimate customer experience. Your favorite brands (like Airbnb, Uber, Slack, and Disney) use our products to engage you as a customer, and we lead the industry with breathtakingly simple software. And we‚Äôre constantly innovating ‚Äì no really, we can‚Äôt wait to outdo ourselves in the near future.About The TeamOn the mobile engineering teams, we power customer engagement in some of your favourite apps, via our SDK integrations, present in thousands of apps used by millions of users.We also deliver the best customer experience for agents using our Support, Chat apps, which enables delivering customer support and engagement on the go, as well as the Sell app that helps the salesperson to work on the move.Role DescriptionAt Zendesk, we truly believe that to build a great product you have to have great people.We enjoy working with other learning-focused people who care about both the customer and the code they write. We value collaboration, high-quality work and frequent releases. We like and use agile processes and believe that pragmatism always triumphs over dogmatism. We are all responsible for our product and enjoy the impact we have by improving it.As an engineer in our team, you will be responsible for designing, implementing and maintaining new features, making sure our stack is up to date and keeping our users happy. You will be deeply involved in the technical details of building robust user experiences and collaborate with other engineers, product managers, testers and designers.What we use: Swift, Core Data, SwiftLint, Native UITests, Github Workflows, Fastlane, Firebase, GitHub Actions, Twilio Programmable Voice SDKRequiredStrong Swift programming skillsCore Data skills or motivation to learn!Solid understanding of iOS developmentExperience writing Unit & Instrumentation testsInnate desire to ship things and make an impactHigh customer empathy and focus on the value delivered to clientsAbility to work with high autonomy and taking ownership of your workEagerness to learn tons of new thingsNice to haveObjective-C experience is welcomeWhat we offerA chance to work on products delivering real value to businessesOwnership of the projects you work onTeam of open-minded, experienced and helpful peopleOpportunity to learn in different ways -- development fund, book clubsWorking with leaders that care about youCompetitive salary and generous stock options programAnd Everything You Need To Do Your Job EffectivelyFlexible working hours.Professional development fundsComfortable office (currently fully-remote, but our team is working on the new office to be ready in 2021), daily catered breakfasts and lunches.Micha≈Ç Wƒôgrzyn is hiring for this position.At Zendesk, we believe that every great customer relationship stems from a conversation. So we built a customer service software company that designs solutions to foster better customer relationships. From large enterprises to startups, powerful, innovative customer experiences should be within reach for every company, no matter the size, industry or ambition. Zendesk serves more than 160,000 customers across a multitude of industries in over 30 languages. Zendesk is headquartered in San Francisco, and operates offices worldwide. Learn more at www.zendesk.com.We believe in service. Learn more about how we provide support to our local communities with volunteering, grants and product donations.Zendesk is an equal opportunity employer, and we‚Äôre proud of our ongoing efforts to foster global diversity, equity, & inclusion in the workplace. We are an AA/EEO/Veterans/Disabled employer. If you are based in the United States and would like more information about your EEO rights under the law, please click here.Zendesk endeavors to make reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities and disabled veterans pursuant to applicable federal and state law. If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to submit this application, complete any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participate in the employee selection process, please send an e-mail to benefits@zendesk.com with your specific accommodation request.By submitting your application, you agree that Zendesk may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. description: Summary Siri is always learning to speak new languages and provide a locally customized experience. Having worked on shipping products and being familiar with the rush to the finish line is helpful. Specific responsibilities will include: -  Engineering Natural Language Processing and Speech components specific to your language. -  Using the power of large amount of data to tackle sophisticated NLP and machine learning problems. -  Leading data annotation efforts and define language specific representations, conventions and techniques. -  Analyzing data and making data driven decisions to improve the localized user experience. -  Automating, scripting and integrating workflow from diverse systems.-  Providing insights and suggestions towards innovative new approaches and new product features tailored to your home market. -  Developing creative solutions to sophisticated issues. -  Interacting with other teams at Apple working towards the same goal; from Speech Recognition Specialists, Data Scientists and Speech Synthesis engineers.If this is you, we'd love to hear from you! Education & Experience B.S/MSc in Computer Science or related fields, or equivalent experience. Additional Requirements Apple‚Äôs most important resource, our soul, is our people. Apple benefits help further the well-being of our employees and their families in meaningful ways. No matter where you work at Apple, you can take advantage of our health and wellness resources and time-away programmes. We‚Äôre proud to provide stock grants to employees at all levels of the company, and we also give employees the option to buy Apple stock at a discount ‚Äî both offer everyone at Apple the chance to share in the company‚Äôs success. You‚Äôll discover many more benefits of working at Apple, such as programmes that match your charitable contributions, reimburse you for continuing your education and give you special employee pricing on Apple products. description: Job DescriptionThe JobThe Tax-Exempt Managing Director provides planning and consulting to Higher Education, HealthCare and other non-profit organizations in order to help them improve the value of their benefits program and ensure their satisfaction with Fidelity.The TeamAs a Managing Director in TEM you will be responsible for building, maintaining and growing strong and committed client relationships with key decision makers, influencers and C- suite committee members. The Book-of-Business will be comprised of clients with a range of complexities, challenges, and opportunities. The Book-of-Business is in our Core Market focused in the Southwest and West and will consist of ~ 25-30 clients with asset size ranging from $25M - $100M. The role is a consultative role, requiring a clear understanding of the business needs and relevant challenges of each client. Client loyalty is developed by seeking feedback, anticipating needs and proactively providing solutions.This role leads and collaborates with an internal team of service-based associates and partners across the organization to resolve client problems and offer solutions for client needs. Together with your internal teams and partnering with the Plan Sponsors, you will help our institutional clients lead a successful benefits program to improve their employees‚Äô overall wellbeing.Licensing and ExperienceWe require associates in this role to have their Series 7 & 63 licensesWe prefer associates to have 7-10 years of Participant or Client Service experience, preferably within the Retirement.Experience working directly with Tax-Exempt Plan Sponsors and Participants is helpful, but not required.Key responsibilitiesEngages key decision makers and advisors/consultants frequently to develop a deeper understanding of client needs and opportunities.Monitors trends impacting client satisfaction within own book of business. Summarizes and communicates to others as needed; develops a response plan to maintain or improve client satisfaction.Maintains proactive awareness of changes in the client's business, their competition, industry, and marketplace, through proactive solicitation and/or research, in order to influence and impact client satisfaction within a book of business.Responsible for external business planning and service reviews to be sure we understand client's goals and objectives. Appropriately position products and services that will help the client achieve their overall benefits goals.Works with consultants on inbound inquiries, plan sponsor presentations, plan design, product, technology, customer concerns, fund changes, revenue requirements, pricing negotiations, Fidelity thought leadership, plan analytics, etc.Frequently works with consultants as appropriate to prepare for client meetings and follows up on Fidelity commitments post client meetings.In partnership with Consultant Relations, builds productive long-term relationships with consultants and/or advisors.Develops and maintains collaborative relationships across a broad spectrum of business partners to drive operational accuracy, efficiency, and problem resolution. Leads internal team in problem resolution.CertificationsSeries 07 - FINRA, Series 63 - FINRACompany OverviewAt Fidelity, we are focused on making our financial expertise broadly accessible and effective in helping people live the lives they want. We are a privately held company that places a high degree of value in creating and nurturing a work environment that attracts the best talent and reflects our commitment to our associates. We are proud of our diverse and inclusive workplace where we respect and value our associates for their unique perspectives and experiences. Find your Fidelity at fidelitycareers.com.Fidelity Investments is an equal opportunity employer.We believe that the most effective way to attract, develop and retain a diverse workforce is to build an enduring culture of inclusion and belonging.Fidelity will reasonably accommodate applicants with disabilities who need adjustments to participate in the application or interview process. To initiate a request for an accommodation, contact the HR Leave of Absence/Accommodation Team by sending an email to accommodations @fmr.com, or by calling 800-835-5099, prompt 2, option 2.

description: Summary Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. The people here at Apple don‚Äôt just craft products - they build the kind of wonder that ºs revolutionized entire industries. It‚Äôs the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it. Are you interested in being part of a team that continues to innovate the way people and machines interact? The launch of Siri was a defining moment in the history of Artificial Intelligence. Siri offers a faster, easier way to get things done on your Apple devices, even before you ask. Millions of people now use Siri to send messages, play their favorite song or even take a selfie. The AI/ML team is passionate about technology with a focus on enriching the customer experience. We are looking for a motivated Annotation Analyst that demonstrates active listening, integrity, acute attention to detail, and is passionate about impacting our customer's experience. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. This position will be based in Barcelona. Key Qualifications Fluency in  the Norwegian language with excellent comprehension, grammar and proofreading skillsExcellent English reading comprehension and writing skillsHighly organized with strong attention to detailExcellent active listening skills with the ability to understand verbal nuances in Norwegian dialect, including the variations across different provinces and territories.Demonstrates attention to detail and critical thinking skills in evaluation of Siri‚Äôs language usage and dialectAbility to independently navigate systems and toolsDemonstrates integrity and focuses on customer privacyExperience in content review or a similar environment, prior testing experience preferredDemonstrates flexibility and adaptability to changing work-flows and responsibilitiesGrows with a team where expertise is shared and feedback is welcomedExcels at working independently to make timely decisions and take appropriate actionsExperience as an end user of Siri, similar Intelligent Personal Assistants, or other AISuccessfully meets or exceeds targets, working within tight deadlines Ability to identify business process solutions that increase efficienciesAbility to maintain focus and aim for high results through large volumes of tasks Description Our team is comprised of very talented individuals, who are passionate about AI/ML and ensuring Apple services are at their best. As part of the Annotation Team you'll play a central role in enhancing the user experience. We work in a fast paced, dynamic, technology focused environment. As an Annotation Analyst, you'll listen and transcribe audio files and evaluate Siri‚Äôs response and language usage, from customers who have opted in to the grading program. You'll use your language and cultural knowledge, along with analytical skills, to evaluate responses against guidelines. Your flexibility and the ability to prioritize tasks is essential. We focus on the user experience, thinking creatively on how customers use Siri and use this knowledge for improvements.Because we believe our individual backgrounds, perspectives, and passions help us build the ideas that move all of us forward. We'll train you to be an expert in understanding, supporting and improving the customer experience. This position comes with competitive pay, great benefits, eligibility to participate in our company stock plan, time off, and employee discount. We are seeking applicants with fluency in the Norwegian language. Education & Experience Bachelors degree or equivalent work experience preferred Additional Requirements Ability to work Monday- Friday on a full-time basis; with scheduling and work flexibility based on business needs Positions with language skills require strong grammar and cultural awareness Successful completion of a pre-employment assessment and background checkSuccessful completion of initial training and certification testing Role Number: 200240417

description: Summary The people here at Apple don‚Äôt just build products ‚Äî they craft the kind of wonder that‚Äôs revolutionized entire industries. It‚Äôs the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it. Apple‚Äôs Sales organization generates the revenue needed to fuel our ongoing development of products and services. This in turn, enriches the lives of hundreds of millions of people around the world. Our sales team, is in many ways, the face of Apple to our largest customers. The Country Manager will be responsible for ensuring the Spanish organisation operates as one single collaborative team across all routes to market and functions. This collaboration should craft the foundation for the Spanish business to build and strengthen the Apple team with the clear goal of significantly growing the business. This requires strong sales leadership skills and the ability to inspire and motivate sales teams across all levels. The focus will be to formulate the growth objectives and strategies for success for the consumer and enterprise portions of the business within Spain ensuring that the team delivers against these objectives.The role requires critical thinking, a deep understanding of what it means to be the custodian of a brand, a real passion for being a market leader and to be evangelical about delivering a superlative experience to customers, across market segments, whilst always thinking about what is next. Key Qualifications Successful leader with multi-channel management experience, including channel development skills at the scale Apple needsYou should be able to create and communicate a vision of where Apple can grow and expand its revenue and market shares across all channelsStrong attention to detailYou'll have the intellectual capability to analyse new opportunities in the marketProven effective relationship builder within a matrix environment at regional, local and WW levelsStrong leadership and people management skills, you should be a strong leader who has the ability to motivate a substantial teamExcellent written and verbal communication skills. This includes enabling effective partnerships across Apple (WW Training, Product Marketing, Sales Leaders etc.)Solid understanding of fundamental Spanish law implications in key areas such as labor, competition or copy right as well as regulatory principles in SpainFluency in Spanish and English is essential Description You will be directly managing and developing the Retail, Telco, Enterprise and Education businesses within Spain and and work in close coordination with the South Europe SP&O and business planning teams. You'll be a part of the Southern Region management team and engage on ad hoc projects to support the regional business and be involved in the following:- Provide inspiration to the teams and present a vision of where the country needs to develop to maximise the opportunity for Apple- Recruits and develops the high calibre and diverse talent needed to provide for Apple‚Äôs future success- Development of appropriate go to market strategies to drive the consumer, enterprise and education sales objectives for the country and owning key relationships with partners in the country- Review the organisational models within the country ensuring we are best set up to maximise the growth opportunities in Spain- Oversee the Spanish country plan to ensure that all routes to market are integrated into a single vision of growth for Spain- Single point of coordination for collaboration across all functions of Apple to align resources to support the growth strategies, and acts as the face of Apple when required- Tightly partner and collaborate with the entire Apple Spain team to seamlessly engage the Spanish customer base maximising the market impact for Apple.- Drive the Education business in Spain with the local Education team- Help drive the ‚Äúone Apple‚Äù approach building relationships across the key components of Apple for successful collaboration- Take the leadership role where there are other functions in country- Own the country forecast across all products and routes to market- Ownership of the goals and objectives for the country across all Lines of business and the development of Apple‚Äôs business in the country owning the tactical execution- Drive the right activities to ensure that channel partners achieve the sales objectivesAdditional activities: - Propose channel strategies and ensure execution to drive growth across all lines of business in Spain - Ensure that the quality of programs are executed within Apple standards and guidelines- Develop the local channel organisation and the people within it, to deliver a world-class channel management function- Handle all internal processes, including budgeting, forecasting, business reviews to the timelines defined by the WW and EMEIA functions- Ensure best collaboration and communication across all functions in the country.- Build relationships with key resellers, customers, retailers and carriers where appropriate- Support the ongoing development of Apple‚Äôs key channel programs- Coach and develop the teams beneath them to create a strong bench for succession planning and personal career development for their teams- Identify new opportunities for growth in Spain and the regional organisation and propose strategies to maximise these opportunities- Leadership, ongoing development and attraction of top talent with in-depth functional expertise- Work with central European and WW teams to develop relationships and collaboration that supports the growth within their regions- Ensure the teams achieve and exceed their goals through setting up standard methodology and aligning with corporate objectives- Liaise with Operations in Cork on all logistics questions for the territory Education & Experience You will have an MBA from a leading business school and/or a primary business degree from a top-tier university.Apple is an Equal Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities. Apple will not discriminate or retaliate against applicants who inquire about, disclose, or discuss their compensation or that of other applicants. Additional Requirements Key Performance Indicators:- Creation of a clear Spain country plan with all the contributors across the Spanish business- Achievement of quarterly and annual targets (own, teams and channel)- Quality and accuracy of sales forecasting on an ongoing basis- Success of managing, developing and evolving the structure of the channels to drive long term growth in the business across all products and routes to market- Quality of management reporting, relationship building and leveraging of resources across the Apple matrix- Maintenance of cost control within the European and local framework- Strong team development and recognition of their teams as leaders in their own rightKey Relationships:- Country sales support teams- Regional Telco, Retail and New Initiatives Sales Directors- Country functional heads, Finance, Legal, HR, PR, CC&D, Sales Planning & Operations, AppleCare (post-sales support), Services, Apple Online Store/Apple Retail Store teams in Spain- Sales support- Business and Distribution partners- Central functions, Product Marketing, Business Development, Marcom, Retail, Telco, New Initiatives, SP&O, Enterprise- Other Country leads and Country Managers- Representing Apple to inter-trade organisations in Spain as applicableWe promote innovation and new technology to further improve our creative output. Dynamic people and inspiring, innovative technologies are the norm here. You'll lead an extraordinary team. We're looking for a talented and passionate person to join this amazing team. If you feel this is you, we'd love to hear from you. Role Number: 200242987

description: Summary Come and join the the team in Barcelona that teaches Siri how to understand and speak new languages. We are an extremely diverse and passionate group, dedicated to making Siri the best worldwide digital assistant. We are looking for a highly motivated annotation projects lead, with a high sensibility for foreign languages and cultures, to help us drive the quality of our Siri deliverables. Key Qualifications Native language proficiency and cultural awareness of Brazilian Portuguese and ability to work in an English speaking environment.Technical leadership and/or project management skills, with cross-functional experience.Proficient and highly accurate on annotation projects with a minimum of 1 year experience.Motivation for informing accuracy metrics and processes.Flexibility to respond and react to changing priorities quickly and efficiently.Ability to understand and prioritize tasks and issues.Highly organized with attention to detail and a commitment to quality.Outstanding communication skills.Desired (but not required): technical engineering, data science or machine learning background Description As the Siri International curation lead for your language, you will be responsible for the supervision of annotation projects that will shape the natural language models that enable Siri. You will be required to interact with several world class teams of experts at Apple, and to periodically report accuracy metrics that speak to the quality of Siri.We are looking for demonstrated ability to be creative, take ownership of a project, and a knack for solving problems that stump most accuracy improvement projects. This is an opportunity to durably shape the future of human - computer interaction, and walk the state-of-the-art of a nascent field.Specific responsibilities will include:- Drive and supervise natural language curation tasks and team sync-ups.- Report and own language specific accuracy metrics.- Track documentation for natural language conventions and processes.- Review other team members work and provide feedback.- Support trainees and annotations team during their training phase.- Deliver hands-on data annotation tasks.- Track, analyze, and report systematic issue to QA. Education & Experience B.A. or B.S. degree preferred, or experience in related fields Role Number: 200220524

Key Qualifications Fluency in  the Belgian French language with excellent comprehension, grammar and proofreading skillsExcellent English reading comprehension and writing skillsHighly organized with strong attention to detailExcellent active listening skills with the ability to understand verbal nuances in Belgian French dialect, including the variations across different provinces and territories.Demonstrates attention to detail and critical thinking skills in evaluation of Siri‚Äôs language usage and dialectAbility to independently navigate systems and toolsDemonstrates integrity and focuses on customer privacyExperience in content review or a similar environment, prior testing experience preferredDemonstrates flexibility and adaptability to changing work-flows and responsibilitiesGrows with a team where expertise is shared and feedback is welcomedExcels at working independently to make timely decisions and take appropriate actionsExperience as an end user of Siri, similar Intelligent Personal Assistants, or other AISuccessfully meets or exceeds targets, working within tight deadlines Ability to identify business process solutions that increase efficienciesAbility to maintain focus and aim for high results through large volumes of tasksMinimum 3 years experience is preferable in Belgium Description Our team is comprised of very talented individuals, who are passionate about AI/ML and ensuring Apple services are at their best. As part of the Annotation Team you'll play a central role in enhancing the user experience. We work in a fast paced, dynamic, technology focused environment. As an Annotation Analyst, you'll listen and transcribe audio files and evaluate Siri‚Äôs response and language usage, from customers who have opted in to the grading program. You'll use your language and cultural knowledge, along with analytical skills, to evaluate responses against guidelines. Your flexibility and the ability to prioritize tasks is essential. We focus on the user experience, thinking creatively on how customers use Siri and use this knowledge for improvements.Because we believe our individual backgrounds, perspectives, and passions help us build the ideas that move all of us forward. We'll train you to be an expert in understanding, supporting and improving the customer experience. This position comes with competitive pay, great benefits, eligibility to participate in our company stock plan, time off, and employee discount. We are seeking applicants with fluency in the French language. Education & Experience Bachelors degree or equivalent work experience preferred Additional Requirements Ability to work Monday- Friday on a full-time basis; with scheduling and work flexibility based on business needs Positions with language skills require strong grammar and cultural awareness Successful completion of a pre-employment assessment and background checkSuccessful completion of initial training and certification testing Role Number: 200215504

description: We are looking for an ambassador of the brand and the property as General Manager, where your leadership, strong interpersonal skills and strategic vision will drive an engaged team, guest satisfaction and maximized operating results.You will be responsible for supervising and coordinating the activity at the Hotel Ibis Styles Sevilla, from a commercial, social, financial and technical standpoint, according to standards and regulations. The hotel is franchised and belongs to a leader in the hotel and thalassotherapy industry in Europe - with 82 hotels, and this will be the 2^nd hotel of the Company in Spain.You will bring your strong commercial and business acumen, and tenacity to drive the top line to exceed targets, and to boost the F&B concept.You will carry out your mission independently, following the strategy defined by the Company. You are responsible for the innovation and renewal of the establishment's service offerings.This position will report directly to an Operations Director.What Is In It For YouTake your career to the next level and take part in the opening of a brand new centric hotel, just next to the Santa Justa train station in downtown Seville:218 roomsGround floor snack bar with an Andalusian patio, with 174 spotsIncredible rooftop bar with a pool and cocktails service (136 spots)Meetings & fitness roomsYou Will Be Responsible ForClient / Commercial: You will ensure the best quality of service and ensure that you meet customer expectations by translating the Ibis Styles state of mind in the field. You will perpetuate and develop our leadership built on the leisure market, with very good interpersonal skills, you are an excellent salesperson, having the HEARTIST spirit and showing creativity and seeking customers in order to develop turnover. You will optimize RevPAR through the day-to-day management of distribution by optimizing the various sales channels. You transmit to the teams a sales spirit by constantly stimulating them and are a force of proposal on all marketable offers.Team management / cross-functional involvement:You lead a team and implement the Ibis Styles brand strategy, in order to achieve the objectives of quality of service, and profitability of all services.You transmit the HEARTIST state of mind to employees through proximity, friendliness and transversality management and ensure that these principles are properly translated by employees, among themselves and to customers. better level of skills and support them in their professional development.You guarantee compliance with labor legislation by keeping you informed of developments in labor law.Business / production technique: You guarantee the quality of the Accommodation and Catering offers You are responsible for relations with suppliers and subcontractors, and ensure the adequacy of their services with the objectives of quality and profitability You stimulate a work dynamic based on permanent innovation and transversal projects.Management: You optimize organizations and staff adequacy. You realize the sales and expense budgets, and analyze them monthly as part of the reporting You ensure the implementation and proper monitoring of the procedures set by the Company and AccorHealth / Personal safety / Environment: You ensure the application of the rules of law, health and safety, and represent the company.What You To Bring To The Table You are above all an experienced Manager to unite your team around a collective and ambitious project, in the search for the achievement of quality and economic objectives. The success of the mission requires a strong customer orientation, human qualities of listening and pedagogy, as well as an exemplary behavior source of credibility. Your managerial skills are essential to make the establishment sustainable. Your sense of responsibility and commitment combined with your interpersonal skills will allow you to succeed and flourish in a developing company, anchored in its human values. Fluent in Spanish and French - all reports and communications with the Company will mainly be done in the French language. English is a plus.Our Commitment To Diversity & InclusionWe are an inclusive company and our ambition is to attract, recruit and promote diverse talent.Why work for an Accor brand?We are far more than a worldwide leader. We welcome you as you are and you can find a job and brand that matches your personality. We support you to grow and learn every day, making sure that work brings purpose to your life, so that during your journey with us, you can continue to explore Accor‚Äôs limitless possibilities.By joining Accor, every chapter of your story is yours to write and together we can imagine tomorrow's hospitality. Discover the life that awaits you at Accor, visit https://careers.accor.com/Do what you love, care for the world, dare to challenge the status quo! #BELIMITLESS

description: Company DescriptionOur mission is to build cultures of innovation at companies by transforming the way they work, by modernising their IT infrastructure & apps, and by elevating their customer experiences. As a Premier Google Cloud partner, we do this by implementing innovative Google Cloud solutions and by leveraging cutting-edge AI & Machine Learning technologies.Devoteam G Cloud‚Äôs certified Cloud engineers build disruptive solutions on Google Cloud Platform to give organisations a competitive advantage. We migrate and modernise legacy applications & IT infrastructure using Cloud Native solutions such as Kubernetes, Anthos and Serverless solutions.We help our customers with their hybrid- and multi-Cloud strategies and to get to actionable business insights faster, by accelerating their data & analytics. Together we create scalable, future-proof & secure data journeys. And we build AI & ML solutions on top of this data to help customers to create better customer experiences. Next to that, we give the workplace of the future shape with solutions like Google Workspace.Job DescriptionAbout the role: With a team of Cloud Architects and Google Cloud infrastructure Engineers you will work on implementing infrastures as well as migration projects to facilitate and accelerate customer solutions on Google Cloud. You will engineer the aforementioned solutions based on given requirements and best practices while you are not afraid to challenge bad practice and provide alternatives when necessary.What we are looking for: Hands on working experience with at least one hypervisition/virtualisation solution such as vmware or alternatively, hands-on experience with kubernetes is required.Proven experience working as either an SRE or an infrastructure engineer. Hands-on experience with a minimum one IaC solution such as Terraform is required. Knowledge of best practices when it comes to security and governance of a complex infrastructure system You know how to write properly documented and tested codeExperience with shell scripting is requiredKnowledge of of Docker is required Degree in Computer Science or EngineeringLifelong learning attitude Nice to have: Knowledge of setting up networking solutions in Google cloud is a big plusHands on experience with Istio is also a big plusKnowledge of Anthos Have experience in Google Cloud Knowledge of migration of on-premise server or virtual machines to a public cloud solutionHands on experience setting up a CI/CD pipeline and software lifecycle management solutions What we have to offer:An exciting job where innovation in technology is not a buzzword but a realityContinuous training & development of soft- and hard skills, including training at several Google locationsA competitive salary, inline with your profile Additional benefitsAn awesome team of colleagues & regular team building activitiesA "Googley" well-equipped office in AmsterdamThe ability to work with the world‚Äôs leading companies in technology and innovation

description: Change the Future with Us! Netsuite Account Executive - Nordics - MalagaAbout Oracle NetSuite: Oracle NetSuite is the world's leading provider of cloud-based business management software. NetSuite helps companies manage core business processes with a single, fully integrated system covering ERP/Financials, CRM, E-commerce, Inventory and more.Working at Oracle NetSuitePicture yourself building a successful career at Oracle NetSuite‚Äîworking alongside talented, driven individuals to help fast-growing, mid-size organizations and large enterprises achieve their business goals with the world‚Äôs #1 cloud-based business management suite, including ERP, Financials, CRM, E-commerce and PSA. This job will relocate you to London.One word: TransformationAt Oracle NetSuite, we believe the cloud is here to stay and so do our 20,000+ customers. We believe businesses should not be bogged down by the overhead of bulky data centers and expensive personnel to run it all. Businesses need to be lean, efficient and agile. Oracle NetSuite is literally transforming business around the globe by providing a cloud-based, unified system that delivers unprecedented capabilities to drive business forward. Founded in 1998 as THE cloud ERP pioneer, today NetSuite has transformed the business operations of our customers without the high costs and inefficiency of on-premises systems. Transform your career at NetSuiteWe work hard and we work smart. We hire fierce competitors. We hire individuals that are fearless trail blazers. Oracle NetSuite employees take the hill, we prefer action over inaction, we are tireless in our mission and we pause only to celebrate our success. And we DO celebrate, because if you don‚Äôt have fun along the way, then what‚Äôs the point? Oracle NetSuite is transforming how its customers do business. If you want to transform your career, APPLY NOW. We are looking for Netsuite Account Executives for our HUB in MalagaIn this role you will be responsible for selling Oracle‚Äôs next generation of Cloud Applications. ¬∑ You are a self-starter, You are customer focused¬∑ You are smart, social media savvy, digitally responsive¬∑ As an Netsuite Account Executive, you will engage with prospect organizations to position Oracle‚Äôs Cloud solutions through Challenger based selling, business case creation, Customer references and analyst data¬∑ You are the owner of your territory and customer relationships¬∑ You have customer success as your top priority¬∑ You manage the end to end sales process through engagement of appropriate resources such as Pre Sales experts, Oracle Consulting Services, Oracle‚Äôs Executives and our global Partner network¬∑ You generate short term results as well as maintaining a long term perspective for your accounts in your territory to maximize revenue generation¬∑ You will ensure daily update of the Oracle Sales Cloud with accurate customer and pipeline data We can accelerate your career by combining your potential and skills with the training that Oracle provides to become an outstanding sales representative and partner to our customers. Due to our Cloud growth and increasing demand for our Cloud services, we are looking to increase our Netsuite sales force and we offer a diverse set of opportunities for all levels of experience.We want to talk to people from all walks of life and levels of experience including if you are working in either finance, supply chain or sales:You have a strong personal drive and ambition to be successfulYou are a recent graduate with a genuine interest in cloud and technologyYou are smart and you have some software, technology or cloud sales experienceYou are an experienced sales representative looking for the next step in your career selling cloud solutions into industry segments. Our customers are central to everything we do at Oracle Netsuite, so we are keen to hear from people who see customer success as their top priority.We value effective communicators and strong team players who can understand the needs of senior level decision makers. Our sales representatives build credible relationships with multiple customer stakeholders, recognize their business and industry challenges and demonstrate value to them.We seek self motivated individuals who thrive on change and problem solving. Everyday is different at Oracle and we are looking for people who enjoy innovating and working in an agile environment. Some travel may be required for face to face customer visits and you would need to be eligible to work in the country of hire.Fluency in Danish or Swedish or Norwegian required

description: 21 Century LawyersLegal Army is an Alternative Legal Services Provider (ALSP). We believe that there is a better way to provide legal services by reducing their cost by up to 80%, adapting to a new client who is much more demanding and focused on developing their business with maximum legal security without paying the tolls of structures and processes of another era. Our corporate organization seeks the welfare of lawyers and the satisfaction of our clients, attracting the best legal talent.We use the best technology to automate works that do not require legal qualification reducing your costs drastically without losing an apex of excellence.This is NewLaw, This is Legal Army.What we need:EU qualified lawyerS.2 Lawyers: 5 and 8+ years PQE as a combination of experience inside a multinational company and/or a top-tier law firm deeply specialized in IT/IP, Privacy and Commercial Law.and commercial contracting law, preferably in a law firm.Master degree in IP/IT, New Technologies, Privacy is required.Proven experience in IP/IT tasks such as contracting, licensing,registration of trademarks and other Intellectual Property assets,specially in the digital environment.Proven experience in drafting commercial contracts and givinglegal advice for new economy business.Passionate for exponential technologies such as AI and new business models: fintech, e-health, data & analytics, insurtech, e-commerce and a deep knowledge of Adtech ecosystem and programmatic advertising, cookies, IAB TCF and CMP‚Äôs.Proven experience conducting GDPR adaptations and audits,acting as DPO (CIPP-E is highly desirable), PIA‚Äôs, DPIA‚Äôs, givingspecialized advice for the creation of services and products basedon Privacy by Design principle.Spanish native, English bilingual or minimum C1 level (a test willbe conducted during the interview). Full command of other languages (French, German and /or Portuguese) would be a dream for us.Team player and hard-worker, can-do attitude, excellent communications skills, creative and strategic thinking is mandatory.Ability to work efficiently, prioritize workflow, meet demanding deadlines, manage multiple projects are of the essence. We are looking for extremely efficient lawyers, with the ability to manage several clients at the time and business oriented.Not only a hard worker but being a nice person and being a teamplayer is mandatory.What we offer:Clear and transparent compensation plan.Personal training budget: up to 1.000 ‚Ç¨ per year (certifications, courses, etc).Madrid central location.You will deal with top tier clients directly from the first day.Your career plan in Legal Army has no limits. To the infinity and beyond!Happy Fridays: whether you accomplish your weekly objectives, you can take Friday afternoon free.Enjoy your Birthday: take your birthday off to celebrate.Great work-life balance: we offer a flexible work schedule and will do our best to adapt to your personal situation.Cool company tools: we love Mac but, okey, sometimes our lawyers prefer PC so you can choose.People. Work with cool mates.Uncommon, unusual and modern work environment (including a swimming pool!).We're diverse so we love diversity: personality and opinions of each of our team members are important and valid, and we aim to offer all employees a safe environment where they can be themselves. We highly prefer sneakers and jeans but suits and heeled shoes are welcome in special occasions such as weddings.

If you're passionate about working flexibly with leading Fortune 500 brands and innovative Silicon Valley startups, Toptal could be a great fit for your next career shift.Toptal is an elite talent network for the world's top 3% of developers, connecting the best and brightest freelancers with top organizations. description: ¬°Hola!Si eres un aficionado al mundo del motor, seguro que ya has o√≠do hablar de nosotros. Seguro que sabes que somos m√°s de 470 profesionales de la automoci√≥n en Espa√±a y Portugal y que implantamos las mejores soluciones de negocio para nuestros clientes. Sabr√°s que nos quieren por nuestra calidad, innovaci√≥n y experiencia, la cual se remonta ya a m√°s de 25 a√±os. Y si no sab√≠as nada de esto, lo mejor es que ya conoces lo buenos que somos. We leverage data to make great spaces and communities.The essence of cities is bringing people ‚Äîfrom all walks of life‚Äî together in one place. Social interaction and a robust mixing of people from different backgrounds, of different ages, with different incomes and interests is the secret sauce that enables progress and creates opportunity. Citiscope provides real-time data and contextual intelligence about the social life in urban settings so you can create places where people thrive.Citiscope is looking for a project manager to be responsible for planning and executing multiple projects and driving them through their entire life cycle while coordinating with internal business leaders and clients. The work is fluid and continually changing or evolving to deliver on the needs of our clients. This includes researching API's, developing sample reports, liaising with software developers, liaising with clients to understand their data needs, and coordinating the efforts of team members and third-party contractors or consultants to deliver projects according to plan. This is a client-facing position with a high level of responsibility. You will be coordinating across companies to ensure smooth completion of project deliverables. This role will demonstrate leadership, teamwork and relationship building. This role ensures that project scope changes and risks are resolved, mitigated and/or escalated in a timely fashion. The successful candidate must be able to balance the needs of many competing clients and must be able to work on several projects at the same time.Responsibilities IncludeLead multiple project simultaneously through the entire project life cycleAct independently and judiciously to ensure that your projects are completed within scope, on time, and on budget whenever possibleAdhere to best practices with internal/external teamsClearly communicate project timelines, including milestones, deadlines and deliverablesCo-develop (with team members) project timelines, and monitor and adjust them as necessary while communicating with the team members and the client as changes occurFacilitate communication between yourself and all internal and external stakeholders in order to maintain good client relationsLead and facilitate effective project meetings, take meeting notes, and clearly communicate those notes back to the project team at the end of the meetingsProvide status updates and time trackingManaging, facilitating and guiding cross-functional teams, including creative and technical resourcesWork effectively with outside vendors as needed, to make sure they are working efficiently and effectively to deliver on-time and on or under budgetProvide feedback and coaching to team members, including ability to establish and build healthy working relations and partnerships with project teams, and other project stakeholders.Provide regular reporting and updates on the projects.In order to succeed, youAre able to work in a fast-paced environment with a number of partners.Have proven track record and more than 5 year experience in managing complex IT application projects. This includes understanding the business case, business requirements, IT project model and methodology and ability to manage the vendors who deliver the technical solution.Have good understanding of Data platform, Business warehouse and Business intelligent solutions as well as overall IT enterprise architecture.Have strong overall IT knowledge and mindset to provide modern IT solutions and servicesHave good collaboration skills and you are open to change.Are fluent in English.Have an appropriate degree.Are based in Vigo or willing to move to Galicia.
